text: 12oz bottle. Clear amber with an inch of off white foam. Nose of malt and caramel balanced with light hops. Flavors are toffee, toast, floral hops and bread. Zesty mouthfeel with persistent carbonation. Fresh, clean finish but with a light lingering malt sweetness. Long time favorite.

Butelka 355ml BARWA: głęboki złoty odcień, idealnie klarowne. PIANA: biała, obfita, drobno pęcherzykowa, szybko się dziurawi i opadaja do cienkiego krążka. AROMAT: zbożowo-ciasteczkowy z nutą karmelową, delikatnie drewniany aromat SMAK: słodowość, przełamania dość wyraźną ziołową goryczk, ściąga boki jezyka, dość długo się utrzymuje, wytrawny finisz. Średnio pełne z wysyceniem średnio wysokim. Jeżeli chodzi o styl to trochę nuda, w dobie ciekawych aromatycznych chmieli niczym nie zaskakuje, nie moja bajka.

Ive crossed paths with Anchor Steam many many times in my beer drinking career yet never imbibed it. In my experience it is often considered a good beer by people of dubious tastes, so I was never inspired to drink it. When a few bottles ended up in my fridge, I thought I should finally give it a fair chance. It pours a clear copper hue with a lovely, frothy head. So far so good. The smell is refreshing, mineral, yet somewhat cheap. Ocean breeze, fresh oysters  am I being influenced by the label, the San Francisco name? It does take me back to walking down the Embarcadero on a sunny day, breathing in the fresh Pacific air. Mild malts and hops appear on the nose, but feel watered down. Citrusy, slightly grassy notes, not offensive. On the palate its again quite mineral, a very watery flavor. Cheap malts are the main attraction, with a lightly roasted coffee flavor, and a twist of piney hops. Unlike its hometown, theres not a whole lot to see. The finish is mildly bitter with subtle chocolatey flavors and cranberry. Leaves a slightly funky flavor in the mouth, which, on the bright side, makes you want to wash it down with some of that early minerality. Overall, this is a bland brew. Simple but not in a good way. If Im at a regular bar in the US, Ill take a Blue Moon over this any day. I was hoping to be surprised, but unfortunately, Anchor Steam lived up to my very low expectations.
orange to amber colour, large, slightly yellowish creamy off-white head; aroma and taste of grains, floral-honey, caramel and metallic notes; ok beer, nothing more
Good beer. Mellow but bold at the same time. Bold mellow. Good pallate of flavors. It really does taste like a beer you should drink out at sea

AROMA: brown/muscovado sugar and dates. Kinda yum. ***** APPEARANCE: perfect head, good colour, cant say anything so a 5. ***** TASTE: honey and pears, dates kind of merge into them. Honestly good. Very unexpected but goooooooood. If thats what American stands in American lager, that country may have hope after all. ***** PALATE: strong carbonation with dried dates is oddddd but its nothing special or noteworthy. Barely any dryness, very neutral, I dig that. ***** OVERALL: unexpected but great. Like it a lot.

Fruity aroma, with some breadiness. Deep amber colour with hardly any head. Highly carbonated. The taste comes on very hoppy, although not a pine/citrus IPA-style explosion. More subtle than that. Malt breadiness also comes through, especially at the very end. Not one of my go-to beers, but I enjoy it.

Pours amber from the bottle and leaves a frothy, finger-thick crown. Aroma is honey, fresh bandage, with a lightly floral note.Taste is lightly bittersweet with a subtle berry undertone. Noticeable caramel as well. Wonderful is the palate - robust, smooth, creamy with a nicely balanced carbonation. It really makes the beer. All in all simple yet scrumptious. Drank this once years ago but didnt remember much. Wish Id gotten back to it sooner. A real pleasure to drink.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
2016 catch up - Bottle at home - It was beer. Not much else to say. A bit like a best bitter and I can get those at a much better price than this.

Beer served in 10°C, Nonic Glass. Pours ruby, reddish dark amber, clear, with two finger and thick head. Aroma of sweet, wet malts. Malty creamy taste with hints of bread, earth, dirt, stable, smoke and not so bitter hops. Easy drinkable and unique.

From Freistädter; orange golden with big white head; aroma is malty, fruity, herbal hops; taste is fruity, malty grainy with low sweetness, dry hoppy medium bitter finish with lingering bitterness; texture is creamy with medium carbonation and a rather thin body
0,3l bottle. Nose: piny, oily, resin. Taste: caramel, piny hopp bitterness, pleasant sweetness. Classic and always nice.

From bottle in shaker. Pours deep amber with one finger frothy head. Aroma is lager-esque with notes of fruit bread. Taste starts with smooth daramel malt and finishes with a bit of orange peel bitterness. This was a gateway beer for me into the craft beer world a quarter of a century ago (along with SNPA). Nice to revisit.

Bottle. Clear amber gold colour. Medium creamy off-white head. Fairly lively carbonation. Very Malty; toasty malts, bready, caramel. Citrus fruity, orange. Mildly spicy. Moderately hoppy, floral hops. Nice malt/fruit/hop balance. Sweet malty fruity throughout. Dry finish. Pleasant easy drinking beer. (2017-04)

12 ounce bottle. Cant believe I never rated this before. Nice Amber orange pour. Firm, rocky beige head leaves nice clinging lace. Sweet fruity malt nose has hints of brown sugar and baked bread. Mild earthy toasted malt flavor has sweet and spicy notes. Some hop bitterness in finish offers a nice balance. Crisp dry bitter aftertaste. Still tasty after all these years.

Slightly hazy to mostly clear amber color with a blanketing head of sudsy white foam. Light caramel malt and grain base cut by spicy and dry woodsy hops. Crisp, crushable, but with a bite. Very Californian, very good.

0.33l bottle. Malty aroma, hopy notes, light caramel, grassy, bready. Hazy amber color, white head. Malty taste, light hopy notes, caramel and grass, medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation and light caramel, bitter finish. Very good.
Pours clear copper with frothy off-white head. Aroma is light fruity, caramel malts. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Light body, average carbonation. Great session beer.
Excellent aroma, beautiful amber color, dry semi bitter palate, complex sour flavoring, malty and spicy, a different experience

From bottle. Pours a light amber with an off-white head. The aroma is moderately malty with caramel and bready notes and lightly hoppy. Medium creamy body, well balanced with a low to carbonation, a light to medium bitterness and a light malty sweetness. The taste is solid malty again caramel and bread with a nice but not dominant hop presence. Nearly fruity peach notes go along with some earthy herbal flavors. Dry finish with a hoppy bitterness.
Clear amber colour. Grassy taste and aroma here. Texture is crisp and clean.
Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves. Belle robe dorée, saveur très fruitée. Un grand classique !
i love everything about this beer, from the smell and taste to the history.. defiantly worth a try.

Clear light cobber with off white head. Light fruit esters in the aroma (apples and dried fruits like prunes), malty aroma of bread and crackers and faint sulphur notes. Not much hop aroma except some faint hay/grass notes. The taste is medium sweet with clear malt notes of bread, crackers and caramel. A little european hop flavor (light hay/grass notes). Light to medium bitterness in the finish. A little sulphur. I appreciate the balance between the fruity notes and the light hop flavor and the sulphur. A classic.

Birra dal colore ambrato leggermente opalescente. Schiuma fine e persistente, di color bianco sporco. Allolfatto sentori di malto tostato e caramello. Al palato corpo leggero con note di malto e anacardi. Nel finale rimane amara e secca. Una birra interessante.

Pours a clear gold with a thick white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of sweet malts. Taste is slightly bitter with a little citrus and hops mixed in. There is an after taste Im not liking though. Overall just ok to me.

A bottle from Privado in Guting, drunk at home. Aroma: nice, fresh hops. Appearance: clear amber, pours a generous head settling to 1mm. of lacing. Palate: medium-bodied and slick, average carbonation. Bitter, hoppy at the finish. Taste: medium bitter, a pleasing vanilla note detected at the finish. Solid beverage.
Clear amber with nice cream colored head. Clean taste that you get from a lager. Straw grassy taste with malty aftertaste. Not what I expected, but very drinkable nevertheless.

Out of the bottle, poured a deep amber, filtered clear with a persistent white head. Notes of honey, caramel, bread, hay, raisin and stone fruit. On the palate, quite balanced and quaffable. A lager with lots of good malt character.
on tap pours amber with white head aroma is grass and barley taste is grass and floral smooth finish
Copper colour, slightly hazy. Some bad lager taste is present, but other qualities are not so bad. Low bitterness, not so much interesting beer. Medium in all the aspects.

Pours luminous amber, thin head with foam islands, generous carbonation. Big waft of smoke, honey and bourbon on pouring. A little thin for the abv but nice balance of spice and sweetness on the taste. For a biggish volume production beer its good stuff, and would lead people to try Anchors other better brews.
Nose mild hops. Pale thin head. Clear golden color. Roasty malty and hoppy taste. Well balanced

3cl bottle at De Uurwerker in Groningen. Pours a clear amber colour with a medium white head. Aroma of hops, fruit, caramel, light candy sugar, malts. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a soft bitter finish. Notes of caramel, fruit, hops, light resin, malt. Texture is sticky, medium to light bodied with medium carbonation
Bottle from waitrose. I was expecting much great things and was surprised by the very tinny taste of the beer, especially given its lovely darker colour. I feel it would be nice very cold from a keg.

Pours a thick white head with light round malts and old hoppy aromas. Light clear gold colored body. Round and pleasant barley in mouth. Balance towards the cereals against low carbonation and bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2017 Amber with medium white head. Malty aroma. Malty taste with medium bitterness. Malt aftertaste.
Raisin bread in the smell. Beer that plays out like a pilsner but with IPA and slight Porter influences. Caramel and hoppy bitterness.

In a mystery case from beer hawk. Was 4.8% not 4.9 %. Nice aroma , pours with a thick creamy head. Nutty malty flavour , with hint of hops and sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 Fl Oz bottle
Amber with good head. Looked great.
Grainy sweet malt aroma.
Medium bitterness upfront with quite a sharp dry finish.

Color naranja, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (poca retención). Carbonatación mínima (alguna que otra burbuja suelta). Aroma a malta, caramelo, frutos secos. Sabor a malta, caramelo, con mínimo regusto que recuerda a metal. Algo plana, me gustaría que tuviera más sabor, pero es lo que hay.
Aroma of caramel, malts. Pours a dark gold with a small white head. Tastes of caramel and toast with a smooth finish. Very drinkable.

The standard of the style. Regular on draught at the belle. Amber-copper colour in a pint glass. Clear. Classic Anchor yeast nose, not enough hop aroma to back it up. Taste is good but one dimensional, could do with more body and more complex malts for an amber lager. There are now better examples.

Całkiem smaczny lager. Jest złote, klarowne i posiada wysoką, gęstą pianę. W aromacie czuć biszkopty, trochę nut siana, nieco owoców (ciężko zidentyfikować co konkretnie), a także bardzo subtelną miętę. W smaku dominuje słodowość, słodkość, karmel, a do tego jeszcze znowuż nieco siana. Całościowo kojarzy się z amerykańską farmą. Goryczka występuje. Nie jest ona długa, za to przyjemna i raczej ziołowa. Nagazowanie średnie z małym plusem. Niezłe piwo.

Aroma: malt, caramel.
Appearance: light copper color , clear, good retention of white head.
Taste: toasty and caramel malt, dry finish.
Palate: medium-bodied, medium carbonation.
Flaka, koupeno na topvíno.cz. Dobré pivo, krásné aroma a chuť, nií říz, pivo, které rozhodně neurazí.

Botella. Color ámbar limpio. Buena capa de espuma que mantiene 1 cm. Aroma a caramelo tostado. En boca se confirma de forma predominante el sabor a caramelo, pero no resulta nada dulce. Un punto agradable de amargor te pide echar otro trago.

Caramel, dough, sweetness on the nose. Round and somewhat flabby and with a light foamy head that dissipates quickly. Carbonation does seem OK. Had a sweet attack and smooth mouth feel on the back end. Not as profound as expected given the lofty reviews over the years. I wonder if I had a bad sixer or poorly stored sample as the head is very thin and insipid and disappears after only half a minute.
Bottle. big example for this historical style. nice balance malt / hop with a high carbonation end. fresh and fine.
Bottle. Pours amber. Malty aroma with toffee and caramel notes. Sweetness upfront with light bitterness.

Live rating of a chilled 330ml bottle served in a 1/2 pint chalice. Dark amber with a white skim. Funky, earthy almost Belgian aroma. Quite full bodied for a lager. Berry fruit, candy, vanilla and bitterness in the flavour. Oily mouthfeel. quite gassy. Like a lager/bitter hybrid.
Bottle - clear, golden orange with thick white head. Heavy carbonation. Sweet hoppy aroma. Ok mouthfeel, dry tasting with bitter finish - very drinkable.

22.12.2016 - Interesting mix of lager style and ale aromas. Palate is somewhere between a crisp clean lager and a smooth fruity ale. Aroma and taste is clean, fruity, floral. Confusing but I quite like this style. Well balanced hop and malt. Would like to try the dryhopped one. I have raised my Anchor to Linda - 40 years at Anchor. Congrats!

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 Bottle. Clear amber colour with a thick white head, nose is malty, floral and fruity with some roasty hints and notes of caramel, honey and banana, taste is bready, sweet and a bit roasty with a quite long dry finish.
Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pours pale amber and clear with an off-white head. Aroma and taste of malt, bread, caramel. Highly drinkable.

Aroma: malty and sweet; Appearance: clear amber pour with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: interesting combination of dryness and malt; Palate: medium body with long, sweet finish; Overall: not as good as I remembered it, but easy drinking and somewhat refreshing; would drink again.

I discovered this beer left by my dad because I know my mom told him not too as they have "flown south to the winter" to Palm Springs. This beer is great. Ive actually been drinking for years....why I have not rated it? No idea, cause its awesome. Even more,awesome...my pops stashed it for me.
Nice blond/amber color. Good head but it fades too quickly. Not much aroma. Nice mix of malt and hops in terms of flavor. Nothing exceptional but good.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, przyprawy, karmel. Kolor bursztynowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, lekki lacing. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, słód, karmel, przyprawy, chleb. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.
bottle bbe 11/17 leggero ambrato limpida buona schiuna persistente erbaceo un po di esteri fiko caramello lievito discreto amaro buona secchezza

Bought a six pack, 12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Clear rich copper pour with medium creamy white head, with some lacing. Aroma: caramel, cinnamon, raisins, banana, bread, roasted malts. Medium body, with low carbonation, would recommend to friends, nice tasting beer.
Bottle at Smash, Reading. 01/11/16. Sweet floral and hay aroma. Amber. Thin white head. Medium bitter. Malts, with a hoppy finish. Textured body. Carbonation.
Klarröd med tunt vitt. Aromen lätt maltig. Smaken hyggligt fyllig, lite beska. Eftersmaken tämligen lång och maltig.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Little to no hops, mostly malts - a bit of caramel and some bread. Taste is rather simple and lacking depth. caramel, a bit of bitterness, some bready notes. Nothing to get excited about. Sad that it lacks hoppy aroma to add a bit of depth. Boring, yet drinkable beer.
Red body white off white head.aromas of caramel,hops, malt.The body is light to medium and dry. The taste is bittersweet,malty,caramel like.Carbonation is low.A very drinkable every day beer.

Six pack shared, bottles into stemmed glass.
Aroma + Dark amber/ mid-brown colour with off-white fluffy head all point to a malty beer and they point true. Not over the top, yet sweetish caramel flavour subtly seeps through. 
Easy drinking almost sessionable beer - but three were plenty to satisfy the palate and lead into a good red with dinner. 
Good enough to drink on its own would also go well with nutty cheeses and mild meat dishes.

Bottle from Fountainhall Wines. Clear copper colour. Malty treacle and Murray Mint nose. Malty smooth taste with slight bitter kick. Gentle but sharp carbonation with oily finish. A good amber lager/Vienna beer. I liked it.
12 oz bottle. Amber colour with white head. The aroma is caramel and fruit. The taste is light/medium sweet and light/medium bitter with a slight peppery hop quality. A very decent ale.
Dont expect anything more than maltiness, caramel, slight acidity and medium carbonation. Heavy like an anchor ;)

This was creamy and interesting. The taste was unique and maybe a bit yeasty. I had this at a seafood restaurant, so I didnt really get the full effect, but it went great with mussels. I really liked the way the beer looked in the glass for some reason, but was not impressed enough with it to order a second one.

helder rood/caramel met fijne licht kaki kraag. aroma van mout, caramel en suiker. Smaken zijn glad, caramel, redelijk bitter, iets pittig, lange gebrande caramel moutige bittere afdronk, matige body.
Bottle from bierlinie. Pours clear Amber colored. Nose is citrus, bread, toffee. Palate is tart, toffee, a bit bitter. Finish is short and bitter. Nice malt backbone. Good.
Flasche im Dolores in Berlin - Mitte. Trübes Bernstein. Aroma Malz, Karamell. Geschmack herb, malzsüße, etwas Karamell und im Hintergrund fruchtig
Solid beer for every day. Tastes great, but a bit lacking in overall complexity and depth of flavor / balance. Always a good choice, but never wows.
355ml bottle at Manchester Piccadilly. Amber colour with a small off white head. Malty grain aroma, flavour is malty with a hefty dose of bitter hops. Nice
Leicht trübes Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig,etwas Karamell, leicht süßlich, fruchtig, blumig, etwas mineralisch.
Classic steam beer with some sulphuric aroma and a ale-ish touch to this bottom fermented beer
Draft at WIllies Locally Known. This was a good beer for a warm evening BBQ. Crisp and refreshing without being overpowering.

Clear bright copper with long lasting beige head. Aroma is lots of nuts and caramel with some bready malts. Little buttery/creamy. Taste is citrussy sourness with malty bittersweetness. Very light and easy to drank, watery actually, with long finish of bitter nuts. Lemon peel while swallowing. Enjoyable, but not great.
Orange color, medium beige head. Malt aroma with some spices and citrus. Sweet taste of malt, citrus and fruit with a medium long bitter finish.

Dont know why I tried so hard to get into Amber Ales this month. Theyre still not my thing. Too malty, too sweet. The aroma of this beer is pretty darn good but besides that I am finding it just alright. I am certain if I were 22, and not 28, I would think this beer is amazing. But things change. Its not easy to adapt, I know. You may think you liked things the way they were, you may beg for those things to come back, but thats not what will happen. Wait, I know now why I bought all these amber ales. My dad likes them and I tend to like the things he likes. Maybe when I am his age my taste buds will crave amber ales? Until then I say let this anchor sink to the bottom.
Der Duft klar untergärig, würzig und ein bisschen seifig. Der Trunk malzig, blumig und mit einem Schuss Fruchtigkeit im Abspann ausgestattet. Nett to drink. 355ml/2,80 Bottle im DOLORES Berlin.
A great example of the "everyday" beer Id like to easily find in local supermarkets or on tap at the gigs. Doesnt offer much in the aroma but its mild bitterness makes it so drinkable.

Ciemnozłote, klarowne piwo o średniej pianie, która zdobi szkło i utrzymuje się do końca w formie mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat słodowy, jakby nawet lekko waniliowy. W smaku także słodowe z lekką wanilią. Goryczka średnia. Ogólnie udane piwo z posmakiem wanilii, ale po takiej legendzie spodziewałem się trochę więcej.
13-09-16 // bottle. Almost clear orange copper colour. Quite hoppy in the nose. Light body, medium carbonation. Taste is light hoppy, grass and flower aroma.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours clear amber with lazing offwhite head. Aroma is malty with bread and biscuit and some fruityness and grassy hops. Taste is malty with breadcrust and biscuit, some fruityness and grassy hoppiness. Finish is quite dry and moderately bitter and has a malty touch.

Pours a deep, clear copper with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of caramel, light banana and butterscotch, toasty, resin, a hue of honey and dried dates. Taste is very straight forward - starts out with medium sweetness and turns into a nice light-to-medium bitter kick. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel, lively soft carbonation, nice bittersweet finish. 
Theres not much left to say. This is a classic, and it deserves to be. Pretty sweet and toasty, but also nicely balanced bitter notes. Very pleasant mouth feel - carbonation and body are just right. Refreshing.

35,5cl bottle at home, bought at Mitra Vismarkt, Groningen. Appearance: clear rich golden with medium creamy white head. Aroma: caramel, raisins, banana, bread, roasted malts, trace of cinnamon and metal. Taste: medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of caramel and bread. Bitterness increases towards the finish. Palate: medium bodied, watery texture and medium carbonation.
Amber liquid with white frothy foam. Grass and malt aroma, Medium body with soft carbonation, nice bitterness.
355 ml bottle from SB. Amber color with dirty white head. Floral, grass, malty, caramel in the aroma. Malt dominated flavors, refreshing. A bit sweet, grainy. Overall pretty nice and drinkable.

Nice 3/4" off white head atop a very clear amber brew... lite lacing that dries to crusty bubbles.

Aroma is bunches of toasted and caramel malts melting perfectly into earthy hops... few other brews are like it... clean, no yeast esters at all.

This beer is dialed in... not really any way I can see to make it better tasting... toasted bread and lite caramel... clean bitterness and malts with a long lingering earthy undertow.

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze ciemny zloty z ladna biala grubopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie nuty kwiatowe i slodowe, jest tez lakki karmel. Nie czuc zadnych aromatow chmieli. W smaku ziolowe bez goryczki z niskim wysyceniem. Bardzo dziwne piwo (moje pierwsze z tego browaru) ktore niestety niezbyt mi smakowalo.

Light amber, medium off-white head. Nice lacing. Smells of honey, caramel, spicy hop. Minimal alco. Medium body. Oily. Rather dry taste. Caramel (lots of). Medium grassy bitterness. Nice balance-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

On tap @ Anchor. How have I never rated this? Clear amber colored beer with a finger of white foam. Rich caramel malts along with toasted bread, biscuit, and floral hops. Theres some hints of citrus to go along with it. Much lighter and crisper than I seem to remember and that most other steam beers/California Commons tend to be. While not winning any favor with the beer dork crowd, a true classic and a fine beer.

AROMA-Moderate caramel and toasty malt aroma with hint of nut. Light woody and minty hops aroma and faint hint of citrus. No esters.

APPEARANCE-Amber color. Light hazy. Head is off-white with dense tiny bubble, dont last. 

FLAVOR-Moderate caramel and toasty malt flavor with medium sourness. Light woody hop flavor. Hop bitterness is medium. Finish is dry and light sour. Aftertaste is medium-high bitterness last long.

MOUTHFELL-Medium body with medium carbonation, crisp.

OVERALL-Good drinkability.

Alla spina. Limpido color ramato, soffice schiuma biancastra. Al naso e al palato ricorda una lager con un intensa nota di malto caramellato e un tocco nocciolato più lieve. I luppoli si fanno sentire sul finale, amari ed erbacei ma non preponderanti. Una birra equilibrata e poco impegnativa, di corpo medio, iconica.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso è decisamente orientato verso il luppolo. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello di schiuma ha una buona tenuta, formato da bollicine medio-fini a carbonazione abbondante. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. La frizzantezza è scarsa. Il colore è ambrato. Il corpo è strutturato non pesante. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate. Il finale è amarognolo, pulito e complesso. Il retrogusto è poco meno che intenso. Laroma in bocca riporta sentori di caramello, miele, frutta secca, resina, fiori, agrumi e pompelmo.

Light malty nose with a touch of resin and lemon notes. Medium body with emphasis on the malt and nicely balanced bitterness and sweetness. Hop flavors very reminiscent of English beers. A tour of roasted malt notes. Bitter finish, but not at all harsh. Packs a lot of flavor and body in a 4.9% beer.

pours into a yellowish terracotta with a white head. the aroma is that of fresh grapes but a very weak smell as if anything pleasant you may have got from it was by accident. the flavor is similar to that of your generic lagers, think tuborg. not the most enjoyable beer ive had, probably wont have it again.

Reddish golden. Caramel malt and light hops in both aroma and flavour. Mild and refreshing taste, with light sweetness and a rounded bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with low carbonation. Overall, a good steam beer. Simple, tasty and refreshing.

Bottle - Huge marks for drink ability. This is a beer I can drink regularly and not get tired of it. Good balance of hop flavor and bitterness, nothing to terrible complex but still a good flavor profile.

Kopparfärgad öl med vitt skum. Ser riktigt trevlig ut i glas tycker jag. Mestadels en maltig öl med karamell och knäckkola. Men även en viss fruktighet är med. Lätt beska. En jäkligt bra öl man gärna dricker flera utav. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 Chilled 355ml bottle. Beautiful bottle aesthetic. Yellow label and blue cap are very complimentary. Pours copper and forms an opulent white head. Smells malty and floral with hints of caramel. Perfectly balanced between malty and hoppy. Nettle, Nut and faint fruits linger in there seemingly from the malts while the hops pack of flowery punch. Easy body. Very palatable. Mild tang and spice. Finish is smooth and refreshing. One of my favourites for sessioning. Excellent.
Bottiglia 33cl; color ambrato con schiuma non abbondante ma persistente. Alla bevuta sentori sentori tostati di caramello, finale amaro non eccessivo.

Pours in dark orange and with a thick creamy head. What a great malty profile and hop balance in one sip all alone. The malty base is good, the way the hops are used is good. And all put together is amazing. I like traditional stuff and this ones one of them.

APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa alta actividad de carbonatación, ligeramente turbia y algunos residuos en el líquido; corona de espuma color blanca de buena retención, de burbujas compactas.

AROMA: notas ligeras a ahumado es lo que destaca, además del dulzor de las maltas, caramelo y cereales.

SABOR: nuevamente las notas a ahumado presente pero muy, muy sutiles, además de caramelo y algo a cereales; el retrogusto con un amargor medio bajo, seco y no astringente que puede quedar pega al paladar.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero con mediana sensación oleosa, carbonatación alta, inclusive se siente el crispar en lengua.

RESUMEN: buena de acuerdo al estilo

6packs of 12oz bottles over the years, often sampled at tastings 2012ff. Occasion: 1001 and BL sampler. - Bref: ESB, simplified Franconian Keller and Kölsch meet their hybrid equal in this robust golden sessioner that started it all. Evergreen and classic. - Love the deep bronze, copper hue. Crisp aroma of caramelised barley and whisky malts, ears of barley swaying under a high sun - no real hop aroma, the fruitiness (apricot, wood, unripe banana) seems mostly malt derived. - Pleasant caramel cracker dry mouthfeel, love the natural carbonation here between ungespundet, real ale and old champagne. Nuances of toast in the flavour that keep me going in for another gulp. The bitter Northern Brewer bite is in the tail: fresh hop flowers, crisp caramels pinching the taste buds with a hint of astringent barley husk, dried grasses and nettle, hay, peels of dried fruit, walnuts. Lingering caramelised walnut bitterness. - Easily my favourite CalifCommon (as if there really were another) and a nostalgic reminiscence of when Spéciale Belge was still a style to be reckoned with. - Ref.: Steam > Witkap Special, draught De Coninck, oldschool Palm.

Deep amber with medium offwhite head, decent lacing. Aroma is rather malty, some caramel and toffee, some fruit and spice and resin. Taste is well balanced with some crispy bitterness taking the lead as it progresses. Very velvetty, well balanced beer with enough bite to keep it refreshing.

Pours clear copper with an off white head. Nose is sweet bread and a little zesty hops. Flavor is less rich and leans toward a typical pale lager with just a bit of barley against modest European style hopping. Finish is quick. Decent enough for what it is.

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought from off-license in Ossett. Enjoyable amber ale.

Chmiel : Northern Brewer 
Kolor: Bursztynowy. Zupełnie klarowny. 
Piana: Małe oczka, zbita warstewka w żółtym kolorze. Zaznacza każdy łyk na krawędziach szkła. 
Fajnie okleja ścianki. 
Zapach : Sympatyczny i dość oryginalny. Głównie chmielowy z minimalnym karmelem. Lekkie nuty owocowe. Czuć jakby osiadającą parę i troszeczkę wiejskiego aromatu. 
Smak: Wyraźnie zdominowany przez słodowość, chmiel na dalszym planie. Tu i ówdzie przewija się również karmel. Subtelny miętowy akcent ujawnił się dopiero pod koniec. 
Goryczka wyraźna, chmielowo-miętowa.
Finisz rześki.
Pijalność bardzo wysoka! 
Wysycenie: Wysokie. 
Podsumowanie: 

Browar Anchor z San Francisco warzy swoje piwa od 1896 roku.
Styl California Common, lub inaczej Steam Beer został zapoczątkowany przez tą właśnie firmę.
Nazwa "Steam Beer" jest nazwą prawnie zastrzeżoną przez browar.
Nazwa wywodzi się stąd, że w dawnych czasach piwo w tym stylu było fermentowane w dużych, płytkich i otwartych kadziach, aby zrekompensować brak chłodzenia i wykorzystać chłodne temperatury regionu San Francisco.
Burzliwe zachowanie piwa w procesie fermentacji wywoływało wrażenie parowania. Staąd też powstała nazwa "Steam Beer".

Samo piwo łączy w sobie cechy Lagera dolnej fermentacji z piwami Ale górnej fermentacji.
Jest niezłą odskocznią od wszystkich piw warzonych przy użyciu nowofalowych, amerykańskich chmieli.

Piwo jest lekko owocowe, wyraźniej słodowe z karmelem i cechami charakterystycznymi dla chmielu Northern Brewer (mięta, drewno, wiejska nuta).
Piwo bardzo pijalne, smaczne i wręcz sesyjne.
Flagowy przedstawiciel gatunku!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 20-01-2017. Jasno-bursztynowe, opalizujace, z ladna piana, brudzaca szklo, zostawiajaca obraczke. Intensywne aromaty slodowo-zbozowe, nieco a la lepsze pilsy, do tego nieco trawiasto-ziolowych - zgaduje ze Northern-Brewerowych nut. W tle jakies slady jasnych owocow. W smaku w slodka strone, nieco karmelu, chleb, nadal zbozowa slodowosc dominuje. Goryczka faktycznie wcale niemala, fajna, roslinna. Dosc lekkie piwo, srednio wysycone, z fajnie skontrastowana slodkoscia z goryczka. Fajne, mimo, ze nie pod moj gustOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

This is an interesting combination given that a malt dominated aroma generally goes along with a thicker body. Caramel and grapes are getting even stronger in the mouth and fruity notes are more dominant. There is a straightness that I didnt expect that it makes is refreshing and easy drinking but still keeps up a nice aroma profile. Leaves a light bitter a fruity aftertaste.

12 oz. bottle. Pours amber with thick white head. Aroma was malty and caramel. Taste was sweet and malty.

4.9%ABV.  California Common.

Poured out of the bottle a deep amber.  18ºSRM.  Maybe for sentimental reasons, this appears to be the amber hue that is most associated with good times?!

Nose has some clean sweet aromas hinting at wheatiness.  Beery and very slightly yeasty.  There are plenty of sweet malty aromas  suggesting nicely browning toast, not unlike the slightly sweet, wet aroma that you get from freshly toasted seven grain or wheat bread.  There are nutty, brown-roasted flavors as well.

Mouthfeel is carbonated and soapy.  Medium weight.   Very pleasing palate of nutty, caramel type malty flavors.  There are also wheaty flavors of white bread, dough, and raw peanuts.  There is also a beery fruitiness right in the middle of the palate. 

Finish is lightly bitter, clean and overall still malt-balanced. 

A good clean old timey favorite revived at the very dawn of American craft brewing.

Goes on Favorites List!. Its pretty much just nostalgia talking, but this beer started it ALL!!!
I had it from the bottle. The taste is hops, grassy, bread, and slightly sweet malt. Its very nicely balanced and flavorful. This is a solid and sessionable beer.

 Pours a clear orange amber with a lacy off-white 
 The aroma is a combination of malt and oranges. Medium slightly creamy body with lively carbonation. 
The taste is toffee, malt, and fruit maltyness with a dry hoppy and long finish.

Hello to an old friend, not tasted for years. I saw it on offer in a supermarket and could not resist. Pours amber in colour with a very thin head. Aroma is sweet caramel. Taste is also sweet with some dryness. Sweet and sticky palate. I remember it better than this. Overall: ho-hum.

Bottle, Kobe Portopia Gourmet store. Dark amber, medium head. Aroma malts, predominantly sweet malty taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella. @La Taberna de Hank, Luanco. 03/10/2015 Color ambar claro, transparente, aroma malta, sabor malta caramelo.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2016 Appearance Clear deep gold, with a moderate white head, slight lacing. . 
Aroma Pine and butterscotch, floral notes, pepper, biscuits.
Taste Moderately sweet, with a rounded mild bitterness. 
Palate Medium body, medium high carbonation. Long aftertaste of well-done biscuits and with some hints of pine resin

355ml bottle pours deep amber with good white head. Nose is all malts. Some real bitter and almost sour notes on taste. Possibly English noble hops in here. Not really my thing. Could easily pass as an English bitter.
Pours clear amber with an slightly off white head the leaves lacing. Nose is roasted caramel. Body is medium. Taste is caramel. Hop bitterness is light. 12 oz bottle

Adquirida en Whole Foods, LES, New York. Botella de 330 ml. Similar a una lager alemana pero algo más amarga. Buena cerveza.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light amber copper. Light foamy head. Sweet caramel aroma. Light floral. Some english.Taste is floral slight fruit foamy carbonated caramel biscuit toast. Citrus pepper bitter.English Grassy.Mineral. Almost an englishy light Oktoberfest in a way.
Wonderful beer. A fizzy beer that hasa light brown colour. Nohead when poured from the bottle. Very strong caramel taste. Excellent beerand the first Ive tried fromAmerica

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks Shmupi. Slightly hazy copper with small beige head and lots of sediments. Sweet fruity aroma (watermelon, grapes) with notes of honey and some yeasts. Sweet fruity flavor, feels quite old, notes of honey and melon, light bitterness. Medium-bodied. Too old, unfortunately.

Pours brilliant clear light brown-amber colour with foamy stable white head.
Aroma: without notice of an alcohol, with notes of caramel, honey, with hints of floral elements.
Flavor: taste is also without note of an alcohol. Firstly is sweet, with nites of caramel and with some fruity-floral elements (also wood flavor), finish is slightly fruity-spicy. Body is mouth-coating, carbonation is mild low, hop bitterness is mild low, malt sweetness is medium.
A classic, if not my favorite Anchor. Pours a lively orange, nose of caramel. Taste is caramel, bread. Lovely chewy mouthfeel. No strong flavors, but drinkability is off the charts.

Schöne, Bernsteinfarbene Erscheinung mit feiner Schaumkrone. Aroma nach frischem Früchtebrot. Sehr malziger, brotiger Geschmack mit Nuancen von Banane und getrockneten Pfirsichen. Intensiver, leicht säuerlicher Nachgeschmack. Tolles Bier!

Im Glas rotbraun, Schaum bricht im Teko schnell weg. In der Nase Röstaromen, leicht Schokolade. Im Trunk hohe Drinkability, Malz, dass sich nach dem Antrunk noch stärker durchsetzt, leicht cremig, ganz feine Bitterkeit im Abgang. Ordentliches Bier, fast schon kernig fränkisch. Für einen Bamberger aber nichts Besonderes.

Stray bottle found in the singles barrel at the Beaches LCBO. Curious about this as I was just recently gifted their Brotherhood of Steam brew (which I find is a far more complex, interesting & satisfying beer). Brown in the glass, foamy white cap etc. Starts off crisp like a highly carbonated lager & then falls into a round honey-like flavour of malt sweetness. A little too sugary for me. Despite my recent foray into the style I cant say this is what im looking for.
Can at champps. Great Amber color and nose. Smooth and crisp. Well balanced.

Butelka. Barwa herbaciana, klarowna. Piana wysoka, drobna, utrzymuje się długo. Aromat wyraźny, wyczuwalna lekka mięta, aromat drewniany. owoce suszone. Smak wyrazisty, pełny, słodowy. Wyraźna niezalegająca goryczka.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2016 0,355l bottle from beerbottle.eu. Nice-shaped bottle. Almost tasteless, watery, boring beer. Very disappointing.
Rerate: Now drunken directly from the bottle: Its an average beer. But not as bad as at first try.

Bottle in San Francisco. One of my favourite beers of all time. Nice golden body with big head. Nose is sweet, caramel. Taste is also sweet and caramel with hops and pine. Nice smooth palate. Well done.
0,5l on tap. Aroma of soft caramel, almost as of rasberries. On tongue I feel hit with cream and it transfers into bitterness, followed by traditional roasted caramel in the aftertaste.

Bottle @ The Barrel Store, Carrick-on-Shannon [250715]
Golden, clear, frothy white head
Aroma of sweet caramel, soft toffee
Taste of sweet pale fruity caramel, quite malty, soft bitter hops, creamy light toffee malts, easy
Palate - Soft carb, medium body, creamy, soft sweet palate. Finish of soft light caramel toffee
Overall - Nice, easy, somewhat old-fashioned, emphasis on the malts here, good for the style

Small but nice shaped 12oz bottle. Foamy when served cold. It is a strange combination of lager gasification feeling with a carecteristic ale taste. It gives a refreshing feeling for it. The same happens with the color. It is no lighter as a lager nether dark as an ale.

Bottle, 355ml. A semi-cloudy amber beer with a medium size foamy white head that fades away after a minute. Aroma is of spices, alcohol, caramel and malt. Taste is botter with a slightly alcoholic beer. There is some carbonation and astringency. I think I feel the special fermentation process; feels like a lager but with the character of an ale.

12oz bottle, poured into a shaker. The aroma is a honey and grains combination with a bit of a dry, grassy herb. Its aroma is mellow overall. It pours amber and clear with white fuzzy head that has light medium lace moderate retention. The taste is a medium bitter and light, dry sweet. The texture is thin with a fizzy carbonation and light body. The taste is a light berry and honey with a pronounced grain taste, the finish is clean with a mellow, bitter citrus and a light bread touch that carries to the aftertaste.
Good beer, great beer. Awesome beer, saiko beer(never visit aldrich hotel in san francisco)

Bottle (from beerExpress, Tallinn). Pours amber with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, grains, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, caramel, hops, grains, malt. Finish is dry bitter with caramel notes. Overall: ok.
Bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Deep amber with small head. Fruit jam aroma, strawberry, malty. Very light body, no real taste. Sweet, but watery. Not bad.
Fľaa 330 ml zo Seoul Plaza Bratislava. Pomarančovo karamelová priehľadná farba, pekná hustá pena, aróma chmeľu a sladu. Stredná rezkosť, chuť sladu a karamelu, jemná horkosť. Zaujímavé, chutné pivo.

Aroma: Hazy spicy aroma like cinamon

Appearance: Deep amber colour, thin creamy head

Taste: Clean bitter and some sweet

Palate: Light body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, and clean smooth finish

Overall: Lager, but its flavour let me feel like an mild ale. Between Premium Lager and English Bitter.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, opalizujące. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości.
AROMAT: Mało intensywny. Głównie karmel i trochę cytrusowych nut.
SMAK: Słodowość. Lekkie, orzeźwiające. Goryczka niska, krótka.

Bottle, light amber with medium creamy white head. Aroma is malty, yeast, caramel, herbal and slightly orange peel on nose. Taste is light bitter, sweet and some citric acidic notes as well, hints of orange, caramel. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. This is my first California common style beer and I like it a lot.

앵커 브루어리 - 앵커 스팀 비어 4.9% ABV 존경하는 앵커의 대표맥주. 보수적 라거 입맛에 승부수를 띄운듯한 한층 강화된 홉, 몰트의 쌉쌀한 맛이 탁탁 쳐준다. 굵직하고 알기쉽게 그은 선이 매력적인 맥주 

앵커 브루어리는 현대적 의미의 현존하는 미국 최초의 크래프트 맥주 양조장이다. 수많은 마이크로브루 산파격이면서 현재 세계의 크래프트 비어붐을 초기부터 견인해온 파이오니어 프리츠 메이탁의 스팀비어

그 맛 또한 극단적 경쟁에 놓인 21세기 크래프트 비어에 익숙해진 이들에게도 여전히 뒤떨어짐이 없다 (상대적으로 시에라 네바다의 페일에일이 얼마나 맛이 없나를 생각해 보라) 한국에 수입되어 있으니 시도해 보시길.

피츠Ǣ 펜실베니아, 미국

https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot
A medium hop flavor that starts off with bitterness and finishes clean. Very slight malt flavor. A pale ale or light IPA beer.

Very easy drink with no flair. will make an excellent session beer but nothing more special to appreciate than that.
Pleasant sweetness and scotch-ale-like flavor with foamy yellowish head.
Draught @ Albion. Clear amber with large beige spongy head, crisp malt aroma, caramel and molasses taste, medium carbonation, long finush with caramel aftertaste. Very good brew.

Foam is dense and beautiful. The aroma is dominated by malt and a hint of fruit. Flavor is a sharp hoppy bitterness slowly taken over by both fruit and caramel malt. The palate is somewhat dry, bitter and not very lengthy. This beer was first brewed in 1896 and was in the 1960s close to disappearing completely from the market. Fortunately chose a wealthy young man (Fritz Maytag) to save his favorite beer. I understand his passion for this lovely beer.

Pours Amber with some creamy white head. Aroma is heavy yeast with doughy malt. Nice fruity flavor with crisp malt character.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured out of a bottle for many of times for over 20 years. One of my first beers out of the domestic realm back in the day. Biscuit aroma and a combination of floral and earthiness in the nose. Golden amber hue with healthy white head that laces as I drink. Slight caramel sweetness with grain flavor. Nice carbonation and velvet texture combination.
Amber clear color. Malty aroma. Pleasantly malty, an almost honeyed sweetness balanced by a dank hoppiness. Smooth palette.

COOL TRADISHONAL AMERICA STYLE OF BEERS IS STEAM BEERS. THE BEER GET BOIL FOR STEAM AND THEYRE MAKES A SMOOTH AND CRISP BEER. IT HAS LITE FRUIT AND SPICE FLAYVER WHICH IS UNIQE TO STEAM BEERS STYLE. CALIFORNIA MAKES MOST STEAM BEERS AND BECAUSE OF CALIFORNIA IT HAS SIGNETEURE GRASSY TASTE. I HOPE THOSE STREEMS DONT DRY UP FOR MAINLY BECAUSE PLINY IS MAKING THEYRE!!! (PLINY IS THD BEST BEER)
Mucho cuerpo, redonda en boca, bastante carbónica llenando el paladar con una estupenda mezcla de dulce con algo de caramelo, Malta y sabores herbales de los lúpulos. Final bastante amargo y seco
33cl @ bottle. Ambrata per la Anchor. Birra senza grandi pretese, buon aroma, retrogusto amarognolo e molto beverina. Non la loro birra di punta, ma ottima birra da cibo.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours clear amber with small white head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, caramel, malty, fresh hay, honey, flowers. Taste is bitter, grainy, malty, caramel, some sour notes, toffee- caramel, some woodiness, dry. Medium body. Bitter -dry finish. Good beer.

Coloração vermelha acobreada,espuma formou um creme abundante,alto e duradouro,média carbonação,aroma de malte tostado,caramelo,ligeiro defumado e a medida que a cerveja esquentava o lúpulo e o álcool apareciam,sabor segue o aroma,com o tostado do malte e o amargor do lúpulo balanceados,boa drinkability,final doce.
7.6.14. 335ml @ Bastis, Helsinki. Ruby color with shortlasting white head. Fruity, mouldy nose. Roasty and quite complex shortish flavor. Crisp mouthfeel and fine aftertaste for a lager type brew.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber, fluffy off-white head. Aroma: sweet malt, apricot, floral, biscuits. Low carbonated, medium body, smooth and crisp at the same time. The taste is malty and fruity, caramel, apricot. Finish dry with pine bitterness. Very rich flavors in this one.

Clear copper pour. Giant rocky tan head that leaves decent lacing. Nutty, slightly metallic nose with a hint of floral hops. Light mouthfeel, lots of bubbles. Slight funk, some rye bread, coffee and nutty notes. Pine late and in the finish. Solid.

Ámbar bastante oscura. Espuma poco abundante. Aroma a malta. Mucho cuerpo, redonda en boca, bastante carbónica llenando el paladar con una estupenda mezcla de dulce con algo de caramelo, Malta y sabores herbales de los lúpulos. Final bastante amargo y seco. Notable

(Keg at William K. Kurvi, 20150612) The beer poured amber and clear. Its head was medium sized, dense and white. Aroma had sweetness, fruitiness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, sweetness, something resembling cardboard, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty, sweet and bitter. Resembles too much an old lager but surprisingly not completely bad brew.
Amber in color with an orange hue. Has a subtle hops flavor to it with a little bite on the back end. tastes of stale bread with a grass nose. little carbonation and lacing

ganz o.k

-im antrunk eine recht starke hopfennote
-große karamellnote
-im abgang leicht süß,sehr wässrig und toast

Selbst für ein quasi Lager nicht sehr komplex.
Trotzdem meilen besser als die Durchschnittslager

Pours medium amber with off-white head of small bubbles with good retention Malty aroma with caramel and hop notes.Disappointingly light malty taste with note of bread and caramel. Hardly any hop and only a faint lingering bitterness in the aftertaste. Pleasantly low carbonation and mouthfeel though rather thin body. I was disappointed by this one as I remembered it more tasteful and as I am a fan of the brewerys Liberty Ale. Not bad, but not memorable either.

Bottle, 355mL. Home. A beautiful sparkling amber beer with a medium white head ; medium retention. Aroma of biscuit, roast, toast, caramel, light spice. Medium sweet, light dry ; round. Medium body, average texture and carbonation, sweet toffee finish. Overall, I enjoyed this beer ; a new style"California common" !! Toasty, toffee, round.
Steam beer is a very good pale ale. It has a good head, but what sets it apart is its excellent malt taste. It is fairly high in hops, and the malt and hops marry very well.

355ml bottle. Pale amber / copper colour with a towering, dense, creamy head with a buttery tinge. Wonderful head retention and some of the nicest lacing Ive ever seen. Aroma of caramel, toasted malts, woody and sulphur. Medium bitterness and medium roast malt sweetness. Light to medium body, some chewy nuttiness and a lingering, grainy, semi-dry, bitter finish. Some lovely complexity in this one. Very drinkable.

Bottle 33 cl.
Clear light amber, off-white head. Malty, and spicy citrus aroma. Well balanced hoppy finish.

A true American Classic and one of my all time favorite beers. Clear amber pour with a frothy white head. Left drips of lace. Aroma was bits if caramel and woody, earthy Norther Brewer hops. Flavors were slightly sweet with a nice moderate bitter finish. Nicely balanced. Unique fruitiness in the finish, a product of the fermentation process Im sure. Always a pleasure.
First rating in yonks. Picked this up from Ashfield mall bottle o, decent enough beer but not worth the price.

Bière de Frisco, qui existe depuis 1896. Abv de 4,8 % . All barley malt.
Couleur caramel à roux clair, appelé par le brasseur « deep amber ».
Clarté nette. Bulles fines partout bien vives. Mousse beige clair, assez crémeuse, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de malt grillé, caramel, nougat, pointe de figue, fumée de foin lointaine.
1ère bouche souple, avec un agréable ensemble malt/épices légères, et un peu de bois brun.
Arrière-bouche maltée, mais assez courte.
2ème au bon ensemble malt/houblon, mais fin de bouche pas complexe.
Arrière-bouche toujours très courte.
3ème avec un côté grillé/brûlé qui prend de devant.
Arrière-bouche plus longue, sur les mêmes nuances.
Longueur avec un peu de vigne vierge, touche de girofle, mais pas vraiment complexe.
Jambes marquées mais un peu collantes.
Alcool assez timide sur la longueur.
Finale décente.
CONCLUSION : un de mes profs disait : « peut mieux faire », et cest le cas bien sûr pour Anchor, 
mais on sincline ici devant la tradition dune vieille bière.

Hardly any aroma. Clear and dark golden appearance. Quite a hoppy taste. Subtle aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 19B). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: predominant malty aroma with caramel notes and a very faint fresh hop note. APPEARANCE: medium amber and translucent. medium ivory head with good retention. TASTE: moderate malt flavour with a caramelly note. very low hop flavours. semi-dry finish with a moderate and lingering bitterness. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: the traditional steam beer from Anchor but with faint hop presence.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Weird ale and lager combination. Taste like not very clear lager, so how it supposed to. Pleasant malty, caramel and hopy aroma.

Clear amber color with huge beige head. Really intense carbonation. Malty aroma, some citrus like lemon, bread and some barley. Very malty taste, with bread, toffee, floral and herbal hops and also citrus. Slightly bitter aftertaste.
Amber coloured beer. First Californian Common beer, Ive tried. Easy to drink as its not very bitter.

Bottle says 4.8%. Appearance is clear, light amber with a substantial off-white foamy head which lasts and clings a bit. Aroma- caramel, honey, toast, biscuit, yeast hints. Taste- bitter hops, underlying sweetness, fruity hints, caramel, toffee, malty undertones. Solid stuff.
330ml bottle @ the Alb, Shrewsbury. Pours amber with white head. Light, clean & harmless with some hints of floral, grassy hops but ultimately lacking a fair amount of flavour.
I drank the draft beer in Bielsko-Biala in Poland.Foam thick and creamy ecru. Long-lasting foam. Caramel and herbal aroma. Minty finish on the palate. Ideal California Common.
Yellow body & thin white head that disappears quickly. Little or no aroma and the taste is sweet, slightly metallic. Slight aftertaste

Pours Amber color with small head not very persistent. Nice lager with some caramel taste. Goes down smoothly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours lemon-gold. Yellowish head.
Very low aromas: yeast, cream, dough.
Fresh and lacking. Tasteless and very short.

I think this beer holds a special place in my heart. I think Anchor is my white whale destination. Had a pint of this last night, mild copper color with medium hop notes without overpowering, some citrus but equally zesty. Medium malted and mild to medium sweet caramel and malty bite. Its enjoyable for sure and a time honored tradition.

Wygląd: Biała, kremowa piana. Szybko opada bez lacingu. Klarowne, o herbacianej barwie. 
Aromat: słodowy, "drewniany", w tle lekkie owoce, chmiel. Świeży zapach.
Smak: Wyraźna choć nieco słaba goryczka. Lekko kwaśne, słodowe, czuć nuty zbożowe. W tle karmel.
Wysycenie średnie, dość treściwe. Ciekawe piwo.

Pours amber with a nice white head. Biscuity, caramel with slight funk on the nose. Flavour is slightly grassy and sour up front with malty toffee backing. Fairly clean and crisp. Good refresher with just enough to keep me interested. Good lager alternative.

Fresh golden pure looking pale beer which has good acidity and structure. Herbs, tree and a touch of toffee taste with a super long light dry bitter end. Subtle by modern extreme craft standards but an absolute classic and very very refreshing.

Cest tellement décevant quand ce quil y a dans la bouteille ne fait pas honneur à ce que laissait présager lapparence du contenant ;-( Plutôt ordinaire mais assez complexe. Jai noté la présence du bourbon en arrière-goût...

355ml bottle, excellent drinkability. It literally disappeared from glass. White head, not sure if lasts long. Medium carbonation, intensively malty taste. Some-kind of grassy aroma. Could be everyday beer - nothing strong in taste noticed. Very neutral.

Tried on bottle. Colour is pale copper/amber, good retention of small white head. Aroma is weak. Slight pale malts and earthy scent. Taste is pale malts, bread with slight bitter hops balance. Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated and slightly dry. Refreshing, easy drinking beer but not massively exciting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
deep amber color; bready, caramel malt aroma; bready malt with caramel notes; bitter and well balanced

Aroma: malts
Taste: malty, bitter
Looks gret, the head goes quite fast tho, will probably get it again

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Bottle. Supplier: The Aviator (Bristol). Low carbonation with roasted malty tones.

Barwa miedziana. Piana słaba - mało obfita, szybko opadająca, chociaż utrzymuje się w postaci pierścienia. Bardzo duże nagazowanie. W aromacie wyraźnie słodowe, do tego estry owocowe - winogrono, jabłko. Czuć miętę. W smaku słodowe, wyraźnie czuć również chmiel. Goryczka średnia. Dobrze pijalne, lekkie.
To moje pierwsze piwo w tym stylu, który wydaje się determinować raczej spokojne piwa.

355ml bottle, poured into tall tulip. A: Didnt look overly lively, golden, small head, poor retention, barely any lacing,slightly hazy. S: Very malty, also had some Saaz style floral aroma. T: Bitter malts and charcoal. M: Sticky texture, minimal carbonation, coarse edge from the bitterness O: A bit like a Franconian Kellerbier, not bad but not great either.

Piana drobna, kremowa, szybko opadła. Zostały ślady na szkle. 
Aromat złożony, na początku słód, potem wychodzą nuty chmielowe. Pojawiają się nuty kwiatowe i lekki miód. 
W smaku wyczuwalna goryczka. Nuty słodowe, ale nie są nieprzyjemne. Wyczuwalny też chmiel. 
Piwo dość pełne w odczuciu. 
Spodziewałem się mniej po tym piwie, pozytywnie mnie zaskoczyło.
Not a bad beer, but not a very good one either. Smooth and easy to drink, but not the most pleasant aftertaste.

Pours a clear amber with a huge lasting frothy white head. Some nice bubble action going on. It looks great! Sweet aroma of fruit, caramel malt, light hops and grain. Very mild flavour of sweet malt and grain with a lightly bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2015 Limpida, ambrata, schiuma bianca di buona persistenza, quasi pannosa.
Aroma di malto simile alle pilsner Ceche, leggeri esteri fruttati molto piacevoli "uva passa".
Al palato corpo medio, poco carbonata, molto presente il malto, ben bilanciato dai luppoli, retrogusto amaro gradevole.
Di facile bevuta, adatta a tutte le occasioni, una buona California Common.

Pours copper from 12 oz bottle, clear with thin head. Aroma of grassy pale malt and caramel. Tastes sweetish up front, biscuity, and dominant spicy hoppy aftertaste. Average mouthfeel. Very enjoyable, unique beer with nice blend of caramel malt sweetness and aggressive hopping.
This is a modern classic. Easy drinking, refreshing and very good beer. Enjoy it!
Very average ale with all of the usual malty aromas and bready flavors. Slightly bitter palate.
In mels diner. Uit de fles. Ruikt fris. Smaakt aardig fris, beetje te koud. Verder niet heel speciaal, gewoon prima.
Very smooth, drinkable beer that's not pretentious and provides a nice west coast alternative when you aren't in the mood for an IPA

ENG: 355ml bottle from Liquor Mart in Winnipeg, poured into the Teku. Golden color with thick, but dissipating tan head. Aromas of malts. Tastes like Kölsch. Malty, maybe a bit fruity, caramel, soury and a bit hoppy. Very light, very drinkable and refreshing. Medium carbonation, low to medium body. Palate not too complex.
PL: Butelka 355ml kupiona w Liquor Mart w Winnipeg, przelana do Teku. Barwa złocista, gęsta lecz zanikająca, jasna piana. Aromaty słodowe. W smaku przypomina Kölsche. Słodowe,może nieco owocowe, karmelowe, kwaśnawe i nieco chmielowe. Bardzo lekkie, bardzo pijalne i orzeźwiające. Średnie nasycenie i niskie do średniego odczucie w ustach. Paleta niezbyt rozbudowana.
Ravfarget med høyt skum. Anonym duft med noe gress og lett frukt. Smaken gir assosiasjoner til høstløv med et lite hint av røyk. Ikke veldig spennende.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2015 Bottle. Big off-white head with good retention. Clear slightly deep amber colour. Aroma is mostly malty, fruity, with some hop bitterness and caramel notes. Taste is toasted malt, hop bitterness, fruity, some woody hints. Sligthly bitter aftertaste. Medium-high carbonation, medium body. A god beer not very complex.

Bottle 0.355L.
Deep amber body with large, frothy, off-white head, mostly lasting with some lacing; high density of tiny bubbles.
Moderate malty (grains) and hoppy (orange) aroma.
Moderate sweet flavour with moderate bitter notes; bitter finish.
Light-to-medium body with watery-to-oily texture; lively carbonation.
Amber coloured beer with a white head. Medium carbonation. Really nice ale. Malts and a hint of caramel make this beer. Really smooth finish. Beautiful ale.

Amber color dark with a white foaming and high that lasts for a short time in your beautiful Shaker cup.
In its aroma there this malt, caramel, a delicious aroma of wet grass give a refreshing touch.
The taste clearly there is the presence of caramel malt and hops that refers to a herbaceous with soft bitterness. Very pleasant to drink.
Its aftertaste is dry and again the slight feeling of bitterness is present, but there is at its bottom the sweet malt and a touch of bread. This persists bitterness in the mouth and brings a smoked light after a while. Very interesting.
Good beer and a high drikability. On hot days is an excellent value.
Pours an amber from a bottle, sort of the modern classic of this style, hoppy, malty, round mouthfeel but not heavy. Slightly sweet and slightly bitter. Good beer.

12 oz bottle. Appearance is dark amber color with light, off-white head. Aroma is sweet caramel with some herbal and citrus notes. Taste is weighted toward the malt sweetness with heavy caramel flavor with some toast. Palate is light- to medium-bodied, somewhat thin texture, sweet finish.

White, frothy head. Amber, clear, perlage. Fairly intense and persistent at nose. grass, spruce, citrus. Good carbonation. Roasted malt taste in the beginning and a soft bitter thereafter. A bit astringent.

Poured a thick foamy white head but doesnt stick around long. Good lacing and retention. Has a clearer amber colour. Aroma of malts, grains. Flavour is lightly hopped, various citric tastes and some bitterness. Mouthfeel is nice, tangy, some carbonation. A very pleasant brew.

draught @ Cph Appearance: pours clear amber with ok soapy white head and some lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, bread, toffee, nuts, and fruity notes. palette: medium carbonation, medium body, some caramel sweetness, average bitterness, medium duration, dry finish and an oily texture. Overall: decent, but a bit thin steam beer
Amber with a medium white head. Aroma is bread, caramel, herbal (eucalyptus, mint), citric. Same in taste. Bittersweet aftertaste.

In the decades before the regeneration of American brewing this was probably a very good beer. It has been been completely eclipsed by much better efforts since, even though its still quite acceptable. And the label is very nice.
Orangish-yellow body & thin white head that disappears quickly. Little or no aroma and the taste is sweet, slightly metallic. Slight aftertaste, no bad but nothing exceptional.

Bottle from Masuyos. Poured into an English tulip pint. Pours copper with a moderate off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aromas of malt, grass and mint. Taste similar with caramel malt and bread noticeable. Well-balanced. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Good carbonation. Refreshing finish.

bottle poured in lager glass. nice copper-amber color with moderate head. grassy, malty aroma. great caramel malt taste with a mild grassy taste, grains and low-moderade bitterness, very tasty, awesome beer. loved it.
Malty aroma with notes herb notes. Clear copper colour. Caramel flavour with bready notes. Medium body with lively carbonation. Pleasant and refreshing.
Bottle. Pleasant amber color with good foam. Aroma: malty, woody, mint and herbal. Taste: malty, touch of caramel, light fruity, grainy, a little hop bitterness.

ASPETTO: ambrato non intenso, con schiuma leggermente giallognola, non molto abbondante e abbastanza persistente. AROMA: caramellato e floreale soprattutto, con note erbacee. GUSTO: appena messa in bocca, emerge soprattutto un caramellato abbastanza dolce, che poi evolve presto in un amarognolo non sempre molto gradevole. Retrogusto amarognolo e abbastanza persistente. Corpo leggero, carbonizzazione medio/bassa. CONCLUSIONE: birra dissetante e abbastanza interessante, ma senza troppe pretese.
Clear amber, medium white head. Light roasty aroma. Sweet, roasty, very resfreshing taste. Finishes a bit bitter and overall lovely. Need a second one.

Barwa: ciemnozłote, jasnobursztynowe, lekko zmętnione. 
Piana: obfita, jasnokremowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, niestety dość szybko opada.
Zapach: średnio intensywny słodowy, lekkie nuty opiekane. 
Smak: słodowy z wyraźną goryczką o ziołowo, herbacianym charakterze. 
Wysycenie: średnie, odpowiednie.

355ml bottle into glass. Caramel malt nose. Almost fudge. Slight tan head. Copper beer with minimal carbonation. Watery zingy taste followed by smoky malt and a touch of metallic hops. Its OK but I enjoyed their other beers more.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear copper color, about a finger of white head that dissipates slowly into a fluffy film. Aroma is light caramel malts, grainy, hay, light sweetness. Taste is pretty mellow, not very sweet, not bitter. A faint caramel flavor is present with a bit of bread and grain. Palate is light body, high carbonation. Not my favorite, but drinkable.

Pours a clear amber beer with a big, light beige head.
Smells malty, some caramel, some yeast.
Tastes bitter.
Mouthfeel is non alcoholic and rather watery.
Aftertaste is a very gentle bitter. 
Okay beer.
Very rich smell of caramel, corn and yeast. Pours clear amber with a white head. Tastes sweet of caramel and corn, has almost a oily mouthfeel with a lot of CO2.

Poured from a bottle. Nice effervescent bubbly head. Nice lacing. Good fragrance of caramel and malt that lingers throughout the session.taste is caramel and malt backed by a grassy even-keeled bitterness. sweet without being cloying. Dry finish. Easy drinking. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is a must for every collection. It is amber and has a strong head. It is a san francisco treat that is rich and well balanced.
Bottle, bb 8.2016. Amber color, very nice creamy head with small bubbles and nice lacing. Nice sweet, malty aromas. Bitterness low to medium. Worth trying, although do not expect too much.

Pours a clear medium amber with a touch of ruby. World Class head volume, lacing and retention.

Nice light nose of caramel and biscuit.

Heavy light bodied with a touch of creamy texture. Above normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a nice burst in the finish.

The flavor profile is reasonably intense, fairly well balanced and slightly complex. It begins with a moderate earthy bitterness that slowly fades to a mild caramel and biscuit sweetness. The middle has a slight lemon zest like citrus note. The finish is a slow fade of earthy and zest bitterness that lingers.
Went through a fair bit of this on honeymoon in USA nice creamy head that left nice rings through pint pours amber colour medium carbonation a well rounded drink.

Backlog rating. 12oz bottle from Utobeer, London. It pours a slightly hazy orange color with a lightly tan head. Aroma is lightly sweet and malty, and medium crispy and citrusy, lightly grainy. Taste is lightly caramel and malty, and medium piny and citrusy hoppy. Finishes dry and grainy. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, not bad

This beer pours a transparent amber color with a thick creamy white head that stayed throughout the entirety of the beer and left great lacing around the glass. There is quite a bit of carbonation bubbles floating to the top.The aroma barley, grassy, some breadiness. The taste is roasted barley malts with a nice hop presence mixed in there as well. The mouthfeel is on the medium side and it finished rather dry. This is a great beer worth a try.

Mooi wit schuim dat lekker lang staat. Amberkleurig licht goud bier. Zachte bitters. Lekker maar niet heel uitgesproken. @hone

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,355 l bottle, best before 5/2016. Clear, light amber with a small, frothy or creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Weak aroma of nuts, raisins and toffee. Sweetish, malty taste of nuts, raisins, toffee and honey. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, flat carbonation. Short, slightly bitter and pleasant finish. Not a real explosion of aroma and taste but highly quaffable and tasty. Very nice!

Ah the famous Anchor steam beer, by some metrics America's only truly indigenous-origin style beer. As described, it is indeed a crossover between a lager and an ale. Pours a very nice clear amber orange color, with a large creamy head and plenty of lacing, very lager-ish. The nose is brown sugar caramel malt and some grassy hops, moderate intensity. The taste is very intriguing and flavorful, caramel maltiness balanced with an earthy/grassy bitterness, almost a caramel malt-accented pilsner. Bonus is the tropical fruity finish, which is more reminiscent of an ale, combined with a slick earthy bitterness. Very delicious, but in my experience this seemed to be excessively carbonated which detracted from the texture and distracted from the flavor. Still quite enjoyable and drinkable, this would be an ideal table beer.
Nice red shining color. Minimal head. Some malty aroma. Taste is quite flat and aroma is missing. Starts quite neutral, in the middle comes some bitterness.
Clear medium amber with an of white head, almost no lacing. Taste is creamy and with floral hints, pilsner like yeast and faint fruity hops. Aftertaste of tropical fruits and candy.

Amber red hue. Crackery crispness of a lager, clean lager aroma. Mildly hopped with a lasting bitterness 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear amber body and a rocky white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus, grass. The taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Medium body oily texture, and soft carbonation.
Tympeähkö ja alumiininen maku. Ei niin hyvä, mutta hieno pullo. Ja pihalla iso myrsky.
Blood orange colour with small white head. Decent body. Very malty aroma - flavours based on the grassy pilsener base but with added sweetness from the malts and some tangy fruit.

Pours hazy pale amber with one finger of creamy ivory head diminishing gradually to a thick cap, spotty lacing. (4/5) Nose is caramel malt, grassy and herbal. (6/10) Taste is moderate sweet, mild bitter. (6/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry mildly bitter finish. (4/5)

Not bad for a malty beer. Decently well-balanced malt sweetness that doesnt overwhelm and finishes reasonably dry and bitter. Pretty sessionable, Id say. (12/20)
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
Pours copper with pretty much no head. Aroma of malt and mapple. Very strong taste of malt. Quite nice.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear, orange amber colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma of caramel, some bready malt, grass, subtle pine and herbal hops. Taste of caramel, bready malt, slight grass, subtle pine, a little orange and herbal hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A crisp, caramel, citrus bitterness in the finish. Goes down well with a surprisingly smooth, caramel finish. Nice, easy drinking steam beer.

Bottle. Pours light red color, with small-medium head. In aroma are grass and toast. In flavor also dominates toastiness with some grassines and caramel. Has some character of czech pilsner, but is more bitter. Overall: simple beer, with noy too much complexity. Very drinkable.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Excellent session beer, amber in color. Taste is light caramel and subtle hops with a nice dry finish.

Clear amber, minimal cream head
Caramel, brown sugar
Caramel, brown suga, hops
Simple but not banal
Excellent session beer, amber in color. Taste is light caramel and subtle hops with a nice dry finish.

Very clear orange color with a medium white foam, pleasant aroma of caramel (eyes closed it seems a bock) with some moderate fruity hints given by the yeast, as moderate is the use of the hop. Medium carbonation, medium body, really well balanced with a bitter and long lasting finish. Its the fist time I taste a california common so I dont have any comparison, all I know is that Id better have bought two bottles instead of one.

Flasche (355 ml) von Bierlieb, Berlin. - Rotgold bis kupferrot, fast klar; schwache Schaumbildung. - Geruch sehr mild: etwas Karamelmalz, schwache Frucht (Apfelsaft), ein wenig Pappe. - Antrunk schlank karamelmalzig aber kaum süß, mit milden obergärig-fruchtigen Noten. Stark rezent, limonadenartig, etwas dünnes Mundgefühl. Im Abgang trocken und gut hopfenbitter aber ohne ausgeprägte Hopfenaromen, nur ein wenig Heu. - Ein wenig enttäuschend: von einem Dampfbier hatte ich mehr Druck erwartet. Aber von Hopfenvolldampf (M. Rudolf) kann hier keine Rede sein.
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 An incredible beer. Quaffable, moorish and satisfying. Perfect amount of bitterness. The best beer I have ever had!

Amber with an inch and half of medium-coarseness head that fades at a moderate-to-slow rate. Aroma is grass, some lager-yeast notes, light caramel. Flavor is the same with more caramel and a soap/mineral note that is typically found in some English yeasts, on top of slight lager notes. Palate is syrupy-watery, moderate heaviness. Could be lighter. Overall, a nice session, maltier than I had expected.

Ambrée brune-orangée claire. Translucide. Mousse blanche disparaissant rapidement.
Maltage toasté et caramel. Houblonnage herbeux/mentolé assez discret.
En bouche bel équilibre, avec une un côté crisp genre lager. Amertume légère, saffirmant en fin de bouche. Plutôt sèche. Disons que la légende est plus grande que la bière... bien mais pas inmanquable.
How: Bottle. Appearance: Amber, white head. Aroma: Floral, grass, raisins, citrus Palate: Medium body, average carbonation.
341ml bottle. Clear and amber. Medium head. Low carbonation. Slightly bitter, medium sweetness.
Looks orangy with little foam. The taste is somewhat body focused. A bit watery and weird.
Orange color with medium head. A touch of fruit and sweet malts. Smooth mouthfeel, refreshing, easy to drink. Something different, but nothing special either. Its alright.

Aroma: sweet malts, caramel, herbs. Taste: biscuit, brown sugar, hops and sweet malts. Very drinkable and refreshing. Medium head, average lacing and medium carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 13PLN (0,3 bottle)
Extremely drinkable.. Bought a six pack and I'm pretty sure I'll make it disappear before the afternoon is done. Island life
Robe ambrée. Nez simple, houblon et épices. Bouche assez simple mais souple, fraîche et épicée. Une bière basique mais qui se marie bien au Hamburger.

Poured from bottle, clear amber with medium off white head. Aroma with notes of toast, caramel, herbs and some hay. Taste is bitter sweet, medium bodied with a dry half bitter finish. Nice beer, but an odd one.

Appealing transparent amber hue. No head. Nice caramel, malt, pastry aroma. Smooth and refreshing, mid bodied. Initial taste is smooth caramel, malt, and a touch of brown sugar. Finish contains these same flavours with a quaint addition of hop that lingers for several seconds. Wonderful.
Caramel, roasty, spruce, herbs, leather, alcohol, woody. Easy drinking, slightly fizzing after taste.
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Flaska från SB. Svag doft av jäst. Syrlig, lite metalisk blaskig smak. Lätt efterbeska.
Flaska systembolaget. Kopparfärgad med lätt vitt skum. Maltig och brödig doft med russin och lite vanilj. En lätt syrlig smak. Blöt kartong och bitterhumle. Tunn med viss strävhet
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.
On tap poured into shaker a orange tinted gold with tan head and lace. Aroma was carmel malts as was taste. It was sweet with a medium body. Okay.
Bottle. orange-yellow pour, medium white head. Caramel malt aroma, bread, some fruit. taste is a little sweeter. Fizzy medium body.

355 ml bottle from a six purchased at Sobeys Liquor, served in a shaker pint. I love the shape and size of Anchors bottles; theyre handsomely cute, or vice versa. Pours a slightly hazy. light orange-amber hue with an orangey-tan, puffy, well-retained cap and streaks of lace. Sweetly and freshly fragranced with malt and citrusy hops; the flavor has reduced malt sweetness, with nice, lightly earthy, piney hop bitterness, leading to a clean finish that allows the bitterness to linger a short while. Good, robust mouthfeel and somewhat dry. A really nice, characterful American lager, bringing together elements of pilsners and ales harmoniously. It reminds me of Sam Adams Boston Lager in a sense (which I shall soon review). Anchor definitely does it right.
Its a beer and I am a American Pale ale man, so not a fair rating really. Clearly a quality drink, cant see thru it. Good tasting beer
Bottle common room, sheffield. Clear amber with a good white head. Aroma of dry grass and grain, some faint citrus. Taste is bright and bitter. prickly with a thin body.
Out the bottle. slight bitterness, but little flavor. Slight hint of caramel malt. Barley!

Pours an orange amber with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus hops and some caramel. Sweet taste with almost no bitterness. Light body with an average carbonation. Some sourness at the end. A bit thin overall.
Das Bier ist ganz okay. Ein typischer recht leichter Ammi. Löscht den Durst gut. Ein sehr brauchbares Alltagsbier.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Keg at the Blue Moon, Cambridge. A trifle hazy. Scent of lemon and coriander, bordering on Witbier. Taste is glorious chalky floral sweet, with edges of mango, lemon, shortbread and coconut water. I cant believe how good this is, and that Im trying it for the first time at the age of 42. A fantastic hybrid ale.

Aromaty słodowe, zbliżone do popularnych lagerów. Piana pełna średnich pęcherzy, szybko opada. Barwa jasnego bursztynu, pełna klarowność. W smaku nic zachwycającego. Wysoka słodowość i trochę krótkiej goryczki. Minimalnie lepsza wersja popularnego lagera.
Malt, caramel, a distinct bite of bitterness in the end that is a real creeper. This is a refreshing and straightforward brew while still having something special about it.
Rated from notes taken 21 March 2012 -- It has been quite a long time since Ive tried this beer. It is quite good.
amber in colour slight white head i got biscuit in the aroma and taste a little sweet but bitter on the finish a good beer

Pours a clear, a bit darker amber color, topped with a generous off-white head. Pleasant and mild hoppy aroma, some grassy and herbal notes. Taste starts a bit sweet, immediatelly followed by nice hoppiness and some bitterness in the finish. Slight grassy notes. Nicely drinkable.

Bottle BBE: 1/2016. Lightly chilled. Crystal clear amber body with full, thick, tight off-white head. High carbonation evident. Biscuity aromas with honey and vanilla sweetness, gentle floral notes and a slight barnyard essence. Medium sweetness followed by a crisp bitterness, a well-balanced if simple taste. Fairly high carbonation, but not overly fizzy. Light body concealed well by a foamy texture. Short to medium finish. A classic, highly-drinkable beer that doesnt offend.
Bue en bouteille de 355ml. Superbe équilibre pour cette bière exceptionnelle. Du bonheur à chaque gorgée.
12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass..copper with a fluffy white head..aroma of malts,some hops..crisp,malty with light hop profile..not my style.

Mild tasting, with a moderate hop presence. It really does, in some ways, have chars of both a lager and ale. Thanks to the new hop guide, I can say that I dont like Northern Brewer hops as a finish/aromatic hop. The hop aromatics and flavors in this beer present as a slightly woody and earthy/musty note that I dont find particularly agreeable.

From 345 ml bottle. Clear honey-Amber in the glass with a creamy lasting white head. Aromas of cut grass, raisins, honey and light citrus. Starts out with a sweet malty note thats quickly overtaken by firmer grass and grapefruit hop flavours. Finishes quite cleanly with a gently fruity aftertaste. Nice.

Bottle from a 980 yen tasting set at Liquor Mountain with a free glass! Steam Beer - the classic that introduced an indigenous California beer & helped kicked off the craft beer movement.
