A deep copper color pour with a solid beige head with nice lacing and staying power. A big malty caramel nose with enticing fruit overtones. Medium to light bodied with a somewhat abrasive carbonation but it does give a very dry finish. The taste is malty caramel, some fruits and more bitter than I expected but it has a crisp flavor and each sip makes me want to go back for more. Better than expected.
Pours brilliant amber thin white head. Fruity aroma woody hops. Light malty body balanced bitterness a little rough some slight oxidation.

12 Oz bottle. Pours clear amber with a frothy white head. Aromas are fairly subtle, cereal grain and minerals, some apricot. Flavor is mild sweet, worth cereal grain and some cherry at first. Quickly transitions to an herby hop bitterness that lingers throughout, with some nutty notes at the end. Medium-low body with a slick mouthfeel and sharp carbonation. Overall, just ok. Not very complex, and while tasty enough, nothing noteworthy on any of the fronts.
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 Aroma maltado-amadeirado. Amargor suave. É a cerveja mediana, sem nenhum grande diferencial, exceto o aroma.
Pours clear copper. Just above medium amount of white head. Bitter. Caramel and malt flavour. Light body, medium carbonation.

Lunica California Common bevuta, si presenta di color ambrato e con poca schiuma, al naso sentori malto-caramellosi , che si ritrovano anche nel palato, ben bilanciati da una nota fruttata. Molto beverina e piacevole, anche se non se ne percepisce gli aromi da luppolo.
Bottle. Clear copper color with tiny head. Aroma - Caramel, apples. Toffee taste.

Honey-golden clear with a hunch of yeasty hue hazyness, lasting small white head. Aromas of fruit is predominant with some biscuity malt centre. 
Softly carbonated, light texture, light-medium bodied with a fruit-malt flavour in harmony. Lingers a while with some dry out bitterness developing.
A Nice convenience beer. Fresh and redy to drink on a bar or to a barbaque.
smells of nothing, cloudy dark gold body, thin white head, tastes sweet with a dry mildly bitter hop finish.
A nice basic ale. Pours a bright Amber with a thick white head. Smells of citrus, tropical fruit, and oats. Taste is well balanced, with more citrus and oatiness. Had in the bottle.

Bottle from the LCBO. BB 07/2016. Pours clear amber colour with nice off-white head. Nose is mild hebal/floral hops and sweet malt. Taste follows the nose with a bit of bitterness. Caramel, sweet malt, a touch fruity, with some hop bitterness. Nice lager, crisp.
Bottle. Hazy, orange, rocky head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, lively, & long finish.
Un aroma suave con cuerpo medio y trago lento. Amarga y notas de alcohol por encima de lo esperado

Appearance- Clear amber with a long lasting, thick white head. Nice lacing.
Aroma- Not much aroma, some hops and malts, a touch of citrus
Flavor- Rich caramel malts, nice bitter hop finish. Earthy and bitter.

Aroma is on the low side with caramel and malts dominating. The taste is distinct with a rather sharp moutfeel. Soft malts, slightly fizzy and bubbly, some pears and apricots in there and a semi-dry finish. When coming to the style California Common, this is the benchmark.
Medium white head, chestnut golden clear colour, malty sweet yeasty smell, medium carbonation and bitter, malts taste creamy mouth feeling

Bottle. Bright clear light brown/orange. Aroma is spiced toasted malt. The crafts adds bread crust and caramel. Medium body and carb with a semi-rich mouthfeel. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Copper/brown typical appearance. Taste of sweet malt. Not much character. Its OK
Pours a nice mahogany color with nice foamy head. Aroma of malt and bread/biscuits. Good balance of bitterness, hops and sweetness.
Mild sweet aroma, mild hopps, moderate bitter, very frothy, overall not my favorite.

@ bartlebiers and oldmanrivers instructive beer seminar. Fruity nose with bubblegum and orange marmelade streaks, very balanced taste, nice caramel-malty background for fruity, esp orange notes again, light and dry, good mouthfeel, low bitterness towards the end.

Butelka 0.33L.
Wygląd: Bursztynowe, klarowne z iskrą. Obfita drobnopęcherzykowa piana w kolorze ecru, trwała i firnakuje.
Aromat: Słodki, słodowy, miód wielkokwiatowy, toffee, wafel, jasny biszkopt, melasa, lekka metaliczność, w tle nugat i estry.
Smak: Słodkie, przypalony cukier, karmel, ziemiste nuty chmielowe, trochę ziołowe. Goryczka niska ale pozostawiająca długi ziemisty posmak.
Odczucie: Ciało niskie do średniego, faktura papierowo-lagerowa z suchym finiszem za którym nie przepadam, nasycenie CO2 powyżej średniego.
Całość: Całość nie wybijająca się, choć pewnie w stylu poprawne. Czuć, że to drożdże lagerowe ale wyczuwalne również estry od wysokiej temperatury fermentacji.

"this is another one that i avoided early, but over time i enjoyed it a little more. its nothing great (maybe inherant to the style), but its pleasant enough, with a light mahogony body, pretty good blance with a slightly sweet aftertaste. Just a little weak for me, personally, but a well done beer for the style."

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 Bottle @ home. Pours with a bright orange clear colour, big medium lasting frothy off-white head. Aroma is medium malty with notes of bread, slightly hoppy. Taste is medium sweet, slightly bitter, slightly sour, nice. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Good session beer (its 4.9 ABV alright, but it feels like one; a very pleasant one!)

Poured from bottle to glass. Copper hue with fizzy tan head that settled. Aroma is bready, cereal, slight sulphur,banana, clove. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness followed by a spicy hop bitterness and a slightly sulphur finish. Overall this is a good brew.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 Small bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Beautiful clear orange-amber color. 2 fingers creamy head.
S: Fresh and earthy malts basically. Caramel is also evident in the nose. Good.
T: Good, basically :). Earthy malts and some hints of caramel. Bitter hoppiness in the end. Very American (as expected)
M: Medium carbonation. Balanced bitterness. Medium body. Again, good.
D: High. Delicious beer. Im definitely moving to USA! :p So that I can spend a barbecue evening enjoying all those refreshing and delicious beers...
[ BA Review @ 2/20/2010 ]
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden, nose is toffee, floral, taste is sweet, toffee.

Clear bright copper with a thin rocky white head. Beer-y nose with toasted biscuity lager malts and a bit of creamy nougat, but its all dry smelling. Earthy bitter start with dry toast and a bit of biscuit lagery tones, with a drying earthyold-world-hop tone.
Bottle at bar. Poured rust orange with a finger high white head. Smells of hay, grass and fresh air. Tastes passible bitter with a nice fullness and carbonation. Enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Una birra nata dalla grande tradizione americana e da un famosissima birrificio sulla west coast che però non riesce a stupire. Una birra lineare caratterizzata dalla importante maltazione che dona aromi caramellati e leggermente tostati orfani però di una adeguata luppolatura. Risulta una birra piuttosto squilibrata e tendente al dolce difficilmente soppotabile per una intera pinta.

Degustazione dalla spina:
Cambiano di poco le sensazioni della bottiglia. Il caramello e gli aromi tostati della maltazione non sono adeguatamente accompagnati dalla luppolatura quasi assente. Corpo medio per una birra beverina ma ben poco ammaliante.
Pours hazy amber with a medium off-white head. Malty in aroma and taste. Pretty boring, but I guess this is what a California common should be. A good everyday beer.
Hazy deep amber color, average sized off white head that quickly disappeared. Medium body, average carbonation. Aroma of dark fruits, yeast, bread, bubblegum. Medium sweet taste. Interesting.
Curiosa cerveza de aroma difícil de explicar, muy ligera en boca y color ambarino con burbuja fina
No conocia este variedad de cervezas pero me ha sorprendido mucho. Un sabor un tanto extraño pero agradable
33 cl systembolaget. Drack denna hemma hos Anna och Joakim. En riktigt fräsch öl som passar en sommardag eller som denna på midsommarafton!
From a tap at the brewery. The pour is clear amber .its thin body with caramel, hops, smooth.

Appearance: Pours a clear bronze amber colour with minimal sudsy head. 

Aroma: Strong caramel malt character with a backdrop of fresh-baked raisin bread. The hop profile is fairly bright and floral with just a few traces of herbaceousness and dried leaves. 

Taste/palate: Light bodied texture with lively carbonation that refreshes the palate with toasty cereal grains and halloween toffee flavours balanced by a fairly dry, lightly bitter and brief finish. 

Overall: This isnt a showcase beer. Its not going to blow your mind. This beer does a few things well but it only does a few things. Its well-made and well-balanced and I think most people would drink it and enjoy it. I would definitely have it again and recommend it to others. Sadly though, its certainly not a thinking beer and those looking for something complex will likely be disappointed. That being said, its certainly well above average stuff.

Bottle, pours golden, slightly cloudy with white quickly vanishing head. Aroma is fruity with some malts in background. Light bitterness, bready, malty with bit of fruits. Average carbonation, light body, malty aftertaste.

From backlog. Tap. Had this many times. Pours a clear golden orange color with a 1 cm thick creamy head that hangs around nicely, leaves lacing too. Aroma is bananas and cream. Taste is very creamy with just a touch of bananas and pale malt. Fairly thick mouthfeel. Overall, its easy to drink and a solid change up to my normal stuff.
I thought this beer had a very alcohol undertone but has a good color, appearance and aroma.

Nice, clear, copper color with a white head. Aroma is a sweet, grainy malt with some earthiness. Tastes biscuity, grainy, a quickly disappearing touch of caramel; grainy, earthy finish. Medium bodied palate, lively carbonation

Transfer from BA review on 10-10-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a nice amber-copper color with a big billowy just off white head. The head has a fantastic level of retention, very slowly fading over about a 5-10 min time period to leave a light level of streaky lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is mainly a mix of some more grainy smells mixed with a caramel sweetness. Along with these aromas there are some lighter hop smells of an earthy nature and a bit of grass.

 Taste  The taste begins with a dry bready and grainy flavor with a bit of an earthy taste. There is a light caramel sweetness throughout the taste that is most intense at the beginning (although still very light) which almost disappears toward the end of the taste. While the taste has a hop bit at the start with the earthy tastes, more hop of a grassy and light citrus nature come to the tongue bittering the taste as it moves on. Some woody flavors come to the tongue more toward the end of the taste, with the combination of flavors leaving a rather dry, malty and decently bitter flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the average side in terms of thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is average to just above average. Both the moderate body and carbonation are rather good for the mix of dry and bitter flavors, making it a good easier drinking brew.

 Overall  A nice dry tasting steam beer that is very easy to drink. A good go too for something on the lighter side.
Slight earthy aromas alongside hay. Malty toasty with some residual sweetness. Carbed moderately, pleasant.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass
Aroma- strong toasted malt, nice smell
Appearance- Vibrant amber color with thick white head.
Taste- Strong malt flavor with a solid hop finish
Palate- Medium body with moderate carbonation 
Overall- an excellent example of a California Steam Beer. Highly recommended
Pours copper/orange with a white head. Aroma is toffee, apples, grapefruit. Taste is toffee again, earthy hops.

Bottle pour. Pours a copper color with a lasting white head. Sugary malt aroma. Flavor has some sweet malt, mild hops, and a little bready too. Decent flavor with a mild bitter hop finish. Not a bad beer here. New to the style personally. Pretty good.

Orange/Gold body with thin frothy white head, great lacimg. Aroma has apricot, peach, and some subtle hop notes. Normal to elevated carbonation with normal alcohol. Crisp and dry on the palate. Very sessionable.

Zapach z butelki: Słodowo-arbuzowy.
Piana: Jasnobeżowa, drobno- i średniopęcherzykowa. Średnio obfita, średnio trwała. Trochę oblepia szkło, redukuje się do kożuszka.

Kolor: Jasnobursztynowe, opalizujące z zawieszonymi drobinkami.

Zapach: Słodowo-owocowy. Przewijają się aromaty takie jak arbuz, melon, śliwka mirabelka, nektarynka. Ze strony słodowej na drugim planie nutka orzecha laskowego, delikatna nutka karmelu.

Smak: Podbudowa średnia, słodowa. Delikatna karmelowość, subtelna owocowość w typie jabłek, winogron. W kontrze do słodyczy bardzo delikatna, cytrusowa kwaskowość.

Tekstura: Ciało średnio-pełne. Piwo gładkie, otulające podniebienie. Nie jest ściągające, nie pozostawia osadu. Mimo to na finiszu pojawia się jednak minimalna szorstka cierpkość.

Nasycenie: Średnio-wysokie.

Goryczka: Średnio-wysoka, grejpfrutowa.

Pijalność: Bardzo wysoka.

Świetnie pijalne piwo, bardzo sesyjne o świetnym zbalansowaniu. Ilość atrakcji jest spora, choć nie jest to eksplozja przebojowości jak w Old Foghorn Ale. Pamiętajmy jednak, że w tym piwie są zupełnie inne parametry. Efekt hybrydowej działalności drożdży okazuje się być bardzo przyjemny. W zasadzie jedynym problemem tego piwa jest jego dostępność oraz cena po przełożeniu na polskie warunki (porównaniu z innymi propozycjami w tym zakresie cenowym). Pomimo braku uderzenia amerykańskich chmieli, charakter piwa jest niewątpliwie w nurcie ducha rewolucyjnego. Gorąco polecam.
Bottle; pours an orangish amber with an eggshell colored head; has a sweet citrus and malt aroma; taste is sweet with caramel and malt; finish is wet with a light bitter hop aftertaste; decent beer

Served on-tap at the The Batdorf into a standard pint.


A - Pours orange-ish yellow with a small one finger tall white head leaving spotty lacing down the glass.


S - Smells of lightly toasted sweet buiscuity malt, earthy hops, and a touch of spice toward the end. Simple yet enjoyable.


T - The taste is pretty similar to the nose. Hints of sweet caramel malt, earthy hops, light spice, and the ever present buiscuity feel. The flavors are simple yet enjoyable. It goes down easy and often.


M - Medium-Light body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Light body with some lingering buiscuity sweetness in the finish.


O - This is my favorite Cali common. The flavors are simple and it is extremely easy drinking. I am glad we are finally starting to see more Anchor products in our area.

Bottle. Interesting history, nice label and bottle. Really wanted to like this, but truth is when it comes to taste this is just another boring beer. There is some lingering flavor, maybe citrusy, but just weak overall. Dont understand what all the fuss is about.
Bottle at home from Obriens. Pours amber with froth white head. Lots of bread, yeast malts. Flavour follows nose. Lasting flavour. Decent beer.

355 ml bottle. Pours a rather clear pale orange amber with a short lived white head. Aroma is caramel, fruits. Flavor is fruity, coppery, caramel. Finish is earthy, metallic-mineral. Lingering grassy notes. Medium body, average carbonation.

Vycap Richtar Jakub. Jantarova farba, biela pena. Vona citrusova, kvetinova. V chuti sladovost, citrusove tony, kvetinove tony, lahko alkohol a celkom prijemna horka dochut. Telo stredne, prijemna nasytenost, osviezujuce.

Has a nose of bready, grainy lightly roasted malts and some very light citrus. Pours a deep amber with a very small head that dissipates quickly with no lacing. Malt heavy taste. Sweet caramel and bread malts. Little bit of lemon rind with a squeeze of orange. Goes down easy, with a good amount of carbonation. Overall, not a bad beer, but wouldnt go out of my way to have it.

Bouteille 355ml. Couleur orange citrouille translucide, mousse beige laissant une légère dentelle. Arôme de malt, banane, pâte à pain. Goût de malt, noisette léger, légère amertume en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps faible.
Caramel aroma, lager-esque clear amber color, yeasty caramel flavor with slightly bitter after taste.
Tasty and good. I really like this beer becuase of its distinctive flavor.

My first experience with a non-national microbrew beer, before the term existed, in 1980s San Francisco. Enjoyed many times since then. Full bodied, malty, but well balanced with hops. Good character.

Pours bright, golden amber with a lot of head. The aroma is malty and rich, and so is the flavor. This beer is dry, slightly citrus, and a little bitter, but the finish is really mellow. It really does have a character thats a little different from other beers. I like it.

(Flasche) Es hat eine bernsteinerne Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weissen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist suess wie Honig, mit wuerzigem Hopfen und einer spritzig herben Kopfnote. Der Geschmack ist sehr schlank, spritzig und sehr bitter. Die Bittere bleibt lange und hat ein breites starkes und gruenes Aroma im Rachen. Der Abgang ist sehr bitter mit einer Spur von Honig.

Poured from bottle into pilsner/ lager glass. Clear gold color with thin white head . Smells stale- ish and malty/ yeasty/ lager-y. Tastes like crisp malt/ blandish yeast. Palate is crisp/ fresh/ not too carbonated. Basically, the best of the style (yeah,I know thats subjective).
Amber with off-white head. Nice and smooth. Tasted barley and maybe pine. Was just okay.
Bottle. Pour is gold with a small head, aroma is sweet candy. Taste is bitter with light fruity notes in the distance and a bitter finish with light metallic notes. Good
Pours amber color, bright white head, nice lacing. Aroma and flavor are very lager-like. OK.

Bottle. Pours clear amber. Large beige head. Sweet and Malty with spruce needles, toffee, bread, hints of citrus, fruits,  pear and grass. Very Smooth mouth feel, similar taste with a sweet finish and balanced bitterness.

The aroma of toffee and caramel. The taste of toffee, bread and hints of caramel. Good bitterness as not become too heavy. The aftertaste sits most of the time in front of the mouth for a long time. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Poured from the bottle, this is what beer looks like. Its glowing amber color and thick (!) foamy head provide a backdrop for a soothing upward cascade of bubbles from the bottom of the glass. The malty but crisp aroma presents a nice combination of bready sweetness and mossy bitterness. The flavor likewise exhibits good depth while still being quite drinkable. The must hop profile is more pronounced over the malty base, and there is some tangy yeastiness to add further complexity. The beer is substantial on the tongue but smooth, which once again makes this one flavorful yet drinkable. Overall, there isnt anything here that isnt normally found in other beers, but this has some kind of character that makes it stand out.
Nice light malt aroma. Clear golden amber colour with good head. Nice smooth caramel malt flavours with smooth toffee finish. Medium body with low carbonation.
Dark amber beer, slightly tepid in flavour with a hint of caramel, left a bit disappointed by this beer.
Dark orange color with white head. Touch of grain and malt.Some hop and malt in the taste. good one.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Rich and malty start followed by a pleasant medium bitterness. Fruity, clean, smooth, and very refreshing.
Keg at the Faraday, Epsom. Pours mid brown with a thin white head. Metallic aroma, malt and caramel. Sweet finish.

Pours pale, yellow gold with fine pale white head. Aroma is faint hop and yeast. Visibly effervescent. Taste starts slightly sweet malt, then adds a subtle bitter hops note. Overall, the flavors are all very mild, clean, refreshing... it does this remarkably without being "lite" or watery.
Draft in San Francisco. One of my first craft beers so it holds a special place in my heart. Pours a bright orange gold with a nice white head. Nose is grain and malt. Taste adds some bitterness.

Bottle. Pours amber-orange with medium off-white head, lively carbonation. Aroma is caramel, fruity, apple, spicy, sweet malts, custard, citrus. Taste is mostly sweet, little bitterness, but some sourness, not unlike biting an apple. Palate is fizzy, medium. Mild bitter aftertaste. Very pleasant, complex beer that reminds me of my grand mums caramel custard, just a bit more bitter.

shared bottle at a bar. poured a dark amber colour with a off head. bit of a standard aroma. malts, grains, caramel, herbs, metallic aftertaste. herbal hop aftertaste, did not like this beer. bit of a strange mouthfeel
Tap at Stones, Helsinki. Originally rated 2011. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, caramel, grain and malts.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad vätska med två fingrar högt skum. Brödig doft med en antydan av karamell. Neutral beska. Funkar bra en solig sommarkväll.

Smell is malt with a hint of hops. Taste follows the aroma pretty closely. The malt and hops are blending nicely and the taste, while not as strong as some craft beer, is great. This would be a great session beer.

Pours a quite clear deep orange amber colour with small medium head. Smells malty, maple, slightly caramel honey; maybe a bit generic, but nice and fresh. Taste is a good sweet/malt and hoppy/citrus bitter blend, piny, slighlty spicy, very crisp, simple and tasty. Lively carbonation, and not that light bodied as you imagine, quite substantial for being 5%. Its really ok beer, refreshing

BB 11/7/2015. Poured a clear orange-amber colour with a few millimetres of off white bubbles that diminished quickly to a collar that laced poorly. Carbonation low and coarse. Aroma strongly of sweetish caramel malt with no obvious hops. Taste medium sweet caramel malt with a citrus bitterness. Light body. Crisp with a strong malt as well as a slightly tart finish.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2014 The archetypical steam beer after a late-19th-century tradition and arguably the one beer that kicked off the American micro brewery revolution. Thick, dense, stable foam on a purely amber coloured beer; malty and fruity aroma, nuts, grassy hops, soft taste with an appetising, rounded maltiness, sweetish fruitiness and nice peppery hoppiness in the finish. Liked this historical monument a lot back in 2004 and I should definitely find a new one to re-rate.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Klar bärnstensfärgad vätska med lågt vitt skum. Doftar äpple och jäst. Jästig smak och något kryddig. Lite tunn men helt ok.
355 ml bootle, 4.8% amber beer with good foamy white head, although the head does not last long. A light beer, ale-like, barley malt with some fruity sweetness. Balanced and tasty.

Clear amber color, fast disappearing white head. Bubblegum and biscuit aroma. Medium to heavy sweetness. Thin to medium body, average carbonation. Refreshing. Not bad, but expected little bit more. 
(Za Popent 0,35l bottle)
Bottle 355 ml from Za Popent, Ljubljana. Pours orange amber with off-white head. Caramel malty. Medium bodied. Expected a bit more.

A beer I have had many time but has taken years to rate. Pour is dark amber with a off white head. Aroma is malts,wheat and citrus. A great year round beer that is better spring summer and fall. A little like a full body wheat and larger mix. A nice sweetness mix with cereal notes.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2014 Pours a beautiful coppery gold with lots of creamy, fizzy head that sticks around forever. Nose toasted malt, caramel, yeast, a bit of earthy hop dryness. Toasted grain, caramel, with a bit of hay/grass, very nicely balanced with a crisp, clean lager finish. No real bold tastes, nothing intense, just a really well-executed simple beer. The great execution somehow transcends the fairly traditional taste profile, and elevates this beer to near 4/5 status. Not quite as good as their Liberty Ale, IMHO, but very nice.

Bottle split with Sarah at home picked up from the Bottle:Shop St Albans. Aroma is caramel, some earthy sileage, hay, nuts and a touch metalic. Nice light amber / orange coloured pour with a lasting off white head. Clear. Flavour is caramel, nutty malts, melanoidin sugars with some dried fruits, raisin, slight tart berry lingering the finish. Mineral and slight chalk in the water profile. Hops are earthy and some grassy silage. Palate is medium sweet, with quite high carbonation. Slight crisp in the finish. Resembles a best bitter in some ways. Tasty enough malty beer.
Dolçor del malt, caramel pansa i una mica dherba. En boca entra dolça i acaba seca amb fruites pel mig.

Bottle to English pint glass. Pours amber/orange, small head, little lacing. Nose is malty with notes of grass, herbs and yeast. The taste is malty sweet, light bitterness. Light to medium body, little carbonation, slightly creamy mouth feel. Finishes bittersweet with notes of roasted and caramel malts, earthy bitterness and apricot. Not a bad lager.

Clear, amber color with small white head. Wonderfull aroma. Notes of tropical fruits, oranges, grass, apricot - mixed with malty-caramel background. Medium bitterness balanced with medium sweetness. Flavours of malts, caramel, bread, grass, floral. Medium body with medium carbonation. Really good, classic beer.
Amber color, off-white head. Fruity nose, wood, caramel malt, hint of yeast. Sweet malty taste, fruity notes, dry finish. Velvety texture, soft carbonation, light to medium body.

Pored into lager glass. Beer is light amber with a strong carbonation, medium head and gentle haze in the body. Beer has a gentle yeast aroma and the body is light and malty, with a good fizz. Fairly bitter with a touch of sourness in the finish.
Medium-bodied with flavors of caramel malt, orange & apricot. Reminds me of an alt or amber ale with higher carbonation and that lager mouthfeel. Grassy hops to round out the finish.
On tap. Style #73. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma is caramel, fruity, malty. Taste is medium bitter, lightly sweet, caramel, malty, some roasted malt.

12 oz. bottle poured to a Czech-pils glass at Lunar Brewing Co., displaying a clear & bright, orangey gold color, with a frothy/cakey layer of fairly persistent, white head foam, and waves & spots of lacing. The nose was light grain, light yeast, lightly toasted & sweetened malt, and a subtle fruit scent. Light to medium bodied, with fairly lively carbonation, the taste incorporated the aroma notes, and added a moderate, earthy bitterness that lingered with some dryness to form a pleasantly crisp finish. A quite sessionable, benchmark brew that Ive enjoyed many times, and presupposed that I had reviewed.
Citrus.  Medium hops.  Lingering after taste, but tolerable....................

Silky, smooth, pilsner-esque beer with a creamy head. Well balanced with caramel & honey malts & the perfect amount of hops (presumably from the years of perfecting this beer). Unusual without being overwhelming - it is easy to see why this beer has survived over time.

Rated by BrewTom

Tap at Le Senk. Aroma is hoppy, some caramel malt, light fruity. Clear golden colour, heavy white head, stable. Taste is reversed, rather bitter up front and fruity/caramel in a moment. The hops flavour is somewhat dull, without character. Finish is rather short. Overall thin bodied and somewhat dusty. Average.

Snygg etikett, obefintlig "head", ettrig kolsyra, mörk bärnstens färgad, över "pilsner"bäska
Kommer troligen inte köpa denna igen
Bottle. Copper/amber with a big frothy white head. Aroma is sweet fruitiness and lager yeast. Taste adds some caramel and apple. Crisp mouthfeel. Solid and drinkable.
Clear amber color with minimal white head. Thin body. Aroma is a bit of toffee, biscuit, pine.

przyjemny, lekko kwiatowy i owocowy zapach z lekkimi nutami karmelu i słodu. ładny, przejrzysty kolor wypolerowanej miedzi z niewielkim zmętnieniem. piana obfita i dość długotrwała w kolorze złamanej bieli. w smaku pełne, słodowe, ale mimo to dość lekkie i pijalne. wyczuwalne karmelowe nuty. średnia, bardzo czysta goryczka która długo odkłada się w ustach. niskie wysycenie. bardzo pijalne i przyjemne

Bottle from Yamaya. Havent had it for a few years, so lets see. Rich fruity nose, with caramel and light raisiny notes; overall, a very balanced scent. Deep pretty copper/amber color. Malty initial, bittering is a bit rough and scratchy, and a bit piney in finish. Some rusted metal aspect is also apparent. Medium body, and a very pleasant mouthfeel. Mildish, but lots of flavors, pleasant, sessiony stuff. This was probably the first craft beer I ever had, way back in the 70s, while living in the Bay Area. It was definitely more of a special beer in those days.
Pours clear amber with offwhite head. Malty aroma and flavour with fruity, hoppy finish.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2016 Nice looking beer with a good nose and taste, but the bitterness was not the most satisfying kind and a bit of an astringent finish. A good standby, updated from my last rating of 3.1 when I still wasnt too keen on it.

Butelka 355ml.
OCZY : piwo jest dosyć przejrzyste i ma kolor bursztynowy. Piana jest mała o kolorze białym. Świetny lacing. 

NOS : piwo ma aromat karmelu, tosta, gruszki, banana, lodów malaga, drewna, kukurydzy. Delikatnie przypomina zapach whisky. 

USTA : średnio gazowane o konsystencji trochę bardziej gęstej od wody. Puszyste i aksamitne w ustach. 
Słodowe nuty są umiarkowanie słodkie. Przypominają lekko palony karmel i złocisty tost. Piwo delikatnie kwaśnieje na styl goździków i śmietany. Gorycz jest delikatna, zdominowana przez cierpkość podobną do goździków i kwasku cytrynowego. 

ODCZUCIA ; piwo jest świetnie skomponowane i pomimo, że kwaśnieje to po każdym następnym łyku nuty słodowe to niwelują. Piwo łatwe w piciu o ciekawych estrach. Na dłuższą metę może znudzić. Brakuje trwałości w smaku, szczególnie w ciekawych nutach słodowych. 

OCENA : 
smak : 6/10
pijalność : 7/10
styl : +1

Bottle. Want to put a California Common tick on the profile, and what better way to start than to drink the originator? 

A: Dark copper/red with a fluffy white head

N: Biscuit, toffee, malt, cracker, pine notes. (Pine nuts?) Some almond in here. Cereal grains. 

T: Moderately sweet with a undercurrent of hop bitterness. A little toasty.

M: Creamy, carbonated, medium to light body. 

O: A post-hard work, Salinas county/John Steinbeck type beer. Its the type of thing I think about in those descriptions of Old German. Throw it down, theres another coming.
Copper colour whitish head. Sweet caramel with metalic heather aroma. Malt, flower with good metalic aftertaste that lasts.

Color amarillo dorado, media capa de espuma permaneciendo unos mms, aromas muy frutales a pomelo, plátano y malta, en boca entrada de trago muy suave, ya que es una lager fermentada con levaduras de tipo ALE y de estilo propio de Anchor, se aprecia albaricoque con el lúpulo bien integrado, pos gusto con amargor suave y muy equilibrada, por su baja graduación invita a beberse otra.

The highly-touted beer from San Fran that I first read about in The Beer Book, (1982, by Bob Able), was disappointing. Though a good step ahead of "plain beer", IMO, the beer has great difficulty holding any place with the excellent brews we see appearing at the local beer store, today.

Bona cervesa, molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, muy equilibrada y sabrosa.

355 ml bottle. Pours a clear amber orange with a creamy, small, off-white head that laces nicely. Mild aroma of malt and caramel. Malty flavour with a note of caramel and a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with oily texture and lively carbonation.
On tap poured into a pint glass. Nice malty aroma. Sweet grain flavor perfectly balanced with hops. Great carbonation
Fell in love with the beer at first sip. Great level of carbonation and flavours. Need to drink more to isolate individual tastes. Highly recommended.
Clear copper with fair white head. Aroma of malts. Taste slightly too sweet with some bitterness. Goes flat pretty quickly. Drunk very cold it masks the failings.
Très belle couleur ambrée, mousse qui disparait. Nez de caramel doux. Gout doux amer de caramel, houblon et note malté, fin avec petite amertume.
On tap. Pours golden with small white head. Aroma and taste consist of hops, malt and caramel. Good and refreshing drink.

It pours with a thick head. Its a deep gold color with an off white head. It has a vanilla, malty type aroma with a mixture of spices and grass. The grass is prominent with a spicy tinge on the way down.
nice aroma. dark gold and clear in color with good head. taste is nicely balanced and smooth, slight hop finish

Bottle pour. Clean copper with medium white head. Aroma is malt forward, mild grass and straw. Some sweet corn chips. Bready taste, with reserved caramel sweetness. Mildly bitter throughout. Medium carbonation. All in all, a decent representation of the steam beer (tm) style.

Bottle from AmmersinO, Vienna. Clear, copper body, with a medium, creamy, white head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, red berries, grass. Taste with about the same aromas, also some citrus and some sour apple-like fruitiness. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a medium carbonation and it finishes medium bitter and with sweet and sour fruits. Nice, fresh and crisp. Not very complex, but still with interesting malt and hop aromas in a good balance. My first beer of this style, so I cant comment on how good it is compared to others, but I like it.
Classic San Francisco beer. Malty with some caramel. Nice earthy woody hops. Finishes clean. Nice go to beer on a foggy night.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Very nice amber pour with a good retention on the head. Smells of fruit, caramel, and grassy notes. Citrus and malt up front with a bit of a hoppy finish. Nice fruity/hoppy aftertaste.

Tap. Golden beer with small white head. Malty and fruity notes in aroma, also caramel notes present. Flavour is similar to aroma, the beer is dry, medium bitter and weight. Now may seem too normal, but its a refreshing and enjoyable drink.
Bottle from ribs n bibs, Lincoln. Deep golden colour with white head. Sweet floral and yeasty aroma. Taste is bitter, citrus with short sweet finish.

Handsome amber golden beer under a thin, fine head. Pleasant fruity nose of medium intensity, hints of scotch and caramel and grassy hops. Fresh attack with a dry palate and medium, precise hops bitterness. Decent medium weight and a medium finish which leaves apple flavoured acids lingering quite long. Seems a freshmaking beer with some food usefulness.
Deep amber pour, thin white head. Aroma of caramel, not much else. Taste is malty, a little fruity, slightly sweet, finishes dry but not a lot of bitterness.
Bottle at home. Pours slightly amber red. Smells caramel. Like the taste even though there is nothing special about it.
En lite fruktigare, maltigare lager. Krispig och lite lite fruktig. Mycket god men eventuellt lite väl tunn i kroppen.

I think this is one of the first craft beers that came to Sweden. Never understood whats so good about it, but it is better than Mariestads, Pripps, Norrlands and Åbro. Basically a relatively good lager.
Good tasting beer light on the palate but everything else is good will recommend and will drink again excellent by Anchor bre Co.

On tap at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Copper color, clear, thin white head. Aromas of malts, bread, and some earthy hops. Taste pretty much the same, on the sweet side. not so long aftertaste, mildly sweet. Low to medium body, medium carbonation.
Good smelling beer that pours beautifully with a decent head . The only large complaint I have is that it feels very thin on the palate otherwise a tasty beer

It just seems like a great, fancy Lager but thats fine by me if this is what you get out of the deal. It looks like a thinner liquid Werthers and a pillowy foam rests on top. I like strong malt flavours and this has them in spades. Caramel, ancient grains, some spice, toast, nuts and yeast. Light bitter hops to balance it and a creamier mouth make this a great choice.

Served in bottle. 
Malty nose, malty taste with long bitter finish. 
Pretty standard, but nice and crisp beer.
Average carbonation.
16oz draft. Pours a rich amber color with a foamy white head. Not much on the nose: malts. Flavors of malts, copper, and biscuits. Not much going on in this beer but has a refreshing lager finish,
Ist nicht ganz mein Geschmack,werde es aber eventuell nochmal testen. Bis dahin bleibt es bei dieser Bewertung

An American Classic. Beautiful tan color. Little head. Lacing. Lot and lots of bubbles. Sweet clean caramel on nose. Taste is wonderful some hops some sweetness finishes very dry. The classic Anchor yeast is present too. Such an awesome historic beer from the Bay. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Clear copper, small off-white head. Minimal aroma with light malt. Light malt flavours, some stone fruit, sweet mid-section, light bitter finish. Light body, moderate carbonation. OK.

Bottle. Definitely better than a normal lager. Aroma is somewhat woody. It taste of toasty caramel malt, and herbal hop notes. Quite a lively carbonation on it, with dry hoppy finish, rather impressed with it.
Color caoba, espuma blanca ligera. Aromas de azucar moreno. Cuero ligero, amargor final ligero y plano. Prescindible.
Minimal head, meduim carbonation, felt like there should be more body to the beer when i got the pint, Lacks that flavour punch! Smokey Taste
Bottle from Soho Wine at home. Deep amber pour. Lager aroma. Crisp bitter aroma taste with good amount of maltiness. Not bad for a crisp beer. Not a lot of flavor.
Drank from the bottle. The nose is tired, smells of hay and bread. Taste is grain, bread, malt, and hay. Typical lager taste, not much to set it apart from others. Meh
Pours light orange with a thin white head. Grassy aroma. Light maltiness with mild hops. Solid beer.
A beer with a personality. Goes well with various kinds of food. Many interesting features.
Minimal head, pours a light orange color. Medium carbonation, not very distinct. A bit above a typical lager.
Un poco demasiado seca para mi gusto. Pero tiene buen sabor despues de todo. Jorobate Flanders

Aroma: malty, maybe light DMS, a pinch of hops.
Appearance: nice golden color, poor head.
Taste: malty (sweet), a pinch of hops, low bitterness.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, malty finish.
Overall: Classical beer, but this is not my pair of shoes.
bottle at home, orange like beer with a medium/small head, aroma is malt and hops, taste is the same, decent but nor great beer

Light orange in color, hazy clarity with mostly diminishing white fizzy head. Sweet light fruit, grain, malt on the tongue. Light grain and water up front with a light short malt finish. Crisp on the palate.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent light amber with thick cream colored head. Aroma of bread. Taste of pine and bread.

Pours clear golden, half finger white head. Aroma bready malt, earthy hops, slight evergreen. Taste slight bittter earthy, evergreen, bready malt. Mouthfeel thinner side of medium body, medium carbonation, clean balanced finish. Overall tasty beer, good transition beer with interesting character from the signature Northern brewer hops.
Poured rich orange gold with perfect head and medium lacing. Very smooth with light malt after notes.

12oz bottle from The Beer Store Wilson. Light orange hue, hazy clarity with mostly diminishing white fizzy head. No lacing. Sweet light fruit, grain, malt. Light grain and water up front with a light short malt finish. Crisp on the palate.

香りと甘さが  
比較的薄めの&  
好みではない&

Ett stycke briljans på flaska med amerikanskt mått, 355 ml. De ska tydligen alltid vara lite motvalls de där amerikanarna. Envisas med att göra både den bästa och sämsta ölen i världen. För att på allvar kunna uppskatta det vackra i livet (läs Anchor steam) måste man ha skrapat hakan i bottenslammet (läs Budweiser).
Classy classy beer from sf. You just cant go wrong with this beer ever. Copper color sweet floral malt with good hop balance. Bold finish.
Smell of malt, sugar, yeast. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma of sugar, apple, yeast. very sweet. Lively carbon.

12oz bottle 11/00 (Old Notes)-Pours a medium to dark amber with a small off white head. Aroma of malt and sweetness. Taste of malt, caramel, and sweetness. This light to medium bodied brew is well balanced and easy drinking.
Bottle. Clear golden with white head. Sweet floral and yeast smell. Taste is bitter with short sweet fruity citrus finish.
Pours a nice amber color, with off-white head. Malt and caramel on the nose, following onto the palate. Finishes with just a pinch of hoppy pine. Overall, a pretty solid beer.

Bottle 0,355. Soft malty nose. Clear, amber colour. White short head. Taste is little sweety, little citrusy and a bit.. soapy (?) with light bitterness in aftertaste. Drinkable, refreshing beer - something between Czech pilsner and APA.
A: Amber slightly hazy. S: Malt, some lager smell. T: Starts sweet, some European bitterness, some sulfur, some very mild acidity. Some toasted malt. Finishes malt. M: Light. O: Not bad.
Light copper pour with a light beige head. Aroma is sweet malt. Taste is malty, little sweetness, nice carbonation. Dry finish. Nice lacing. Tasty beer.

Gedronken tijdens proefavond van biergilde hoorn. Kopergouden kleur met een fijne crème schuimkraag. Bloemige geur met vanille en amandelspijs. Smaak en geur liggen echter ver uit elkaar, met grapefruit laurier en gistbitter. Waterig mondgevoel en licht trekkend in de afdronk. Ok voor een lager

Excellent beer with caramel and roasted malts. Goes excellent with Spanish Tapas! Refreshing, smooth and with a nice foam head!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma y sabor maltoso, acaramelada pero no dulzona ni empalagosa. El lúpulo se nota en el final, compensando el dulzor tostado. Tiene una efervescencia muy curiosa.
Aroma: weak malt, mildly sweet. Appearance : reddish copper. Taste: malt heavy, sweetish faint caramel. Palate : small bodied.
Decent beer, no strong or overpowering tastes but all round good drink. Could happily spend an evening drinking this.
Bottiglia da 355 ml. Bellaspetto ambrata con schiuma fine. Al naso poco leggero caramello e uovo. Al palato scarsa, citrica.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Botella de 35,5 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, caramelo, dulce, muy suave.
Backlog. On tap at Green Lion Inn. Dominated by caramel, butterscotch, some herbs and citrus. One of a kind. High drinkability.
a nice simple beer from anchor....pours dark amber with thick creamy head...taste is malt caramel....light hops...refreshing.
Pours amber with a white head. Quite sweet. Caramel notes but a little citrus too. A nice enough beer. A bit different.

Flaska från SB. 
Vacker klar bärnsten med ett fint tjockt skum som dock lägger sig ganska fort.
Fräsch doft av malt och lite fruktighet. 
Frisk smak med en bra blandning av sötma och beska. Ganska stickig i munnen, rätt klen kropp. Positivt överraskad!

Poured from a bottle, age unknown. Pours a clear amber with a frothy head, turns big bubbled and dissipates quite fast. Aroma is pleasant, malty and sweet. Taste is round, malty, nutty and leaves a nice kind of molasses aftertaste. Very nice beer.
Thought I had already tried this beer. Was nice and refreshign with some character and thick features too.
Appearance is orange amber. Nose is sweet malts, yeast, fruity bubblegum. Taste is sweet rounding to a nice bitter finish. A noble station. Not sure why this beer doesnt get more love.
Boa cerveja malte caramelo suave.trazendo no final amargor do lúpulo tudo muito suave.
Orange amber colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Light body. Aroma of malts and bitter hops. Bit thin and watery. Easy drinkable.

botella 355ml. color ambar oscuro, aroma dulzon a malta tostada y algun toque de caramelo. en boca carbonatación media, entrada dulce que rapidamente deja paso al amargor del lúpulo con toques herbales. equilibrada, sabrosa y fácil de beber

Bottle.

A- Grains, wheat, citrus, cereal.

A- Orange color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Grains, cereal, malty, water.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

O- I was quite let down with this one. Granted, I had high expectations, but it just seemed like a glorified macro to me. Like a hybrid between a lager and ale, I just cant seem to find much love for this one.
Bottle at fizz. Earthy malty shitty taste. Had this after some good IPA so my rating isn't fair. Blah. Can't believe I hadn't rated this

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Clear golden/amber with a white head. Honey, honeydew melon, floral, slight banana, slightly bitter, generic fruityness, bread. Medium body, low carbonation, slightly bitter finish.

Hondeydew melon and some floral notes in the aroma 
Clear amber with white head 
Not much malt in the taste, some of that honeydew melon though, and the bitterness is a bit metallic 
Medium body, soft carbonation 
Must say it is not a nice as I remember unfourunately
Flaske fra SB Sälen. Mørk honningfarget med mye hvitt skum. Lukter sitrus, malt og karamell. Karamell i smaken, samt noe sitrus og krydder. Medium kullsyre, lang og god ettersmak som sitter lenge.
Bottle, smell is sweet floral, appearance is clear brown with thin khaki head, taste is a little sweet at first with carbonated bitter finish. Refreshing beer but not unique.

A somewhat dark, but nice honey-colored beer with a somewhat yellow layer of foam. The aroma contains the sweetness of alcohol, despite the fact that it "only" contains 4,8 %. It tastes sweet for about half a second, but this quickly moves on into a bitter taste, with a dry bitter aftertaste. A bit strange, but not bad!

Een iets donker, mooi, honingkleurig bier met een lichtgele kraag. In het aroma zit het zoetige van alcohol, ondanks dat er "slechts" 4,8% in zit. De smaak is heel even zoet, maar wordt bijna direct bitter en laat een droge bittere nasmaak achter. Beetje vreemd, maar niet slecht!
Malt and lite citrus aroma. Golden amber in color with good head. Malty, roasted and citrus flavors. Another good session beer.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 Piana ładna, szybko się zbija pozostając do końca i oblepiając szkło. Kolor lekko bursztynowy, lekko przejrzyste. Aromaty słodowe, lekko miodowe, karmelowe, chlebowe. Lekka goryczka, lekko słodkawe. W smaku bardziej słodowo-karmelowe. Odczucie w ustach kremowe.
355ml bottle. Clear amber with a foamy white head. Flavors are cereals, caramel, toasted malts, citrus and minerals with herbal and peppery notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, buttery texture.

35.5cl bottle @ home. Clear amber color, minimal off-white head. Aroma honey, caramel, floral, bread, malty, slightly roasted, grapfruit notes. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, hint of salt. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, strong lagerish bittersweet finish. Massive flavor, still quite refressing. Fantastic.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein kupferfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, hopfig, blumig. Geschmack röstmalzig, hopfig, blumig, Karamell, leicht bitter, leicht süß.

Pours rich amber color with well-developed pale head. Low lacing. Roasted malt smell and low to moderate hops. Very unique nutty complex taste, but malt forward with a complex but moderate hoppy and toasty aftertaste. Medium body and warmth. You simply cant go wrong with this quintessential and well-balanced California steam beer.

Spännande öl, smakar lager men är Ale?! Steam beer helt enkelt! Best of two worlds.

Bottled. Looks very impressive - slightly dark amber with a very nice and stable white foam. Aroma is good enough as well - a bit sweety, malty with some thin hop notes. But the taste is a bit dissapointing - very flat, 2-dimensioned, lacks of some core. There are some malts and bitterness of course, but it is not enough and sometimes the taste remains some of boring euro-lager. A proper czech lezak is a way much better ;)
Somewhat empty in the taste but a really nice and tickling aftertaste! Very good beer overall.

When I first tasted this beer I fell in love with it, but after ordering it for so long its started to fall flat on my pallet. Thats not to say thats its not an enjoyable beer (it very much is) its just that after drinking so many beers from this "craft beer revolution" the Anchor Steam Beer doesnt leave you with anything memorable.
Bottle from a Pub in London. Pours a light amber colour, with a slowly disappearing head. Smells quite sweet, taste has minimal bitterness and is lowly carbonated. All round great beer
Tastes way too bitter. It doesnt even taste like beer. I couldnt even finish a bottle.

On draft. Pours light copper with a nice two finger head. Great floral hop aromas and flavors. Wonderful malt flavors with a great fruitiness from the yeast. There is a balance in this beer that makes it great.

Appearance: Clear light copper body. Medium white head. Lacing. long lasting
Flavour: Medium-high hop flavour, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. roasty, woody, dry, crisp, caramel,

Overall: Very enjoyable. Great beer.

355 ml bottle, poured.
7B. California Common Beer
Cerveja de coloração avermelhada. Espuma de boa formação e retenção. Aromas herbais e cereais.

Bu en bouteille de 35,5cl, une couleur ambrée et peu de mousse, en bouche grosse attaque sur le grillée avec des effluves de caramel, de noix et de noisettes, grosse amertume en seconde bouche qui annihile le reste dommage.
Pours a clear orange with a lively head. Smells of sweet malts. Taste is the same with yeast,sweet,minimal bitterness.

One of the first craft beers I have had. Finally had a chance to rate. Really light ale that is slightly hoppy and malty. Ha at Calos.

Rich malty aroma with not a lot else. Pours an amber colour with a creamy off-white head. Quite a thick lace persists after the head dissipates. Beautiful malty creamy taste. Minimally carbonated and with only a slight hint of hops in the aftertaste. A good example of a steam beer.
En bra öl som luktar malt och jäst. En bra lättdrucken öl med lite inslag av sötma och malt.

DAA; Pours clear amber with a creamy, lasting, lacing off-white head. Nose is sweet malty, grainy, grassy and light spicy. Taste is moderate sweet, light spicy and bitter, moderate lasting. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is avarage. I do appreciate the history behind the beer. San Fransisco, see ya later.

355ml. Bottle. 
Pours clear orange with white head. 
Aroma fresh, citrus, caramel, malts, bread. 
Taste malty sweets, light bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Classic!

Bottle from Bier & Co. Quite intensive aroma of bread combined with some weird unpleasant scent. No sign of hops. Alcohol insensible. Color of dark amber. No haziness, clear. Rich, but rather frothy head. Sweet, light bitter. Light body, slick texture. Soft carboxination.

Appearance: pours a 3/4" off white sudsy head which slowly recedes with moderate lacing. Mostly clear copper color with abundant streaming carbonation.
Aroma: aroma is dominated by yeast and sweet malts. Some floral hop aroma as well. 
Mouthfeel: light and fluffy, much like a light English style ale. Finish is fairly dry.
Flavor: yeasty bread is dominant, but also pick up some butterscotch and toffee flavor, some bittering earthy hops in the finish.
Overall: first time I have had this beer in a while. It is just as delicious as I remember.
Aroma of malt and yeast with a clear caramel colour. Taste if sour dough and malt. Astringent palate with a hint of bitterness and malt.

Poured from a bottle. Clear golden color, no real head. Mild bread and malt aroma. Very light sour grain flavor with a watery finish.

A nice malty beer with notes of orange and caramel along with some spice. Quite dry in the finish too.
Weak malty aroma. Dry and toasty, with some malts and hops. Medium body. Great beer to drink with friends.
Pours a semi-clear amber with a low off-white head. Aroma is rye bread, orange rinds, citrus, yeast. Taste is rye bread, orange zest, citrus notes, some nutty tones.

33cl bottle

Appearance: Pours a nice copper with a creamy allmost white persisting head.
Aroma: . Weak aroma with light Toasted malts, light honey notes
Taste:A nice toastiness, some good hop bitterness backiing up the malts, Finish is dry and clean . Simple but its a perfect execution.
medium light with medium carbonation. 

In the end a very solid allround lighter beer with not very high ABV. Something you can drink the whole year and which has taste.
Belle couleur brune; arômes et goût un peu maltés; légère amertume en finale; une bière intéressante

Beer poors medium copper, brilliant clarity, and a huge white head that persists. Aroma is earthy/woody, northern brewer dominated. Toasted malts notes are detectable but very light. Flavor has nice malt toastiness, firm hop bitterness, with low hop flavor. Finish is dry and clean, palate is medium light with medium carbonation. Overall very easy drinking, well balanced flavorful beer. Great beer to have on hand.

Long lasting foams, with long lacing. Clear liquid with warm hazelnut brown colour. Warm welcoming aroma. Taste a bit strangely bitter, but something that is a bit to annoying too. Bit watery. In summer very nice beer. Winter bit too simple.
Weak malty aroma. Nice chestnut brown colour with good white head which lasts a while. The taste is pretty weak and watery.
Amber colour with very nice white head. Aroma of malts, peaches from yeast and bit of hops. Rather dry, with pleasant bitterness and medium-high carbonation.

Bottle rhythm+ booze. Amber beer ok white head some lacing. Aroma is weak malty. Taste is yeast malts a bit of spice very dry bitter finish. Medium body quite strong carbonation. Its ok but a bit too dry in finish or me.
Beautiful beer. Nice caramel, marmelade, and malt aroma. Well-balanced malty and fruity taste, with moderate bitterness.
I really enjoy this one from Anchor steam, solid alternative to lager options. I loved the tour at Anchor and SF in general

Bright clear amber with a creamy white head. Malty hoppy nose. Taste is bitter with sugar, orange, grass, malts, sweet hops. Finishes bitter with a hint of booze. Good session beer, used be a favorite of mine years ago..and still good.

Bottle from Yamaichi. Finally getting around to rating this. Malty, dry, grassy, herbal hops, a touch of citrus, clean. Amber-orange with lace. Malty, sweet flavor, a bit sugary, oranges, grass, dry, reasonably bitter finish. Light and crisp body. A touch of brown sugar and spices in there too. Clean and very drinkable.
Bottle. Pours dark gold with small, white head. Aroma is malty with some fruitness and minty hops aroma. Taste is caramel with light bitterness in the finish. It is refreshing, but boring.

I remember this being the first craft beer that I absolutely did not like. Lets see if the years have changed that:

A: Some off dull stale note in the aroma. Like old hops or something. Malty like a macro..
A: Looks good enough. Nice red orange color. Head is minimal.
T: Super malty which is good but a strange dull bitterness throughout. Finish is off having that stale dull bitter note.
P: Light on palate. Finish is dull.

Overall not as bad as I remember but still not good. That stale hop bitterness cuts through in every aspect which takes away from the maltiness.

Bottle. Pours a Fizzy yellow.

Aroma. not much on the nose here

Taste. The best way i can describe is a very slight grapefruit bitternes, dominated by Herbal and Nutty Flavours.

Overall, a good beer but not a great one.

Orange amber, medium white head with filmy retention .Nose is malt, spice, fruit. Taste is toasty malts, caramel and orange-pear notes, some sweetness, some hops in the finish. Very drinkable, but a bit plain.

Bottle. Somewhat similar to Belgian blond beer: aroma is malty and fruity (peach), with a slight touch of hops. Minimal and quickly disappearing head, amber colour, hazy. Light sweetness, light bitterness. Average carbonation, light body. Nice one.

Subtle flavor. There's nice maltiness in this refreshing beer, but no big flavors. Goes well with the pizza I'm having in SF. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Looks great long lasting head, a nice flavor different but nothing crazy, refreshing is my favorite term for this beer

Bottle. Cant recall where from. Yer genuine amber. White, broken head. Crystallised fruit, biscuity malt. Taste is toffee sweet, with a fruity, dry, grainy follow up. Some creaminess on the palate. Dry, fruity finish.
orange, cloudy, white foam, lively, medium body, oily feel, caramel, floral, citrus, light sweetness, medium bitterness,
Aroma: hops, malts log. Appearance: dark gold. Taste: sweet malt. Palate: developing bitters. Overall: good, refreshing California Common. Bottle at Jackson&Rye, London.

Bottle into shaker. Medium amber and clear. Aroma is bread, dough, grass. Flavor is nutty, not quite toasted upfront. With floral hops which was unexpected for the style. Sweet caramel malt finish. Medium bodied, kinda flat, and boring on the palate. My first steam beer and was pleasantly surprised. Doesnt seem to fit what I read about the style however.

[Style tick] Pours a clear copper with a medium white head that leaves great lacing. Aroma is kind of shy with light caramel and light herbal notes. Some toasted grains. Taste is a little sweet with a light bitterness. Flavors of fresh cereals with some herbs. Bitter finish lingers for a while. Body is light, mouthfeel slightly oily. Carbonation is high. Not bad but certainly not something I would seek out again.
From bottle pours amber with white head. Taste is sweet but not strong. Slight bitterness. An easy drinker.

Bottle poured a clear orange hue w/ medium white head. Moderate bready aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are hay, lemon, and grass. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel, and crisp bitter finish.
Refrescante, agradable, floral, de amargor contenido, deja sabor a miel, cerveza muy agradable de beber, nos gusta tenerla por estas tierras
Birra leggerina e senza pretese, ma ben curata. Gusto leggero maltato, con note dolci molto delicate, forse qualche sentore di caramello. Amaro discreto.

bottle 33 cc in a tulipglass. Aroma is kinda thin-sweet fruit. Mostly apricots but watered down. It pours a nice redbrown with an off-white head that stays for a while. It doesnt leave much lacing. Maybe this dampens the aroma. Taste is light bitter with some sweetness in the background. A medium body with a thin texture and a lively carbonation. Not a beer that stands out but good enough.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 335ml bottle, poured into an Anchor Brewing Company pint glass. Appearance is clear amber with a medium sized foamy beige head. Aroma of syrup loaf, caramel and apricots. Flavours of syrup loaf, caramel and orange peels. Taste is light sweet taste with a light-medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. A highly drinkable and sessionable beer, with a mild pleasant flavour.

Bottle poured into tulip glass. Awesome copper colour, decent cream head. Aroma is nutty, fruity and a tiny hint of something like sawdust. Taste is a full, round malt sweetness, quite light on the bitter - not remarkable, but very drinkable. Palate is a little brown-ale, kinda like a thick lager. Nice.
Rien de spécial. Plutôt desalterante, léger arrière goût commercial. Plutôt dilué. Bcp plus impessionant lhistoire et sa confection. Dommage.

355mL bottle. Pours clear gold with a big fluffy white head. Estery aroma, some yeast, a tad burnt and metallic. Mild bitterness, a little toast, slightly fruity and floral. Light body, average carbonation, lingering finish.

From bottle. Pours copper gold liquid. Beige head, bigger bubbles, but nice. Aromas a bit like strong Belgian ale, candied fruits, caramel. Light to medium body (on the beginning watery than medium), carbonation lively. Taste is malty, in aftertaste some lager bitterness, but nothing exceptional. But overall a good beer.

Very decent and enjoyable thirst quencher. Starts with quite watery texture thou nice maltiness kicks in with pleasant citrus touch and some hops for balance. Bit caramel and kinda honey in second stage.
Nothing fancy, but really enjoyable brew

Just reviewed their wheat beer and this is surprisingly similar. A bit darker than the wheat beer but just as boring. A hint of bitterness and a smooth, fizzy mouthfeel. A bit on the watery side, its a very standard beer. No complaints, really, but it doesnt really live up to its current 78 rating. I am very excited for the other two beers in the mixer; I guess Im working up from the bottom.
A bit sweet, watery taste. Little aroma. Easy drinkable. Would like to drink this in the summertime after hard work.
Viegs gaiss alus. Dzintara kraasa, viegls karsta laikaa drinkojams lagera un maaazliet eila. mazliet medains.

12 oz. bottle. Pour is a medium amber, clear with an ivory head that leaves a good amount if lacing. Smell is caramel malt, some bread and yeast. Nothing overwhelming. Taste is caramel malt with medium sweetness, faint bit of hops, and a slightly yeasty finish. An easy drinking amber beer with a mellow aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear golden/copper with a frothy white head. Aroma of bready malts, some hops. The quality of this beer is mostly in the aftertaste. Light bitterness. This is somewhat Lager-ish, but a bit fruitier and hoppier. Refreshing and easy to drink.

DATE TASTED: December 21, 2013... GLASSWARE: Howards Pub pint...OCCASION: post Hobbit unwinding... APPEARANCE: beautiful copper-amber body supports a thick, pillowy head; solid lacing.. AROMA: fragrant, soft hops with floral hints; malts are minimal... PALATE: medium-bodied, almost creamy; highly drinkable lager...TASTE: crisp and clean; start to finish, an agreeable West Coast resin and moderate pine; little citrus to be found... OVERALL: though intimidating to rate a style all its own--I first sipped this "steam" beer with wide-eyed, impossible expectations--the experience is that of a refined, articulate pale ale with a slightly thin quality...
En ganska speciell öl. En trevlig fyllighet, men ingen vidare beska. En särskild ton i smaken, från den unika tillverkningen?

Murky orange appearance. Citrus, orange peel aroma. Initial taste is malty, sweet, fades into very light bitterness, fruity aftertaste. Very short finish. Nothing spectacular. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 Anchor Steam is an American classic. Quite fittingly, this beer tastes like a cross between an amber lager and an amber ale - rich and malty. Hops are used to brilliant effect with this beer. Theyre subtle and they create a clean finish. Anchor Steam is both a craft icon and a piece of American brewing history.

I enjoyed this beer. The California Common style is quite distinctive. The beer is malty with a thorough hop bite on the end, Quite pleasant and balanced. The aroma is enticing and it pairs well with most any food.
Rate beer comment padding as i just want to track my score not write an essay!

From the bottle; a classic. Amber color with beady white lace on the surface. Sweetly malty accented by mild hops. Crisp, warm profile. Hay in the back, hints of sweet corn at the end before hops and malt overtake them. Finishes clean. Totally solid.
Tastes like they brewed this beer with sea water, maybe juiced some barnacles for flavor. Not down.
If two sour patch kids brewed a a beer it might taste similar to this monstrosity.
Klar brun med tynt hvitt skum. Karamell malt. Søt karamell, medium bitter, medium kullsyre.

Aroma: Malt, citrus (oranges), caramel, dough, hey Appearance: Gold, orange, clear white fine bubble head, medium lace, light carbonation Taste: Malts, Orange, slight sour, malty dry light bitter aftertaste
Lys gylden, lavt skum. Aroma av gjær og malt. Smaker søtlig gjær. Medium konsistens. Grei nok.
From a bottle. Solid light beer, more like a Pilsner than an ale, full flavor, clean and no fruitiness. Fairly dark color.

bottled: 1SW; 3rd week of September, 2011

A: Copper with a transient finger of white foam which falls quickly to a broken sheet of the same. spotty lace. excellent clarity.
S: Smells like english malts. Sweet with hints of toffee.
T: Tea flavors with strong malts and subtle, earthy hops. Pretty simple and easy to drink.
M: medium bodied with moderate over low carb and a semi dry finish.
O: I can see why this beer made it big. I can appreciate the approach-ability of the beer. Its just mediocre to me.

Serving type: bottle

12-14-2011

Bottle: Clear, copper with frothy white head. Caramel, fruit, esters. Clean. Slightly heavy. Banana. Dry, not sour with low to moderate bitterness. Medium flavor intensity and length. Slightly heavier than lagers. Palate is full of banana, esters, dry fruit, malt and dry brown spice.
One of the most well balanced beer Ive tried so far. Very drinkable and refreshing while maintaining an interesting complexity in its taste.
Love this beer. Refreshing, easy to drink. Truly the benchmark of the style.

Bernsteinfarbenes Bier, minimal trüb mit guter Schaumbildung. Obergäriger Citrus-Hefe Duft. Süßmalziger Beginn nach Karamell, leicht getreidig und zitronigem Hopfenabgang. Vielleicht etwas dünn, aber gute Balance und Süffigkeit.
Consumed with a roasted lamb shoulder and an exotic salmon salad dish. Quite enjoyable

Aontaíonn tú gan aon ábhar atá mídhleathach nó gráiniúil nó a sháraíonn aon chearta tríú páirtí a chur suas ná ceangal a dhéanamh leis. Smells of bread. Pours amber with small head. Virtually none head is lasting. 
Mildly sour and bitter. 
Surprised by some good aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 Grassy aroma in an amber pour.  Somewhat one dimensional fruity body is nicely balanced by the laid back bitter finish.  An enjoyable brew that is the benchmark of the California Common style.

Bottle
Aroma-yeast, 
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, slick feel, lively, bitter finish
Overall-good

Ive been drinking Anchor Steam Beer for awhile as my "what is that beer?" of choice, i.e. the ones that get my friends talking when I pull it out.

Upon pouring, it has a nice Amber colour with a decent head. There is not a lot of carbonation bubbles but it still has some kick when drinking it. It smells quite crisp and has a little bitterness to it. You can taste some of the hops, but it is not overpowering. There is a bit of an aftertaste but nothing bad. You can feel the beer on the front and back of the mouth.

I would suggest this as a nice beer to try if you want some hops but dont want to go all crazy with an American IPA.

Pours dark amber with fluffy white head. Leaves nice lacing on glass. Aromas of honey, malt some citrus. Taste is sweet malt, honey, bread followed by light bitterness, full body nice carbonation. A very well made beer.

355ml bottle at home. One of the beers that really got me in to Beer. Drank (drunk) in San Francisco many years ago, a pleasure to revisit. Clear golden amber pour, nice tight white head & lacing. Aromas of caramel, toffee, faint flowery hops. Taste has a nice bitterness and more malt sweetness. Very enjoyable.
Tap. Amer coloured, tiny white head. Malty, touch of caramel, grapes. Bitter/sweet taste, medium-light mouth. Very dry. Lovely drinkable stuff, more complex then my notes make it seem.
Pours a dark amber with tan colored head. Very malty, possibly too malty. Oak notes with hints of citrus. Not bad, not great. An above average beer.

Poured from the stubby 22 into glass. It created a light tan, 1-finger head. A little darker head and color than I remembered. Its been a long time since Ive had this one. The creamy head lingers nicely and leaves very decent lace. I honestly didnt pick up much on the aroma, slight hops. The beer is very dry, skews malty but leaves a pronounced bitterness. Clean finish. It is busy in the mouth and appears very lively in the glass with its active carbonation.
Very solid amber lager tasting with ale esters that combine with a malt bill that makes this subtlety complex while extremely drinkable. Nice bridge between macro and micro brews.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Couleur or profond, nez malté, légèrement houblonné, très frais, un peu dagrumes et de levures. Bouche désaltérante, assez douce, un peu trop diluée. Finale moyenne, maltée. Un peu trop simple.
Golden amber, nice head that dissipated rapidly. Tasted like a golden lager, malty, slight carbonation, paired well with spicy sushi.
On tap in San Fran; poured amber with a creamy head ... quite smooth, with some creaminess to it .. a little hoppy at the finish. Overall not bad, and I might consider buying again
Bottle @ home. Nice light amber color with a small compact off white head. Taste and aroma is malt, bread and some flowers.

Pours a beautiful clear golden colour with large 2-finger robust head. Aroma is very similar to a European lager - very subdued with a whisper of grainy malt. Not much to sniff here.
Has a very light but bouncy palate, fairly crisp and a little dry. Taste is again mostly light malt with some corn. Competent but a little one-dimensional.
My first one California Common. Slightly strong, light biterness, high carbonation. Good.
Bottle. Tastes smooth, slightly sweet and malty, like grains, bready. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like malt, wheat, and nuts. Good for a California Common.
Did I just drink marshmallows? Has a very sweet taste that reminds me of said treat. Very different than anything else Ive had, but not in a bad way.
bottle 355ml. clear orange amber color with medium head. aroma of hops, malts and caramel.taste is light hoppy with caramel malts.
From bottle. Attractive copper color with some thin white head. Active, with some roastiness and wheat. Nice, smooth finish. Solid.
Really unique beer. Flavor starts out sweet with floral and brown sugar notes. Finish is distinctly Hoppy. Its a little too carbonated but other than that is fantastic.

355 ml, flaske, 4,8 %, købt i Netto på Østerbrogade, 12. november 2013.
Kobber-farvet og klar amerikansk ale med fint småboblende offwhite-farvet skum, 1 cm tykt.
Dejlig sødlig og frisk duft af abrikos og vådt hø. 
Velafstemt smag af sødme og bitterhed med sidstnævnte som dominerende. Smagen starter frisk henad bayersk pilsner, hvorefter den humlede (?) bitterhed kommer snigende. 
Mundfølelsen er middel rund med kulsyreindhold lige under middel. 
Øllet har en sødme henad en Bock, men man efterlades med smagsindtrykket af en Classic. God velsmagende øl i pilsnerklassen!

Dark gold / copper color with white, frothy and medium lasting head. Aroma of malt with hints of hops. Light bitterness, medium body. Carbonation is average.

Transparent amber in colour. 1, 5 finger of head. Citrusy&flowery aroma with a hint of toffee. Citrusy&peachy taste with a well balanced hoppy finish. Medium carbonation. Lacing is good. Better than your average beer.
Ja en smakrik lager eller? Söt maltig aroma. Viss sötma i smaken, sen sticker citrus fram lite mot slutet.
Amber golden body with a white head. Some herbal aroma. Some caramel taste. Some carbonation.
Poured into a shaker. A nice beer pours golden color with nice carbonation and white head.

Copper in colour with ample, yet quickly dissipating head. Aroma of sweet, caramelized barley malts, fresh-from-oven bread and hops. Pretty nice beer, with a great amount of pilsner-like aromas, and a soft, delicate and well-balanced taste.

(Bottle): Pours a clear amber, small white head. Definite lager yeast aroma with some lovely malty notes. I could sniff it all day. Unfortunately the taste isnt as amazing. Notes of yeast, fruitiness and dusty, old hop notes. Pleasant but really quite bland and dull flavours, maybe a bad bottle?

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 Tap: Muddled copper color with rustic amber hues around the edges; half clear and half hazy. Slightly gray-tinted head turns to a skin and leaves small drippings of lace on its way down. Aroma is fairly bleak and mild, but relaxing and calm. Musty hops (Noble?) with some leafiness. Faint grains and mild citrus zest in the finish. Straightforward. Taste has some light biscuit malts and heavy grains, substantial hop bitterness with some very mild citrus, lemongrass, and herbal tea leaves. Heavy lager yeast in the finish, bready. A little musky. Thin bodied but surprisingly creamy, for what its worth. An easy drinker, for sure. Not much to it, but I respect the originality of the style.
Taste better at Giants Games than it does from bottle at home. Fairly low alcohol with a nice body and medium bitterness, pours a nice amber color, not a lot of head or lace though.

The light, earthy aroma is pleasing, but it is too mild to be very enticing. 

The flavor starts with a good hit of earthy/spicy hops, with the malt component becoming more apparent mid-taste. The hops are present all the way through, making this steam beer seeming to build in intensity through the finish. Great hops/malt balance leaves both bitter/sweet and other flavor components in exemplary balance. Excellent roster of malts. 

Anchor Steam has a medium-light body; excellent carbonation, and a refreshing crispness. An exceptional if subtle beer.

Pours into tulip from bottle a beautiful clear copper with small white head. Aroma of sweet mild malt, pears, some florals. Flavor is admittedly mild but definitely session able. Medium light mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Sweet malts and light fruits with a slightly unpleasant finish. Finally tried this and it is not too bad. Better sessionable brews though.

There was a sweet malty aroma with notes of caramel. The medium body lager had average carbonation. Te finish was dry and clean with a balanced hoppy finish.
Bitter red beer good looking and tasting with lasting balanced bitterness and hopping aroma that is not over used. Good summer drinking

Been trying to work out what the hell this beer is, for a while. Think its basically a very malty lager, with an extremely firm bitterness. I wouldnt say it has caramel character, its more savory, like brown breadcrusts. Really cold, itd be a good accompaniment to a greasy burger, instead of the usual hoppy ipa, although I can only ever manage one of these due to the rich malt taste. Unique.
Very well balanced amber beer. Definately no strong taste or smell but very nice all around.

Pours a beautiful clear copper color amber with plenty of foam and good retention. Bubbles rising from the bottom. Beige head that left soapy wet lace and a layer on top. Very pretty beer. Nose is simple. A touch of sour yeast, some caramel malt and a bit of fruit. Malt is a touch toasted and grainy. First taste is some light citrus that washes over the palate like a gushing stream, then some hop bitter settles in on the mid palate. The malt is smooth toasted grain. Theres a light sweetness and lager yeast. The malt is woody and earthy. The body of the beer is medium/ light and smooth. To look at it you would think its very sweet but it isnt. It drinks so easily that you never notice how fat the malt is. Finish is dry and grainy. 

This beer has a classic and clean taste that is enjoyable to say the least. The hops are soft yet bitter and drinks like a lazy afternoon. Friendly and approachable. Would pair well with black bean burgers and would compliment a variety of vegetarian dishes. Would also go well with spicy foods like chili or sweetly smoky foods like barbecue. Its versatile.

Couleur bronze, avec un petit col de mousse blanche sur le pourtour du verre ; au nez, malts évoquant le sucre cuit et le caramel. Étonnamment désaltérante sans être aqueuse, ce sont des céréales cuites (mais non grillées) qui attendent le buveur. Savoureuse, elle possède une finale toute en douceur, le sucré nest pas du tout envahissant, et elle possède une belle balance entre les saveurs et la buvabilité. Très intéressante bière "historique", simple mais parfaitement au point.

Lett og fin smak. Bra skum og ser flott ut i ølglasset. God maltsmak, men ettersmak blir bitter og litt kort. Fin øl til kjøtt og nøtter.
