Man this one of the best beers on the Planet!!! Nuff said! Go get some!
Pours a deep red-amber. Mild floral nose. Rich and a little malty with a good hop taste and bitter finish.
A lovely beer - out of the bottle. Great session beer, not overpowering nor is it not present - just a well balanced beer.

One of my all time favorites, Anchor Steam has a beautiful color, a clean, fresh aroma and flavor that I love. A wonderful balance of malt and hops, IMO. I live in the SF Bay Area, so Im fortunate enough to be able to get this whenever I want and its always fresh.
Tart and metallic.. In Aus but I enjoyed this in San Francisco so it might be due to shipping.

Decent retention with a great amber color. Smells of sweet malt and biscuit. Tastes the same with hints of hops. Great classic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a 12 oz bottle into a tall weizen glass - appearance a pale amber with a thick white head. My first impressions of this beers aroma and taste were wine-line, and I swear the palate feels a bit tannin-ey, like red wine. Tangy aroma. Sweet flavors from the malt and again hints of wine. Light carbonation, and a bitter and tannin aftertaste. I really liked it, havent tried anything like it yet.

A - pours clear nice caramel brown with low off white head. Nice retention w some lacing. S - simple yeasts and caramel malts. Some quite cereal grains. M - light drinkable body with high carb, lightly sweet malty end. Session beer. T - cereal grains, gden raisins, caramel malts. Light grasses as well. O - simple sweet malt heavy session beer. 3.1
bottle. Pours amber with creamy white head. Malty aroma. Mostly sweet with just a touch of bitterness in the finish for balance. Light to medium bodied, smooth and easy to drink. Quite good.
On draught. Dark almost amber golden color. Light malty aroma. Sweet taste of malts, some pitted fruit, and light hopping. Really smooth character that finishes really well.
ligero aroma a citricos bastante carbonatada y al paladar le senti como sabor a piel de manzana un poco bitter bastante suave nada especial
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Flaske fra polets nettbutikk: absolutt et øl man bør ha prøvd siden Anchor er et viktig bryggeri i historien om de amerikanske craft breweries, men som øl å betrakte har den for lengst blitt passert av utviklingen.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 For me, this is like a fruity lager - as such, its a damned fine one. Neural nose and palate but a very pleasant fruity finish. I wish true lagers tasted as good as this! Had Kolsch to follow and thought there were similarities. The Steam Ale was better though.
(bottle) clear amber colour with a medium tall whitish head; sweetish aroma; dry and refreshing flavour with a long light bitter finish
Tap. Very clean copper color. Aroma is metallic, some citrus, floral and a little caramel. Medium body with medium carbonation. Great session beer.

Clear orange lager-looking beer with a nice moderate head. Aromas are slightly sweet malty and somewhat fruity, with a kind of creamy vibe. All this is repeated in the taste with a nice bitter and slightly sour finish. The body is thin but the carbonation pretty lively. All in all, a quite refreshing beer with an original twist.
Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Smells of sweet malts. Amber pour, some head. Light body and easy on the palate. Some sweet malt flavor, with some bitterness and a sour aftertaste. Forgettable.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (22:-). Bärnstensfärgad. Doft av frukt, parfym och vanilj. Smak av frukt, vanilj och lite citrus.

Cuivrée ayant une mousse qui se résorbe rapidement en un mince voile, tout en réussissant à réapparaître suite à une petite secouée. Arômes de malt, de caramel, ou encore de miel ambré et quelque chose qui serait dans la famille des grains, du froment? ou de la farine? Un goût qui semble simple, tout en étant particulier. Une vieille levure, des saveurs acidulées. Elle est plutôt sèche en bouche, alors quune amertume se dessine au fil des gorgées et laisse une sensation de satiété, de rafraîchissement. Elle est assez ronde et effervescente et ce, tout en douceur. Pour moi, cest une belle surprise. (674-060613)

.3l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar
Pours clear golden with low head. Aroma is malty with dried fruits and caramel. Flavor is caramel, soft malts and hint of liquorice.
Lite lukt, litt halvgrumset gyllen brun farge, tynt skum langs kanten, flat smak. Ikke så mye mer å si om dette enn en grei leskedrik i sommervarmen.

Too bitter for me. A sour taste as well that always turns me off. Brewing since 1896 and this might be from the first batch.

Found frequently on tap in airport bars, pubs and restaurants in California, a much better alternative than flat tire...

Pours a light amber color with minimal head minimal lacing. A bit of malty aroma not much hops wise. Not a bad drinking beer but unremarkable.

Bottle; Poured golden amber with an off white head. Aroma: very faint not picking up much smell. Flavor: Tastes of yeast, slightly bitter with a sweet vanilla finish.

Malty, yet well balanced and somehow underwelming. Caramel is the dominant note in the malt profile while grassy and floral flavours follow it over the tongue and linger. It has a good body and has the taste notes I normally enjoy yet in the wrong way. It is a strange one in that I feel like I should like it more than I do.
Pours copper in color, light head. Nose of malty caramel. Thick caramel is dominant followed by barley with a hint of bitterness and a walnut finish.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2013 Gyllen amber farve med høyt beige skum som varer lenge. Fruktig lukt med karamell. Søt  fruktig smak med karamell og frisk bitter avslutning.  Cardinal.
Tastes like what it is, kind of, a cross between an ale and a larger. Tasty and easy to drink without being a knock out.

Pours like a pint, with matching relatively thin head, clear "pinty"colour and carbonation. Taste is fresh with a hint of grass, fruits and some bitterness, not lasting long. Great pint, one of my new favorites.
This is the benchmark for me.  Crisp and slightly roasty with a bitter end.  Robust and utilitarian, this beer is a good fit to any occasion or meal.

Väldigt vag fruktig lukt, kanske drack jag den för kall?
Fin grumlig brun färg med  döende bubblor, ser väldigt lockande ut.
Inte jättestark smak, men det man känner är fruktig och inte alls bitter som vanligen följer den fruktiga smaken. Eftersmaken håller sig i samma smakkategori som huvudsmaken. Pours an orange beer with no head.dont smell much. Average taste. Not bad not very good. The palate is perfect for this one.
Delicate malty aroma. Small, dissapearing head. Amber, slightly hazy body. Interesting taste of malts and caramel with bitter aftertaste.
Light red color with little to no foam. Smells of honey, fruit and hops. Tastes malty and hoppy, maybe hints of caramel and ripe fruits in the end. Pretty mediocre.

Looks like a amber with a big head.  Aroma of a macrobrew: sweet malt and slight citrusy hops.  Mouthfeel is moderate and refreshingly dry.  Tastes much better than it smells: fresh tasting moderately bittered hops blanket the malty background and remind me of an esb.  Slight caramel flavors poke through.  Well balanced.

Bottle. Clear yellow with white foam. Aroma is sweet with pine. 

Taste is very well balanced between bitter pine and sweet and a smooth grainy flavor. A well bodied beer with a good character.

malty aroma with hints of sweet fruit and bread.  dark gold color and quick diminishing head. clear.  nice balance between malt and hops.  not too heavy in either, with a slightly sweet aftertaste.  pretty light and easy to drink.  im pretty sure i could drink a few of these easily.
On tap at Bistro Boudin in San Francisco, CA. Obviously had to get this at least once while in SF. Not thrilling, but better than Philly's "home beer."
Copper colour, malty taste, but more bubble than flavour. A fairly ordinary beer.

Schiuma bianca, abbastanza fine abbastanza persistente. colore ambrato carico limpido. Aroma poco intenso per nulla persistente bilanciato tra malto e luppolo, leggermente crosta di pane. Corpo leggero, poco carbonata, beverina, finale abbastanza amaro. Gusto prevalente di malto
Copper colour with a small head.  Sharp and yeast driven malts.  And very very long in the palate.

I really like this beer very nice aroma and goes down smooth in a pint glass its not for you hop heads but if you want a nice smooth beer you cant go wrong with Anchor Steam.

A - Pours a clear amber color with 2 fingers of off-white head.

S - Toasted grain, honey sweetness, burnt biscuit, light caramel, floral hops.

T - Sharp grain and floral hops up front, a mix of carmael and honey sweetness. Some over ripe apples and plums in the background. Some chalkiness towards builds toward the end before finishing nice and crisp.

M - Light to medium body. Active soda like carbonation.

This is always a solid pick. Tangy yeast and a sturdy grain malt with plenty of balancing hops. Its like an American style pub bitter.

Serving type: bottle

04-27-2012
A truly delicious and highly drinkable beer. My go-to everyday beer. Malty with light citrus touches and plenty of carbonation.
35.5 cL bottle. Pours copper brown with light brown head. Distinct malty and spicy aroma. Taste is spicy with notes of corn. Sweet and bitter with a spicy-bitter finish

Bottle at club W. sweet almost honey smell, or I drive way to much today. Light, sweet taste. Not bad.

Bottle into glass.. copper  clear pour with small white head...sour fruit aroma.with bitter finish..

0.355l bottle. Orange body, off-white head. Aroma of grains, soap, fruity, metallic hops and some caramel. Taste of caramel, bread and floral hops. The finish is more on the hoppy side. Not a complex beer, but its OK.

355ml bottle. Pours a fairly clear medium amber, with a smallish off-white head, which lasts fairly well and leaves reasonable lacing. The aroma has strong toffee and caramel malt notes, along with a little candied fruit and lemon hops. Lemon and kaffir lime leaf hops notes up front persist into the mid-palate, where they are joined by toffee and savoury, slightly charry malt notes. Lemon hops make up the finish. This is not a bad beer, but it is a little simplistic.

1 Pt. 6 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Appearance is great, pours a nice clear amber, thick head a nice lacing.  Aroma of malts and grain and some caramel. Taste is very sweet and malty caramel mixed with grain and it has a nice mild bitterness towards the end. Good and reliable beer.

Head: beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Color: amber, clear. Aroma: persistent and intense caramel, toasted and nutty. Taste: a little caramel, but not really sweet or fruity, moderate to strong bitterness.

Appearance: Dark amber with a strong beige head that settles down to about 5mm and lingers for the whole glass. A small amount of thin lacing down the glass. 

Aroma: The first thing that came to mind was pineapples and rockmelon, but this was followed by some malt and graininess.

Taste: Initially, I actually could taste pears, but this disappeared after a few sips. The rest of it was a bit citrusy (grapefruit & lemon rather than orange) and a bit sharp. Some wholemeal bread and black pepper in the aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Medium carbonation, medium body. A little sharp and zingy on the middle of the tongue, but not in a bad way. Finish was a bit dry.

Drinkability: Well this was my first California Common, and I wasnt really sure what to expect. Overall, I think that it is a nice drop, one that would go with a lot of different styles of cuisine, but Im not sure if I would buy it to savour on its own merits.
This was my first "steam" beer and I liked it. Nice caramel character with a thick mouth feel.

Pale orange color with head that quickly disappear. Aroma of malts, butter, biscuits, nuts. Taste is light sweet with nice bitterness at the end. Light body, creamy texture, soft to lively carbonation, Nice and quite drinkable

Aroma is slightly malty but also hoppy.  Poors dark brown/yellow, slightly hazy. Small instable head, poor lacing. 

Medium bodied, slightly creamy texture. Spicy and bitter, some liquorice. Fresh and bitter finish. Pleasant.

Cerveja equilibrada, ótimo drikability, destaque para sabores maltados, poderia ter um corpo mais intenso, mas mesmo assim é uma bela cerveja.

Bottle. Pours a clear copper with minimal white head. Settles quickly with no lacing. Aroma is malty, bready, slight caramel/toffee. Flavor is mellow, bread/dough, malt, bread in a bottle. Slight fruitiness and rather mild throughout. Flavor leaves much to be desired and is much milder than I recall. Moderate carbonation, light body, and crisp texture. A mediocre beer.
How have I never rated this beer?  Weird.  Great, smooth drinking session beer.  May become one of my go-to beers now that Im on the Left Coast.
Floral and roasted aroma. Clear amber with a frothy White head. Medium bitterness. Thin average carbonation with a long bitter aftertaste

Amber colored beer with a thin off white head.  Light grainy nose with hints of fruit.  Caramel sweetness with biscuit, light toast, apple and some berry fruitiness in the flavor with a nice bitter hop burn in the finish.  Always a good beer and one of the granddaddys that still holds up after all these years.

Draft at Beer Temple.  Pours clear amber with a bubbly tan head.  Aroma of biscuit, malt, citrus.  Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter.  Light to medium bodied with light to moderate carbonation.
Bottle. Rich amber with a big, beige head. Caramel and malt aromas. Caramel, clove and grain flavors. Creamy mouthfeel.
Luktar lite strävt, humle. Ganska fin öl lukt. Mycket bra första smak, möjligt lite söt först. En beska kommer sen som passar bra men bryter av det lite. Gillar den mycket.
Poured from a bottle to a cup. Has golden clean color. Many bubbles rise up. Has a clear sweet citrus taste.
Not the greatest of beers. Semi-sweet but a very basic flavour.I wouldnt order this beer again yet Im glad I tried it.

A good beer, no offensive flavors and a very strong bread crust and malt flavor highlighted by a bit of bitter hops and a small amount of citrus. Medium on the mouth, drank from a bottle so cant comment on appearance.

It seems like everywhere you go, people talk highly of this beer. I can see why, but at the same time the hype I had heard for it left me slightly disappointed. The best thing about it is the dirty, dark and golden colour, the aroma doesnt quite live up to the appearance. Its mildly tangy, mild but notable yeast presence, its pretty much a toned down version of a type of beer that is often complex and challenging. The best thing I can say in praise of this beer is that it seems like it would be an incredibly versatile lunch/dinner beer.

Clear amber with a foamy head. Aroma of caramel and malt, some floral notes. Taste of biscuit and caramel, some bitterness, oily mouthfeel, not as malty as aroma would suggest. Not as complex as I had expected.
on tap in NYC. poured an orange yellow with small white head. aroma of toffee, fruit and flowers. tastes really good. slightly hoppy but mainly fruit. very easy to drink.

The most complex session beer that you can find pretty much anywhere.  Raspberry, plum, toffee and caramel all blend into a satisfying light finish.  Some people think there is something "off" about anchor steam which is fair enough I guess, but to those that say there is "nothing special" about it, all i can say is "whats wrong with you?"
mistura de cerveja belga com índia pale ale. Amarga, refrescante, bem encorpada. Cerveja artesanal californiana

Light orange-red, medium light tan head.  Aroma pleasant although not that strong, lightly malty.  Medium-light body.  Flavors are all fairy subtle, faintly sweet malt and the hops is present as a nice dry finish.  There is nothing that really stands out about this beer but nonetheless is very enjoyable and drinkable.

Copper amber, clear, with a nice foamy off white head. Nice malty nose, cereal, nuts and a little caramel. Flavour follows the nose, all malt, nicely rounded with caramel hints and a touch of bitterness toward the finish. Very mellow. Quite full bodied and forward carbonation. Longish finish which blends hops and melt perfectly. Nothing over the top, all understated flavours, but very enjoyable.

Bottle.  Pours a clear amber body with a beautiful one inch frothy off-white head that left lots of intricate lacing.  The nose is malt driven with some toasty malt and some light caramel.  Just a touch of fruitiness and hops.  The flavor isnt especially exciting, but its pretty solid.  Fairly dry and toasted malt with a minimal bitterness on the finish.  A pretty nice gateway beer to get non-craft people to do a little experimenting.  Light to medium bodied with a dry dusty finish and soft fizzy carbonation.  Pretty well just as I remember it being, the quality is still there after all these years.

malty aroma with spicy notes and lagerish yeast to balance..red amber color with foamy white head plenty of lacing..tastes malty sweet and lagerlike..spicy..with a tingle of hops at the end...palate is medium bodied with a drier finish..overall a classic and a deserved one incredible that all these various and strong flavors could come from a beer with a weaker abv than budweiser

Bottle @ il Campiglio. Birra  dai profumi tenui, difficilmente distinguibili. Cè il classico luppolato delle American Ales, cè un sentore erbaceo, forse addirittura floreale ma non ci giurerei (cera puzza di fritto mentre spillavo). Invece esteticamente è piacevole con un colore ambrato scuro che lascia trasparire una bella vivacità nel bicchiere. La schiuma è bianca., non molto fine ma stabile e compatta.   Il gusto è caramellato allingresso, poi ci sono sentori dolciastri della fermentazione e il finale è luppolato, molto lungo, e decisamente erboso. Non è amaricata come una IPA, ma la sensazione del luppolo è piacevole e stuzzicante sulla lingua. Ha una dolcezza che non mi sarei aspettato ma il finale la equilibra.
Excelente cerveja. Aroma e paladar. .........

This is a classic. Not my favorite as I think they make better beers but still classic because of the high quality and history. Strong malty aroma with added aromatic hops. Nice dark amber color with a foamy head. The beer has always had a strong malt base for me that overshadowed any hops presence. It blends well and is easy to drink, just not in every scenario.

Great beer and available every where I went during a Two week trip to San Francisco.  Its a light beer, easily drunk throughout the day and into the night. Great over lunch or by the pitcher for a session with friends. Nice little bottles fit into every corner of the Fridge too. A great relieve to find on the menu of every restaurant too.. From Mels Diner upwards.
Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell med citrustoner. Välbalanserad och lagom söt med en trevlig beska.
God og mild "pils" god lukt og lett og drikke. Denne hadde gått ut av dato men det skal ikke ha stor å si på smaken.
Bottle. Poured a clear amber color with a white top and nice lacing. Taste of grains, caramel, toffee, and spruce. High carbonation, medium body.

The aroma is mostly yeast, which might put you off. 


I started off not liking this, but as it warms I got more malts, and in the end Im actually developing a fondness for this, its not so bad, and quietly its a little gem.
I like this beer. Aroma is a bit weak but it definitely a great session beer. Very drinkable.

Aroma: grainy, little fruity; Appearance: dark golden, clear, small moderately lasting foam; Taste: lightly bitter, lightly sour; Palate: medium body, quite thin feel, average carbonation, quite long slightly bitter finish; Overall: quite refreshing, easy to drink, tasty

Orange, slightly hazy with lots of particles floating.
Aroma is malty mostly. Watery mouthfeel with acidy carbonation in the end
Hint of roasted malts and something else. Steam, i guess?

Lovely amber colour. Rich head, lovely balanced bitterness snd malt body. A good everyday beer. Thirst quencher :)

Aclear orange/amber pour with an off-white head. Fruity, maly aroma and taste...some caramel and flowery stuff and a medimu bitter ending. Never heard of this style but i like.

Keg @ Jolly Butchers 2013/4/8 Much nicer keg than bottle in my opinion. More body. Good carbonation but poor head retention for the body. Nothing special about the malty aroma. Lingering bitterness and marzipan-like flavour. Good beer.

2013/04/07 - Pours a light amber color with a tight, white head the dissipates quickly. Aroma is grass, slight hops, cereal and caramel. Taste is similar to nose with a dry finish. Mouthfeel is thin and crisp. Nothing special.

Flaske frasystembolaget. Rødaktig farge,middesls skumtopp, smaker malt,humle,furunål,appelsinskall,grapefrukt,. En ganske bitter øl, men ikke på samme måte som en ipa.
Nice and refreshing typical steam beer. Golden color and tastes of light malt, some hop, bread, and cereal. Nothing bad about this, but nothing spectacular either.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2013 355 ml bottle, at home. Poured into a lager glass. ABV 4.8%
Beautiful colour, deep orange, transparent, with good and continuous activity in the glass. One finger of off-white head, with surprisingly good retention for its size. Good lacing left on the glass as well.
Aroma was of a typical lager when I smelled from the bottle, but now that sits in the glass I get some caramel, spices and fruity notes.
Very refreshing and very hoppy. Quite bitter from the very beggining, with flavours of malt, a bit of hay as well, and spices. The bitterness persists on the aftertaste.
Medium thickness on the body, good carbonation. Nice dryness on the palate.
Overall, a very good beer, I havent been so excited about a beer in a long time.
Although its the quintessential steam beer, I thought it was still somewhat lacking in overall flavour. Easy drinking beer, good for hot summer days, nothing to write home about.

Anchor Steam is classic to me. A clear deep golden / amber hue sits beneath a frothy white head that remains until the last sip. Aroma of clove, grains, and tropical fruit with flavor to match. Carbonation is perfect. A well constructed session beer indeed.

Appearance very good, nice red color with a quickly dissapating head. Aromas of Cloves, citrus, grapefruit, oranges and mango. The beer is quite bitter, with flavors of malt, cereal and bread. Kinda missing the hop aroma, and the beer becomes too bitter with too little hop aroma for my tastes.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 Nice orange/amber colour, with a medium head. Smell is malt, honey and some floral tones, probably some hops.Taste is malty with more than slight sweet tones. But the finish is quite bitter, not bad. But the taste is disappearing too fast. 
Not so special, but at least I discovered a new style, interesting just for this...but its not bad.
Underwhelmed with this California Common - I like the Widmer Brothers take on this style better.

Certainly a unique beer, for very subtle reasons. I cant quite put my finger on what it is; the nose is malty, pours an amber hue with a nice, frothy head, but theres a certain kind of piny bitterness I wasnt expecting in the finish. A fuller beer than initially perceived. The type of beer that grows on you throughout the bottle. Will definitely try it out again.

Nose is malt, honey and slight floral tone. Good head with some lacing. Taste, is malty with notes of honey and slight pine and toast. Leaves a pleasing bitter finish. Mouthfeel is full and good. 

A decent beer.

355ml bottle. Pours out clear copper with a fluffy white head. Butterscotch and green apple aroma with additional hints of orange peel and burnt bread. Quite yeasty too. Taste is comprised of honey, esters, toffee and some leafy hops. It didnt really taste at all like what I expected. Despite this its definitely unique and intriguing, just without much of an excitement factor. I probably wouldve enjoyed it more when I was starting out on my beer adventures.

Enjoyed straight from the bottle at Green Dot Stables in Detroit, Michigan.

Anchor Steam is a beer that Ive wanted to try for awhile now, but just now decided to finally order one and get my first taste. I had never had a beer of this style before, so I was actually surprised. With the ABV and the name "Steam" beer I was expecting a light beer that was light on flavor and pretty much a slightly better version of an adjunct lager... its better than that. The smell is of malts with a fair amount of hops. The taste has mild hops on the front, with a malty and bitter finish. I was not expecting this beer to taste the way that it did, but I enjoyed it. I had Black Crown by Budweiser just last week, and honestly, this tastes like a craft version of that beer. It has a similar malt aftertaste with a trace of wood, but with a bit less sweetness and more bitterness. Clearly, this beer is MUCH better than Black Crown will ever be, but thats a beer a lot of people are familiar with that I would compare this one to.

Would not exactly be my beer of choice (Theres nothing offensive about it at all and its a solid, craft beer), but its a very respectable beer with a lot of history behind it.
12oz bottle. Pours a rich amber color with solid head after the pour. Aroma has floral hints and a caramel suttleness. Taste is toasted caramel with a hit of citrus notes.

I remember this bad boy as being a lot more enjoyable...it was really bitter and the opposite of smooth...maybe it was old... Or maybe I'm old...

One of my favourite beers,simple but perfect,you can have one in every moment

Pours dark amber with a large head.
Nose shows grainy malt, cardboard notes, soft spicy hops and a bit of wholegrain bread.
Slightly better flavours, more malt. Other than that, not much difference.
Body seems watery.
Not sold on this at all.

355ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Harbour City, Tsim Sha Tsui. Clear amber colour; Razor thin head and white foam which fades in 10 seconds; Minimal lacing with notable carbonation; Aroma of English ale maltyness with orange peel, honey, floral, bread and light grass; Moderate sweet taste of light honey blossom, liquorices, malt, bitter grassy hops, and hint of alcohol; Light body, quite slick palate; Taste profile is strong, lingering orangey malt and liquorices throughout, with hint of booze in the background. Solid but pleasant German Pils-like hop bitterness kicks in mid way to finish. Quite dry after taste, bitter but pleasant to mouth.

Comments: my first time tasting of this genre and I quite like it. It combine the best of two styles - good aroma of English ale with strong German Pils hoppiness. Its head looks too flat to me (maybe its my bottle) and dominating ale character is too strong but not as outstanding as the proper ones like the Fullers. Very drinkable, through not something very special. A solid beer to have when I am in the mood.

Nov 2012 - Bottle. smells like a British beer.  Taste - slight sweetness, uncomplicated malty toffee and spice.  Tastes like an average British beer.   The beer is drinkable and I have no complaints at all, but I was expecting something a bit more exciting.
Hazy amber with white head. Mild sweet malty aroma. Taste is similar to smell. Adds a little caramel and finishes dry.

Pours a clear amber, with a moderate off-white head.  Surprising aroma of Belgian yeasts.  Malty, taste of caramel, sweet.  Not much flavor of hops, but there is a slight bite at the end, and an almost dry finish.  I used to drink this beer a lot back in the 1980s, when the craft beer movement was just getting started.  It does not compare to the better modern craft brews, but it is still a fine beer.
bottle. amber orange with small head. mild flavor, but distinctive. lightly sweet and fruit with a hint of hops as well.

Clear amber. Small fluffy white head with nice lacing. Aroma is malty, orange, slightly sweet. Medium, creamy body with some sweetness and very light hop finish. Smooth, clean, and easy to drink. Malt, fruit, caramel,

The color is a brownish orange with no head, and the aroma is mainly yeast with undertones of malts, dough, and alcohol. The beer is quite sour, slightly salty, and slightly bitter, and, although this sounds less than appealing, it isnt bad. Furthermore, the palate combines an abrupt finish, average carbonation, medium body, and a thin texture, which makes it quite crisp.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours golden orange. Citrus aroma with hints of resin and peach. Mild bitterness with a malty backbone and decent carbonation. Slightly sweet and malty finish. Very inoffensive, sessionable beer.
Sweet, caramel malt aroma and flavor; some subtle fruit. Moderate bitter aftertaste.

Colore ramato carico tendente al marrone, poca schiuma e non molto persistente. Aroma di caramello, chinotto, liquirizia, punta di cioccolato da torrefatto. Al palato il lungo dolce del malto caramellato seguito dalla tostatura del malto, cioccolato e liquirizia con un finale amaro con ancora molta liquirizia e chinotto. Birra molto particolare, difficile berne la seconda pinta.
By far, my favorite, most consistant beer. It never fails to delight my taste buds. Be careful, it will introduce you to the wonderful world of hops.

Clear orange with massive, lacing head. Peach aromas derived from the yeast along with some caramel and grassy hops. Malt is nicely balanced by a mellow hop profile. Medium carbonation and body. Ends with citrus bitterness. A great beer.

Total classic, always makes me think of SF.  20 oz bottle into a pint glass. Pours light orange amber with thin creamy head. Aroma is slightly sweet malt with a hint of herbal hops. Taste is clean thin caramel malt with a dry somewhat creamy finish. Notes of lemon, oak, and grain. The lighter flavor from the amber body is a pleasant surprise, even after having it many, many times.

Block frothy head deep gold pour medium carbonation aromascitrus earthy the flavours honey lemon grain sweetness medium bitter more milder say sweet ale the citrus taste of grapefruit the finish rewarding ale best aftertastes honey grainy like sweetness hops okay ale on palate
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 Crisp and drinkable. Borders on watery but its well-balanced hop profile carries it through. A simple beer Americans can be proud of.

Clear orange with a decent white head. Aroma is peach, fruit peel ,bread, hint of mint and pale wood. Medium-light body, crisp & refreshing on the palate, slightly citrusy bitterness on the finish. Flavour is orange peel, grapefruit, hint of honey.

Pours amber with little head and no lacing.nose is fruity. Aromas of fruit, some light cereal, some light grassy hops. All in great balance. Tastes are light sweet and medium-light bitterness. Light body with lively carbonation. A really great beer for everyday drinking.

I dont know much about steam - or California Common - beers but I think I like  em. This one pours deep amber with a creamy head ripe for biting off. The aroma is unusual, combining butter, bread, grain, stone fruit and lemon. The taste is very hoppy, but more sour than citrusy, with a nougat malt structure.

Bottle.Clear  amber colour medium head. Aroma is yeast and bread with malts. The taste is bready and malty with a crisp dryness. Medium bodied with a slight carbonation. I quite like this beer, tastes fresh.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Nice clean looking poor.  Great frothy white head.  Yeasty, bready aromas first up as well as a woody cask like aroma that follows through into the flavour.  Dont really enjoy the wood/cask like taste Ithink that is what Im tasting.  The beer is tangy, tart almost acidic.  
Over all not a beer I really enjoyed unfortunatly the combonation of the woody cask flavour and tangy acidic taste wasnt for me.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2017 Pours a hazy orange-copper with a fairly buoyant rocky eggshell-khaki head that hangs around for a while. Nose involves hints of bubblegum and caramel, some minty herbal hop notes, light tropical fruit, and sweet grain. Nice sweet bitter balance, not too much of either. Creamy, fuller bodied, not heavy but certainly not light, with a pleasant lengthy bitter finish. Really nice brew, smooth and easy to drink but with plenty going on to keep it interesting. 

Rerate 4-7-17. Pours a glowing clear orange with a tall ff-white head that leaves thick waves and spots of lace. Nose involves dark sugar, toasted malt, dried fruit, and leafy hops. Somewhat sweet, decently bitter. Medium bodied, round, fairly active, fluffy yet crisp, with a cleansing drying toasty finish. At this point in my beer journey, I regard this as world class and goddamn enjoyable.

Very average beer, not much aroma not much taste but I guess this is the style but still dont understand the hype behind this one. Find this a bit to malty and sweet in the finish for it to be refreshing.

Havent had this in a while, but definitely remember the rating I would have given: not worth the hype or price tag. The bottle talks about its "absolutely unique" brewing process, but it winds up a very average beer. There are dozens of better choices in all kinds of styles for $10 a six-pack.

Medium carbonation, bit soft and oily. Bit of sweetness on the nose and in the taste, but also maltiness and some alcohol (even though weak). Taste is fruity, fresh cut grass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tastes a little sweet with a funky flavor to it. Kind of tastes like cough syrup. Very average. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
After a few sips this beer grows on you. Yes, a deep amber color and thick creamy head...Anchor Steam Beer has the ability to anchor you to your seat while drinking it

I digress. The draft I received was not great. I would be unfair to leave a poor rating based upon a single pour from a restaurant where the median age was 50. Not exactly craft beer central station. The bar tender informed me that there would be a delay in giving me the beer because of the tall head and she would add more to the cup after and she hated pouring this beer. She also informed me that this beer is special because it is steamed. Anyways, when I have a bottle I will officially rate it.?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 appearance: Bright orange. Lovely sugary broken white foam with great lacing.smell: I get dark honey / nectar. Sweet grains and malts. Surprisingly i?m not getting much hop smell from it.taste: It has a grainy dark honey sugary base flavor with some bittering hops through it to balance it out, its a bit like rye. The hops mellow out during the finish, leaving the lovely sweet malts and nectar like texture. mouthfeel:  Nectar like velvet. Syrupy. Very smooth and round. With some medium carbonation to freshen it up. Only the finish turns a bit bitter in a not great way after a while in the mouth. Its the dry rye like flavor that lingers. It?s quite sugary in texture, yet the hops gives it a nice light bitter kick.

Bottle. Clear amber liquid with medium to big off - white head. Aroma of biscuit, dried fruit, caramel bit yeast esters and light grassy hops. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of grain, biscuit and dried fruit. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice and balanced.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a hazy amber colour. Aromas of citrus and biscuit with taste being refreshing, slightly hoppy and bitter. Solid

Amber with an off-white head. Aroma is toffee with a little marzipan. Medium bodied with flavors of light caramel and nuts. Soft finish with mild hop bitterness. The perfect every day kind of beer - lots of flavor but perfect with most foods.
Bella schiuma compatta e aroma appena fruttato di albicocca. Amaro ben bilanciato con le note maltate. Ottima, va giù che è un piacere!
a little sweeter than i would have liked, a bit up front with the darker sugar flavors. still as a mass distributed beer, its better than most of whats out there.

35,5 cl bottle @ Viking Amorella Pub. Rated on 05.07.2009
Aroma is quite light with grainy malt, some hay and fruity notes. Flavour is somewhat stale with grainy malt, some fruity notes, caramel and hints of hay. Also the staleness typical to CCs is present. Decent.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 drank at home ( according to the bottle, this is 4,8 ABV , not 4,9 ) but its the same beer. 
such a funny looking ( feeling ) bottle ! 
pours clear, orange , white head with big bubbles. fades very fast . malty smell
taste is rich, high carbo, malts, sweetness ( from the malts i supose) . its ok, if someone told me this was another blonde abbey beer of belgium, id believe them straight away . so is this realy a diffrent style ( its my first CC ) ? its good, nevertheless. but not more than that.

Re-rate ( same score ) from a blind tasting with Dr. Beer. Served in black glassware. Smell is mostly breaddough maltyness. Mild fruityness, bit creamy. 
Taste is rather bitter, bit fruityness from the hops, but not intensely so. Mild sweetness, from the malts ( breaddough, pale malts ) Bit creamy. Assertive carbonation, but a decent body to support it. 
--- Note --- clearly I have learned a bit more about styles than when I first rated it. I still havent had many CCs ( this one, is perhaps one of the only one? ) But i did have a shitload of Belgian blondes, which I dont think are to be confused with this beer anymore...

Bottle. Pours a darker golden coloured beer with a nice, one finger of white head on top. Malty aroma with a slightly spiced touch in the background. Flavour is quite balanced between bitter and sweet, none of the two stands out eitherway, making it incredibly easy to drink and a nice quencher of thirst. This is not overall too special, just a nice, drinkable beer.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2013 One beer that reminds me of a great time spent in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. And a good one.

[10/12/2013] Shared a 33cl bottle from Cora (Luxembourg). Pours a dark amber colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is malty, caramel and lightly grapes. Average carbonation and light body. Taste is light bitter and light sweet, very suave, with a dry finish. Overall, a very nice and easy beer with low alcohol content making it a good choice for having some.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 From 12 ounce bottle at Johnny Rockets location at The Banks.  Light red/orange hue, small off white head, sweet bready/yeasty aroma, moderate bittersweet tart/tangy/bready flavor.  Like most beers, this one is better on draft but is certainlty worthwhile bottled.  Fritz Maytags rescue of the Anchor Brewing was certainly a precursor of the craft beer movement.  It behooves all craft beer fans to occasionally drink an Anchor brew in his honor.  Heres to your health, Fritz!
Drank from a bottle then in a glass.  I would recommend pouring first (as with all beer) however this one was noticeably different.  Well balanced,  light amber pour. Little aroma.

Anaranjada, con espuma no muy duradera.
Presencia de las maltas y el caramelo tanto en nariz como en boca.
Oleosa y con de cuerpo medio. Una gran cerveza.

Bottle into lager glass.  Amber color with creamy off-white head.  Aroma of toasty malt sweetness, some nuttiness and citrus hops.  Taste is bready sweetness, some spiciness balanced nicely with earthy hops.  Light body, well carbonated, effervescent, bitter finish.  Very tasty for a lager, I would have no problem drinking more.
For a light easy to drink lager, this fits the bill. Goes with light or mild tasting food that would go with white wine.
Amber orange color. Cereal, spicy and alchol aroma. Light sweet at taste with cereal and caramel flavour, smooth.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 This is a great easy to drink craft beer. If you like craft lagers, you will like this.
From bottle. Pours amber in color with nice head. Aroma was toasted malt, a slight sweetness and citrus hops. Taste follows. Clean taste and refreshing.

average frothy white head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. clear sparkling thick dark amberish-yellow body. aroma: heavy roasted malt, caramel. if: moderate sweet light bitter. ff: light sweet Bitter; AVERAGE duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonastion, metallic finish. agradável sabor maltado, 35 s
330ml bottle. Amber colour with a medium white head. Malty and fruity with exotic fruits, toffee, syrup, herbs and apricote. Nice bitter orange peel ending.

Nice clear amber color with a finger of white head and decent lacing.  Aromas of caramel malt, some grain and citrus. Toasted malt flavor with hints of caramel and citrus.  Earthy hop flavor in finish with mild bitterness.  Fuller than expected mouthfeel with moderate/high carbonation.  A well balanced beer that doesn't pretend  to be more than what it is, a well crafted, drinkable beer.  Had with a burger at Blancs Burgers and Bottles 2-1-13.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 It pours nicely with a reddish amber hue, and a nice foam head. Toasty malt taste. Good sturdy ale, One of the better larger craft brews.

Not quite amber and good bit of foam on the pour. Enjoyable session beer that I recall being a bit better years ago. Respectable!

Bottle: Pours a clear amber with a thin off-white head that has nice lacing. Has a sweet bready aroma with hints of caramel. Rich flavor has a woody character with hints of mint and caramel. Creamy texture and well balanced. A must have beer in your craft beer arsenal.

Dark golden orange color, half finger of off white head. Reasonable carbonation.

Cereal, toasted bread, slight cardboard and toffee. Very faint hops

Nothing fancy really. Good bodied lager that is easy to drink.

Decent California Common style lager. Some flavor of malt and hops, but mostly of carbonation. Okay, but wouldnt seek it out.

Lots of malt up front with a dry hoppy finish. One of the classics and reasonably priced as well.

---

Pours an opaque copper orange with a nice 2-finger white foam. Nice aroma of lightly roasted malts/cereals, toffee and some spicy hop notes. Balanced flavour of malts, herbal hops, yeasty flavours and some alcohol. Medium, slightly astringent bitter end, rounded out by more malt sweetness, and herbal, floral notes. A nice pre-prohibition style brew.
Not as good as I remember. One of my first craft beers, along with their Liberty Ale. The latter is better, but I will give this beer credit for being at the forefront of the craft beer movement.
A pretty nice ale. Nothing special.

12oz bottle pours golden tangerine yellow (Lovibond 6). Clear. 
Negligible aroma. Not unpleasant, just nothing notable. Slight head wet lace. 
Watery texture, metallic aftertaste. Tastes like paper. Newspaper. I think I detect the carbon too! Blech. 
Nothing really good to say so this review is done.

Deep amber color. Thin bodied, lager smooth, fresh taste while it lasts, but flavors quickly evaporate as soon as they become apparent. Very little to no aftertaste. For having almost no taste, its not a bad beer. Tastes like steam.
Drank in luxury in Florida.  The best way to waste time.  Might need a few more to finish the rating.
Nice session beer, bit nutty and appealingly dry. No signs of droppings anywhere though. Watching Jungle Book. Ace.

Easy to drink beer. I could drink 12 of these and not be overly full

Yes please!

(bottle 17/01-2013) medium beige head, clear amber color, high co2, rather boring taste, very light hoppy taste, light malty taste. BB date 7 2014.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 Bottle. Pours amber/mahogany with a tan head. Bready/malty aroma and taste.

Clear fox brown colour (note to 77ships: if there ever was a beer deserving this description, it is this one), off-white head. Aroma of malts and caramel, some spices. Floral hops when it warms up a little. Light bitter hoppy flavour, malts, bread, caramel and toast. Relatively full body for the ABV, sweet finish, light sticky, malts, some pleasant hops coming through.
Nice!
(From 355mL bottle @ home)

Kaatuu lasiin kullanoranssina ja kirkkaana vaahdon ollessa kolmen sormen paksuinen, melko nopeaan katoava, mutta kaunista pitsiä jättävä. Haju on hunajaisen ruohoinen, alta löytyy myös hedelmää, hiivaleipäistä mallasta ja multaa. Maku on bitteriin vivahtava, siitä löytyy pahkinää, hedelmää, ruohoa, hieman havua ja maata. Suutuntuma on jonkin verran hiilihappoinen ja katkerahko. Kokonaisuutena melko yksiuloitteinen, mutta alen ja lagerin ominaisuuksia yhdistelevä olut. Hajusta voisi luulla lasissa olevan pilsiä ja mausta brittibitteriä, jännä yhdistelmä.
355ml bottle- nice creamy white head. Dark orange in colour. good malt sweetness at first, then finishes with good hop bitterness.
Bottle at home. Clear deep golden color, small white head. Basic malty aroma. Taste of malts and some hops. Basic summer beer.

This is the first California Common/Steam Beer Ive tried.  Pours amber with a frothy tan head.  Aroma is very pleasing and bready.  It reminds me a bit of a dopplebock.  I get more of this on tasting as well as sweet almost caramel malt that dominates.  Very reminiscent of some dopplebocks Ive had as well as having a nutty quality similar to something like New Castle Brown Ale.  Light bitter hop finish that is somewhat spicy.  I know this style is based on the lager, but I dont get many tasting notes I usually associate with lagers.  This could be due to having mostly tried European Pilsners.  Still, if more American Lagers had this kind drink-ability and flavor Id be more inclined to drink them more often.

Tasted like it was old.  Have to try another one to give it a fair rating.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It poured a clear, golden amber and had lots of carbonation rising into the white head that dissipates fairly quickly. The lacing is ringy and spotty. The smell is malty and yeasty/bready, slightly sweet and nutty. The taste has the malts come back fairly strong, but not sweet, in more of a bitter sort of way. The palate is light, and has a dry finish and aftertaste. Overall, its not one of the greatest beers out there, but could be due to the fact, Im not necessarily a big fan of this style.

0,355 bottle from Za Popent shop in Ljubljana. Dark gold with orange reflections, big compact off white head but not long lasting. good lacing. intense sweet aroma of flowers and fruits. sweet milky taste, very malty and fruity. refreshig bitter from hops in the aftertaste. smooth texture, medium body, sticky mouthfeel. really nice brew, where you can feel both malts and hops, sweet, umami and bitter at the same time! refreshing but complex!

Bottle.  Pours a clear copper with a large head that dissipates slowly.  Bready aroma with a touch of fruit (apple, cherry).  Very clean flavor - slightly bready malt (not in an unpleasant way), a bit of fruit, some caramel.  A pleasant, easy-drinking beer.
copper color, aroma of citrus fruits, grain, bread, slight honey sweetness, good for a bland style
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 Beauitful citrus floral aroma. Taste is a classic lager - nondescript and unexceptional.
Havent had it in a while.  Just as good as I remember it.  Makes me wish I was back home in Northern California.

Bouteille. Nez moyennement fruité (agrumes, notes de pommes rouges), malté du genre caramel sucré (butterscotch, notes légères de miel), léger de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) avec des petites notes de de noix . Rondeur assez moyenne en bouche et un pétillement moyen. Léger goût fruité sucré (agrumes, traces de pommes) avec un léger goût de grains de malt aux notes terreuses lors de lentrée en bouche suivi rapidement dun goût moyennement sucré de caramel doux, léger de butterscotch et avec de faibles tracesde miel et de noix puis vient ensuite un léger goût amer de houblon floral et her herbeux. Post-goût moyen, avec une légère-moyenne amertume de houblon ainsi quun léger goût fruité.

Bel colore ramato e schiuma alta un paio di dita, aroma lieve luppolato e dolce, corpo medio e equilibrio di amaro e luppolo, molto beverina, mi è' piaciuta, personalità e tradizione.

December 16th, 2011 - Rating and reviewing Anchors Steam Beer nearly four years after I took up the craft beer hobby feels like a transgression against the whole of the field. I spent the last years chasing after glitzy new bottles and beers from far-flung places, when there was a seminal and classic cornerstone of brewing sitting on the shelves all this time. This is a drinkable institution, and I hang my head in shame that it took me so long to buy a six-pack. Once poured, this beer takes on a deep golden hue with a normal carbonation and a small off-white head. Caramel drips and dribbles in the aroma, off-set by a pilsner malt mineral quality, and the sweetness of deep, slightly heated glob of honey. A sip introduces a slight sweetness, but its gone before I can really get a taste of it. Where it drops off a blander maltiness appears. Its not as light or thin as a pale lager, in that the Anchor Steam tastes cleaner, with more of a mineral water flavor, and a neutral graininess, but no appreciable depth or complexity. Clean, uniform, crisp and somewhat austere, this might be the Scandinavian design of beers - classic in its style, and no doubt a master stroke in brewing despite the spartan flavors. However, I think Im addicted to deeper, darker stuff. Still, thats no reason not to look back and drink parts of craft brew history here and there.
Bottle. Pours clear amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of maæt and hops with a fruity note ate the end. Bitter taste of hops. Dry finish. Richly carbonated. Decent stuff.

Pours a deep copper color with a big white fluffy head. Fairly malty and sweet aroma. Very flavorful beer. Interesting notes of sweet, salt, bitter, fruity and a little citrus. Good body with a big punch of carbonation. Great balance and a beer I think anybody could like. I had been wanting to try this for a long time and am glad I did. Looking forward to trying other beers from this brewery.
Aroma:  caramel, herbal hops.  Appearance:  dark honey.  Taste:  mostly spicy and herbal hops, some toast.  Palate:  smooth and refreshing with lingering hoppy dryness.

Copper color, lively carbonation, creamy, average-sized off-white head. Aroma is very soft, reminds me of hay and a little of honey. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Bitter, nice, aftertaste. Taste is a little flat, easy to drink and mainly bitter.
Bottle. Pours copper with thin white head. Good carbonation, with a wheaty/yeasty aroma. Taste is bready and grassy with some malt. Long bitter finish.

Bottle from Mane Liquor
Very easy sessionable drinking beer. Pours light straw color with average head, light malt, biscuity flavours, summer drinking
amber, clear, minimal head, white foam, bread, hay, cereal, herbs, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Poured a clear copper color with a thin white head. Aroma is grass, citrus, hay, and floral. Taste is like bitter lemon grass and has a long bitter finish. This stuff is nice and refreshing and good with a steak.

Bottle at The Swan & Rushes, Leicester.  Dark amber with a decent head, plenty of fizz to look at.  Weak bready yeasty aroma.  Initially bitter and medicinal with some citrus/grapefruit notes coming through.  Lively mouthfeel.  Heavy.  Decent.

(bottle from Fakta, Hammel, DK) gold pour with white head. Unfortunatly tried this straight after the immense Liberty Ale so was going to be hard act to follow. Aroma/taste was light hops,pine and mineral malt, pleasing enough and easy drinking, but just slightly above average for me.

Aroma of yeast and a little hint of pine.  Pours a slightly reddish honey gold with a thick foamy white head.  Smooth, light bodied.  A little piney edge on the finish.  Not bad.  Just tastes like beer.
Has a weak aroma of bread and grass with a nice lagered, slightly thick and sticky mouthfeel.  Attractive beer, nice in small amounts.

Bottle. Pours clear copper with a nice white head. Aroma is malt, corn and rubber. Taste is light sweet, light bitter with a tiny sour note and slightly metallic aftertaste. Body is light, texture is watery.

23/11 0.355 l bottle. Finally got my hands on it, after maybe 5 fails all around Europe. New style also. It poured clear copper body with medium sized head. Aroma had some cheese which could be characterized as light smoked notes, caramel and touch of rubber. Flavor was slightly sweet, floral malty with, again some weak smoked notes. Medium bodied brew with nice long and pleasant finish, where hops showed a bit more. Actually better than Ive expected.
Cerveza color bronce. Con espuma blanca. Olor y sabor malteado suave. Ligeramente gaseasa. Refrescante.

Aroma ligero en donde destacan principalmente notas a malta, granos y caramelo.

A la vista, cerveza color cobre pálido, cuerpo ligero, carbonatación casi nula, corona de espuma ligera y de poca duración.

En boca los sabores que destacan son la sequedad y el amargor, en virtud de los lupulos utilizados.

Al paladar, esta cerveza Hibrida deja un excelente sabor y retrogusto. El amargor destaca, sin embargo es suave y no opaca las caracteristicas de la bebida. Es suave y fácil de tomar son llegar a parecerse a una laguer o pilsner. Hace notar sus caracteristica y apego al estilo.

En general una buena cerveza, sabrosa, fácil de tomar, distinguiendose de las laguers o pilsner con su sabor definido a maltas, su sequedad imponente y su suave amargor!
Bottle->SA glass. Copper with 1/2 inch white head.  Aroma of hops and malt (light).  Taste is slightly bitter malt and pepper.  Decent, if boring.
Bottled. Pours light copper. Light hops aroma, light caramel malts taste. Pretty refreshing and sessionable.

Bottle. Pours an orange-yellow with a thin white head, not much retention, no lacing  (could be the glass). Nose is mainly malt. Mouth is dry, malt, and a bready finish, with some hops bitterness. Been a LONGGG time since I had this one (mid 90s?) but its average at best.

Bottle. Pours a milky yellow with a slight brown. Not as clear as a traditional lager, Taste not as clean as a lager, not as fruity as an ale. Light hops balance moderate sweetness. Good session beer with unique yeast.

330ml bottle - Pours a nice amber colour with a quickly diminishing tan head. Has an aroma of honey and fruits, light hops. Taste is light hops and slightly sweet. Drinks very smooth. A good beer.
Had this in San Francisco. Very tasty when cold. Darker amber color. Smooth going down.

Bottle poured a copper color with a significant off white head.  Aromas of musty malts and floral notes.  Flavors if bitter malts and slightly sour fruityness.  The finish is dry with subtle undertones if hops!

From notes: Poured clear amber with a 1-finger off-white head.  Mild aroma consisting of caramelly malt with a touch of citrus.  Medium body, with a brief finish.  Nutty malt taste, with a touch of piney hops beneath.
Had a bottle by the mighty Pacific in San Francisco while watching the sun set. Magic! Beer was very refreshing with a nice hop character and a clean finish. Lovely!

Bottle. Pretty darkish cobber amber with a medium creamy off white head. Lots of bubbles in the liquid. Aroma is malty, some barn and rye bread. Wonderful spritzy carbonation with lots of small bubbles. Flavor is sweet, caramel malty with a slight peppery bitterness. Nice and fresh - wonderful summer beer!
From bottle. Orange amber hue white head dissipates quickly. Cracker grainy slightly sweet aroma. Light body cracker taste dry finish. This is how a good light beer should taste.

A nice color and head but too much carbonation. Ive got gas coming out of places I didnt know gas could come out of after drinking it. Taste us better than a lot of big brewers. Pretty good but not up there on my list of favorites.

Pours a clear golden amber color with a creamy white head that dissipates quickly but leaves a small ring. Smell is very yeasty like a pilsner with aight fruitiness. Taste is yeasty up front with a nice well balanced bitterness on the end. Very dry finish as well.
Orange colour, white head. Yeast, vegetables, caramel. Light bitterness. Pretty dull.
Bottle. Bready farm notes with overtones of lingering body odour.  Thin, metallic, yellow and bland.

great color, slightly excessive carbonation, but could be due to too quick a pour.  Smells like a lager, with mild taste.  Smooth palate with refreshing flavor.  not much bitterness.  very easy drinking beer.

Nice fruityness from the yeast. Beautiful copper hazy beer with huge white head.   Some warmth and bread from malts. Not very bitter. Reminds me of a subtle malty saison with less acid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice amber color, with adequate foamy head. Rich flavor and nice finish. I had always heard about Anchor Steam during the days when American macro-brews ruled, now I know why! A reputation well deserved

12 oz. bottle.  Pours golden brown with a thick off white head.  Not too much on the smell - possibly slightly eggy if anything.  The taste is excellent, combining dryness, bitterness, caramel, spice and malt.  The drinkability of this beer is what makes it so good.  You can actually drink a few of these in the same way you might do with a lager but there is so much more taste and less carbonation.  Overall, I recommend trying this beer if youve not done so yet.
almost no aftertaste whatsoever... kind of weird because it just kind of cuts out immediately with the flavor... the only taste i really get is hops
Nice golden brown color, with off color white head. I smell malt, wheat, caramel, and citrus. I taste of the same and hops. Nice....

Virtually unmistakable. Almost orange in colour and slightly hazy. Thick hoppy-sweet palate and nice bitter finish. I have drunk this beer sporadically over some 30 years and still rate it up there amongst the best.
The beer has an amber color with a small head. Mild aroma of hops and citrus. Taste has more malts and hops which give it a crispness. There is also a little pepper. Refreshing finish.
Fantastic Brew. A must pick up if you see it at your local beer store. Smooth, and refreshing.

pours clear nice golden with a nice off-white head, some retention and lacing. plenty of malts, toasted wheat, oranges, very fruity, peppery. some dry caramel, light nuttiness. very nice grassy-citrusy golding-like finish. average to soft carbonation, medium oily body. really enjoyed. quenching. thought this one would be boring.
Bottle @ home... It pours clear deep golden with a medium tan head.... The aroma is malt, caramel, flowers and citrus...... The flavor is malt, hops, yeast and caramel......

33cl beer. Light red brown color. Shady. Sugar aroma of apples and hops, hint of sweets. Caramel perhaps. Fruits, say peach and more for taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aspetto limpodo con schiuma abbastanza persistente. Al naso malto con sentori di caramello, vaniglia e liquirizia. In bocca amaro equilibrato tendente al dolce. Non troppo persistente. Esce molto pulita.

0.355 bottle. Very small, almost instantaneously disappearing head. Coppery-colored, clear liquid. Somewhat fruity aroma, sweet to an extent, slightly alcoholic and definitely some adjuncts mixed with slight whiskey scents. Delicate, crisp taste, mostly bitter, brings in mind corn. Light to medium body, thin texture and not really soft, but less than average carbonation. Pretty short finish, leaving some bitterness behind, watery. Overall the brew is enjoyable but mostly due to its drinkability. Fine for a casual evening with friends, not overly sweet.
Bouteille 355 ml. 4,8%. Couleur ambrée, mousse blanche. Arôme de malt, caramel. En bouche, grains, un peu de houblon, un peu de caramel. Finale un peu amère, malt. Très bonne.

Does not have a whole lot of aroma. Pours a copper color with soapy white foam doesnt last little lacing lots of carbanation. Taste is verybitterwith a apple juice after taste. Overall a little upset I had hoped fora lot more from this one.
Amber pour with a decently lasting head. Aroma is pretty straight forward sweet malt. Flavor is pretty non descript. A bit earthy a little sweet. Not the biggest fan

Always a favorite of mine, Anchor Steam pours a lovely amber with a little white head. It is lacking in nose, but its taste is always great, and its mouthfeel is smooth and rich. The finish is a little bitter and dry, but overall it is still and excellent brew.

This is an ok beer. Pours a amber color and leaves a white head. I thought the taste was kinda bland. Initially it has notes of citrus and hops that quickly fade and leave a bitter, unpleasant taste on your palate. Overall, it was ok.
I really enjoy this beer, Ive yet to find another california common or steam beer that tops this..

I really thought I rated this before.... Guess not. On tap at local chicken place. Pours amber with off white head. Nose of toast and flowers. Crisp mouth. Ample cereal and toast malt with flowery finish.
Golden pour with a thick head. Smell is very much bread/wheat, nice.Taste is strong bread as well. Fairly oily mouthfeel. Good enough backyard beer.

Bottled.  Pours a pale amber with ample off-white head.  Light, fruity aroma.  Flavor is crisp and simple, a nice balance of hops and malt with neither really predominating.  Finish is slightly bitter.  Mouthfeel is on the thin side, but very smooth and pleasant.  Light to medium bodied.  A very clean and refreshing, though not all that complex, classic.

Pours orange with a small white head. Aroma is a sugar sweet, but an unpleasant wheaty. Taste is sweet an also slightly wheaty, but very light and pleasant. Feel is a nice balance of watery and thick.
Flaska från SB. Gansak OK men sticker inte ut. Kort smak. Kraftigt kolsyrad.

Bottle 10.10.2012
Visual: Pours clear golden, medium foamy white head
Aroma: Malty, slightly sweet bread aroma.
Taste: Slightly bitter, light body, oily feel, light bitter finish.

rated by Sumonation
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2013 Bottle purchased somewhere in the middle of Germany... Decent - middle of the road beer... Re-rated on 18 January, very malty, little hops.

Crisp and full tasting.  Slightly fruity hoppy palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
light sweet bread aroma,golden, clear, off white foam, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, lively, light bitter finish.

From wikipedia: "Steam Beer Brewing had produced awful, sour beer through the 1950s and into the 60s". I dont t think thats changed. Pours a coppery gold. Smells and tastes of biscuits, vague spice, moldy bread and  not much else. Glad I got the style marked off, though.

Medium goldish orange with a lacy lasting thin bubbly head. Smells of light floral and malt with oranges. Medium creamy body with carbonation. Tastes sweet at first with cereal, smooth malt and lager elements and a bitter grassy hoppy long dry earthy finish. Interesting but overly grassy.

Pours clear copper with a thick, creamy head. Aroma of hay and bread, malty but not that fruity, only little fruity notes. Taste is malty with flavours of bread and biscuit. Moderate hop bitterness balance. Light to medium bodied, a bit abrubt finish. Drinkable but simple.

Pint at FS.  Good copper color and lacing, smells a lot like straight-up malted barley, light.  Its predominantly malty, slightly bitter in the aftertaste.  Roasted nuts and basement dust stick out.  Just an outstanding beer, a modern classic.
Bottle. Bottled in Amsterdam. Very light amber. Slight hazy. Half finger foam. Faint malty spicy notes. Crisp bitterness. Some depth in the taste of subtle fruity. Nice ancient microbrew.

35cl bottle from ABCBeers.
Ok white head.  Clear amber pour.  Quite refreshing.

Pours a very clear copper with a nice white head, not too much visible carbonation in the brew. Head retention seems to be minimal. Some fine lacing on the glass. Has a fruity and slightly chocolatey notes, noting super noticeable about the hops until the lingering finish. Nice malty taste, very little bitterness and I cant taste much hops at all. It has a very slight sweet touch to it which lingers for quite awhile. Low carbonation that carries across the top of the tongue and lasts for a little while. Slick texture.

Pint glass, clear copper to orange color. Frothy finger plus of head. 
Lager yeast smell, borderline metallic.
Crisp and clean tasting. Dry bitter throughout. Some pear and green apple at the end. 
Lighter body, moderate carbonation. 
Interesting enough style, not my favorite though.

355 ml. bottle @ home. Lighter shade of amber with a touch orange, clear with a white head. Smell is rather fruity, plenty of spices, toffee and touch plastic plus some light blended whiskey which is a pretty curious given. Body is very highly carbonated, too bad. Tastes of plastic, apples, grains, herbal with spices, lots of flowers, odd plastic fruits, light bitter root,  herbal aftertaste, tad lager-esque. Odd blend of boring and lightly curious and engaging qualities.
Used to be a favorite many years ago but now just about average.  A good beer to introduce someone to the early beginnings of craft type brewing.

Heres an Anchor beer that I thoroughly enjoyed. Reddish amber, with generous (but brief) white head. Nose is fruity, with interesting biscuits to chose from. Flavour is complex, comfy, with malts hidden in a cascade of bubbles and fruits. Very pleasant finish. Glad that such an iconic beer did not disappoint.
On draft at t klooster in Delft. Clear amber pour with a fine light head. Slightly floral nose. Hint of toffee in the flavor.
Nuts, toast, coffee, caramel, bread, pine and very mild oak (sap?). Very clear copper with foamy head. Great balance and sustained finish. Excellent beer.

Pours a clear orange, huge amount of meringue-like white foam, lots of bubbling going on. Aroma is bready and sweet, with some citrus fruits. Taste is a little thin, roasted malts with a dry hoppy finish.
Cerveza de color oscurito, sabor no muy intenso y amargor muy muy ligero. Está curiosa pero no es nada del otro mundo.
Amber with thick offwhite head. Malty aroma, some pepper. Dry taste, medium bitter. Refreshing.
On tap in Lemmys. Pours a pleasant orange with little head. Aroma of fruity hops and a similar taste. Pleasant if not stunning.
Amber coloured, slight malt and bitter taste, overall well balanced, not a bad beer

Aroma of old caramel, a hint of chocolate, ashes, and hints of orange peel. Decent, inoffensive mouthfeel. The taste is ash bitter with some citrus-and-caramel sweet, as well as some hop bitter. I cant help but feel this could have been a much, much better beer, were it not for the ash notes.
A dark yellow to amber colored ale little head. Aroma of hops and a bit of fruit but not a lot else. Taste good with hops and a bitter finish, pleasant enough, not unduly demanding.

Ambrata con riflessi ramati, schiuma beige chiaro abbastanza persistente.
Naso piuttosto semplice con note erbacee e tostate.
Secca, corpo scarso, abbastanza amara......
Non male ma cè di meglio......
Medium amber in appearance with small cream color head. Crisp taste and lightly bitter hops with a good malty and hops aftertaste.
12 oz bottle from Whole Foods in London, clear golden hue with white head, light to medium body, smells a bit of grain and hint of lemon, drinkable

Pours a deep copper color with a decent off white foamy head that sticks around to the glass and rides the beer out for a bit.  On the nose its subtle with malty earthy notes and a touch of sweetness; vanilla, caramel.  On the palate it has alot of the same but is surprisingly quenching with a nice touch of bitter hops to liven up the flavor profile. A true california common that is a real American beer.
Faint, watery hops on the nose. Dark amber with a small foam. Taste is light hops and bread/oat filled malts. Overall, it tastes a little watered down. Easy drinkability though. B- rating.
Bottle from wegmans sterling - pours a clear orange with a white head. Aroma is a bit malty. The taste is sweet with a few bitter notes. Palate is creamy and dry. Overall, pretty good, but boring.

A solid beer, not incredible but a great drink. Pours a caramel color. Taste is sweet with malt and a bit of fruit evident, but finish is a bit too bitter. Nose wasnt very big though, not much too it.

From bottle. pours a dark amber colour with thin lacy head. sweet malty nose, caramel, light orange hints.  Moderately sweet initially with a malty chewiness that develops into a deft bitter ending. A little to carbonated for my tastes, sharp fizzy mouthfeel that no doubt carries a lot of the flavour and aroma but not to my tastes.

Enjoyed in a plastic cup on-board Virgin America on my annual flight to San Francisco for my birthday. Reviewed at 30,000 feet as we ascend over the Sierra Nevadas. 

A - Pours a burnt caramel slight orange appearance. Solid creamy off-white head that is a finger and sticks around fading slowly over 5 minutes. It never fully goes away. 

S - Not a huge amount of scent. Some burnt orange and birch notes. Some sugary notes. Vanilla maybe. 

T - Start is sweet and sweet. Middle reminds me of a solid lager. Finish is a bit too burnt for me. Too bitter and harsh at the finish. 

M - Lots of carbonation. Medium body. 

O - Solid beer. Drinkable and great for bbqs. Not that impressive or complex.

Light maltiness. Pine , soft grass. Never got the appeal of this one. It's ok. Nothing special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Breeze Thru. Pours a very clear yellowish orange. Nice white head that lasts and lasts, leaving a wedding dress lacing. Aroma has sweet malt, sour fruit and old beer hall. Taste is of sweet toffee, some straw, a bit of fruit and an earthiness. Finishes earthy and dry, without much length. The first few Anchors tried, we always were convinced it was the water. Shrug? It may just not be very good beer.

A great beer.  Light and drinkable, but the flavor and aroma arent sacrificed.  Hints of evergreen and piney hops.  Refreshing maltiness to balance out.  Just a little bit of spiciness on the aftertaste.

Bottle, feels fairly fresh.  About as classic an amber looking beer as you can get with al little soft nice head and lace.  Aroma is thin, fruity and malty, with a clean but not distinct hop component. Flavor is fruity, malty, with a bit of toffee and light non flavor bitter and slightly metallic finish.  Body is light and clean.  I wish this was better.
A perfectly drinkable beer, usually - Ive had a couple of bad pints of it though.  Its a tiny bit fizzy, with a thin head (at least, this one is).

Pint draft at pour 24 las Vegas. B gold-amber in color, thin lacing, thin head. Bananna esther flavors, medium bitterness, but not much hop aroma or flavor. Somewhat smooth, but not especially flavorful. Meh. Rougher than a pale ale, not as interesting as a kolsch. Not a repeat.

Bottle 355ml.
Pours dark golden with low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of malt, bananas, sweetness. Taste is of malt, fruits (bananas). Dry finish. Overall: Not easily drinkable. Not too bad, but I woulndt say its a good beer.

Botella de 355ml. Copa Pokal. Sesión de cata de Cervecera única en agt´12. (Disfrutada muchas veces en el pasado).Color ámbar/cobre y apariencia algo velada. Espuma marfil que crea una corona algodonosa. La capa, que se disipa con rapidez, deja una fina línea en la superficie. Aromas de maltas caramelo y tostadas con trazos de lúpulos cítricos. Sabores de maltas, leve dulzor y caramelo. Cuerpo medio-ligero y carbonatación alta. El amargor del lúpulo en el intermedio queda cubierto por las maltas tostadas. Suave sensación en el paladar. Final seco con algo de dulce, grano y leves notas cítricas.
355ml bottle. Pokal glass. Single brewer tasting session on agt´12. (Enjoyed many times in the past). Amber/Copper color. Chill haze. Off-white froth creates a rocky crown. Quickly dissipated head leaves a thin layer on top. Caramel & toasted malt aromas with citric hoppy hues. Flavors of malts, light sweetness & caramel. Light to medium body. High carbonation. Hop bitterness in the middle is covered by toasted malts. Smooth palate. Dry finish with some sweet, grainy & slightly citric notes.

Pours golden amber with tiny off white head. Aroma: bubblegum, bananas, malt. Taste: malt and fruits. Really sweet. Drinkability is medium due to high sweetness. Nothing outstanding, but nothing terrible neither.

Bottle (12 oz). Clear amber with a small creamy off-white head and some lacing. Aroma of malt, banana, bubblegum and citrus. Taste is sweet and sugary with malt, fruits and banana. Slightly dry finish. Not so drinkable because its too sugary.
Love this beer. Smooth classic beer, roasty, toast, alcohol, woody, woody, smoke, banana

Pours a medium amber with a creamy head. Aromas of grain, grass, light hints of caramel, and spruce. Flavors or mild all around with light mixes of spruce, grassy, faint hint of toffee, and grain. There is certainly a more fuller body. Its almost to the point where its "chewy", or resin like on the palate. Its also lower in carbonation. Well done Id say all around. Wow, I guess Im just very surprised at this one. Definatly a 4 on the palate scale. Man, being surprised in a good way is what makes rating that much better for beer. Theres a faint nuttyness to it as well. Mostly a clean finish but leaves a little grainy aftertaste. I think after trying so many lagers that leave that horrible dreaded grain/corn aftertaste, this doesnt seem to matter much. Has more of a velvety texture. Pretty smooth. Well done. Im going to have to put this at the top of one of the better lagars Iv had. The flavors arent complex but its more in the body and on the palate that makes all the difference.

Pours a darker honey gold colour with a thin head that dissipates quite fast. A slight caramel aroma with an even slighter hint of fruit. A somewhat emptier taste with not much carbonation. Leaves a  bitter taste but nothing much else.
Some vanilla and malts in the nose. Bit of bitterness on the back of the tongue.

On draft..only thing to really say about this is that it deserves credit for expanding the craft beer market for years when the craft beer market didnt exist. A decent choice at an establishment that really has no better offerings, goes well with most food.

Bottle. Dark golden body with a small head. Quite weak malty aroma with some caramel. It must have lost most of it while being shipped over the Atlantic. Taste is one dimensional: not too watery but flavors are light and pretty simplistic. Finish offers medium bitterness. Nice label.

Poured at home (Jan 12) from a 355ml bottle to a an amber orange colour, slightly hazy and with a thin head that moved to the edges after a few minutes.

On the nose I get a sweet floral hop aroma, grassy, straw with sweet malts thrown in.

On the palate caramel is the predominant taste with a mild hint of butterscotch, closely followed by malts with a crisp clean finish and aftertaste with some hop flavours, but not at all strong in this sense.

Medium carbonation, medium body an enjoyable drink!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 12 ounce bottle.  I guess this is the original "steam beer."  Its a pretty humdrum style.  Aroma is yeast and malt, aka the Duffs beer smell.  Appearance is amber.  Palate has higher than average amounts of carbonation.  Taste - Slight chemical taste, but otherwise nice and run of the mill, traditional lager flavor.  Overall - Homer would have one of these at Moes.

Bottle. Hazy reddish copper color with a thin head. Mild sugary aroma of caramel. Earthy taste with some caramel. Slightly bitter finish. Thats my 1st rating of this style so I didnt quite know what to expect.

Bottle shared at a tasting in our place. Pours clear golden with a condensed white head. Rich malty aroma, honey, warm. Tastes bitter, malty and a little hoppy. Light body, soft carbonation, malty, bitter finish.

The king of the micros and craft beer. Not great probably a bit overrated but it is a good beer, Certainly more heartier than a basic lager. Lots of grains going on dry goes down smooth and easy good summer beer. Seemed to get more intersting as it warmed. Solid 3 beer here.
A very special and rare beer to get in Germany. It smells very nice, the taste is like roasted hops but with a very bitter downing, what I didnt like at all.
0,35 l bottle. Amber in colour, light caramel, surprisingly bitter. A bit smokey, definitely something special but definitely for fans, especially when you had a sweeter one before this.
Copper coloured and clear with a medium head and body. Also medium bitterness. A bit smoky in the beginning with a sweet smell. Dry with balanced hops which could be more intensive.
Orange amber, malty sweet aroma; dry and malt balance, raw grain/barley/wheat in the flavor; medium body-good for a summer night; finishes tangy and dry.

Really great example of a steam beer. A lovely amber appearance precipitates an easy drinking, easy going beer. Tasty, with much more depth of flavour than most beers of this type and a nice subtle nutty finish.

A legend in the craft beer industry, Im enjoying this refreshing brew on a rainy autumn afternoon.

A: Sunburst orange to golden in color, this beer has a massive, thick head like a cumulus cloud floating on a golden river. As the head recedes, it leaves a noticeable residue on around the circumference of the glass.

S: Malt, lager scents. Rather simple and inviting.

T: A really refreshing beer with a clean and easy taste, I find this to be rather enjoyable. There is a nice maltiness throughout, with a subtle hop bitterness near the back. There are delicate hints of fruit in there, as well. Overall, a very solid brew.

M: Medium bodied, and thicker than your average >5% beer. Again, a very pleasant beer to drink.

D: Very sessionable and enjoyable. Absolutely worth a try.
If you are a human, this beer is for you. Middle of the road, yes, but in a good way.

Bottle. Orange amber with a thinnish, but robust layer of tan scum. Nose has honey, sweet malt, clotted cream, treacle toffee. In the mouth, the beer feels creamy  and gives what the nose was promising - honey, malt, cream, toffee. Theres a slight nutty quality to it too and some vanilla. A slight dry bitter to the finish and an incredibly drinkable brew.

Aroma has caramelly sweet malting. Bit cloudy red/brown, short head. Taste is more bitter and has more evident hoppiness than aroma. Finish has bit sweetness. Tasteful: mango and pineapple here also. Medium bodied, perky, lively carbonation. Overall this work fine for me.

Has a unique aroma i cant place and a hint of sweetness. Its clear light amber/orange in color and has a little head retension. Its not to sweet and has a low hop flavor/bitterness but has a slightly bitter aftertaste. Its light bodied and crisp. Its not a bad brew worth a buy

Pours a nice orangish light amber with a none sustaining tan head and no lacing. The aroma is sweet malts. I found the taste is malty but also very grainy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: SEP 30, 2013 Pours a light amber. Aroma and taste similar to a lager. Has a strong malt and light fruit hops taste and aroma. Very plain. N
