355ml bottle. Clear orangey golden colour with small, frothy, moderately lacing, off-white head. Slightly fruity malt aroma, with unsweet notes of rhubarb, strawberry, a strawy touch, leather. Impressingly mouth filling, minimally sweet fruity taste, else mostly dry husk notes.
This is my first California Common. Smelled and tasted lagerish but with a nuttiness thats usually found in ales. A bit thin, but pretty good I wouldnt mind drinking it again.

Years ago I avoided this because so many California yuppies liked it.  Today I finally tried it for what it is.  22 oz bottle pours a clear copper/amber color with a moderate white head and some lacing.  Smells malty.  Aroma is of  lighltly roasted caramel malts with some hops, Taste is toffee sweet at first with a dry finish.  Body is thin to medium, and carbonation is lively.  Good, but nothing Ill rave about, especially since I found a local clone of this style (Argus California Steam) which is at least as good.  Im glad to have tried this one and and glad to now say "been there, done that".

Can't believe I haven't rated this. Clear, light copper pour with a small white head. Aroma of sweet, bready malts with a touch of citrus. Clean, crisp, refreshing palate that has more sweet malts, citrus and gives way to a grassy finish. Nice session and easy drinker.
Oarange/copper in color.  Slight malt tones in the front with a lingering bitter after taste.  Style is definatley unique.

This beer was presented to us as an "American classic," so we were expecting it to be specific in its own flavor but also crowd pleasing enough to suit the general masses. Maybe we were expecting too much because when we tried it, our response was, "Meh, its okay." We didnt dislike it, but it didnt leave a lasting impression on us either.
Just like hofbrau hefeweizen, Jonathan really likes this. Another plain watery beer.
33,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Traverse, Utrecht. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma of lightly roasted malts. Good bitter hop taste with some earthy tones. Creamy texture. A great summer beer.

Pours an amber colour with a small white head. Aroma is malty with some caramel, fruit and hints of spices. Taste is also malty with caramel and citrus notes leading to a moderate bitter finish. Quite a nice lager.

Aroma: Malt and alcohol are sticking out a lot. Caramel is there but alcohol is too harsh. Its killing all other aromas.
Appearance is clear amber. Head is generous and long lasting with nice lacing.
Taste: Metallic attack, lively carbonation, very slight butter and biscuit accents. Not much to say about that one beside a lack of personality and flavors. Almost bland
Bottle. Aroma is hops, earthy, slightly citrus. Taste is malty with some hops, but generally sweeter.

Pours a medium orangish copper from the bottle with decent white head that dissipates and moderate lacing. Aroma is of sweet caramel and resin malts. Taste follows suit, but a nice bitter finish to add a little hop characteristic. Not a bad beer overall, but Anchor makes better ones.

Golden amber pour with medium sized off white head. Aroma of malts, hops and caramel. Taste of malts, slight toffee sweetness and a slight hoppy finish. Very crisp and refreshing on a hot day, perfect carbonation. Good beer.

Drank in a restaurant in Fishermens Wharf, San Francisco, CA. Pours an opaque orange with an off-white head that leaves a tiny lacing. Aroma is malty, one-dimensional with notes of grains, ripe orange and nuts. Taste is pretty standard, like a good Premium Lager with slightly more body. Moderate sweetness and a tiny hint of acidity. Refreshing. I think its Californias equivalent to our chilean Kunstmann Torobayo, even though theyre different styles. Easy to drink, well-done summer beer.
Amber pour with a decently lasting head. Aroma is pretty straight forward sweet malt. Flavor is pretty non descript. A bit earthy a little sweet. Not the biggest fan, but a classic.
Has a very slight sweet aroma. Taste is  very plain. Watery not much bitterness at all.
Pale yellow color with decent white head. Smells like typical summer brews. Lemons and grains. Taste is the same with a smooth finish and some lingering tartness. Decent summertime brew.

I drank this straight from the bottle, so it was difficult to rate the aroma & appearance.  The flavor was earthy, wood, etc.  Nice crisp and refreshing taste.  Ive tried this a few times and always enjoyed it.
Not very impressed. Theres a hint of greatest in it but the finish is lacking that Cali common flare.

Pours a nice amber with a lasting 1/2" head. Aroma of yeast and generic malt. Decent palate but not that interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Clear dark amber color. Small beige head, stays. Good lacing. Weak aroma. Bit dusty, grassy, hops, faint malty, weak caramel in aroma. Mild dry hopy, slightly sweet and bitter. Nice bitter ending. Nice beer.

24oz bottle. Been awhile since Ive had this, and I like it better than before, but it still has something odd going on. Very interesting though. Very fruity with a dry hop kick. Sour lager on its base but much deeper than euro trash. Pretty copper with foamy head. Fresh and tasty.

Copper pour with a white head and lacing. Subdued aromas of hops, malt, metal, oak and nutty aromas. The flavour profile is equally subdued. Little dry on the palate with medium carbonation.

Decent....that's all really!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle to pint.  Looks good; a deep copper with nice lacing.  Smells decent.  Tastes solid; a nice amber malt flavor.  Mouthfeel is average.  Good.
Deep flavours with a light, sharp twist. Tastes almost caramel but leaves an odd metallic aftertaste..
One of my favorite summertime beers. Clean and crisp finish.  Mild, but nice flavor.
On tap at Cherry Reds in Kings Heath, Birmingham. Rich, malty flavour. Nice.

330 ml bottle. Slightly unclear amber body with a fine off-white head. Aroma is malt, light caramel and a bit floral spicy. Flavor is mild malt, light caramel, balanced bitterness and spicy. A fine classic from the time capsule.
I wish it had a better finish. It also gets worse as you finish the bottle. Glad I tried it, but never again.

Not much of a scent or taste, little bit coppery. Would be good for camping though!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My favourite traditional california local beer. Not adventurous, but pleasant & fitting the climate. nice balance
The color is yellow-brown, the head ok. It smells intensive, hoppy and a bit bitter, malty. Interesting, and good. 12/10/9/10/1310
Very clean refreshing taste. Gold brown color at pour. Thin white foamy head. Slight bitterness

On tap at Village Pizzeria in San Francisco (Pacific Heights) - Pours dark and clear with a generous head that dissipates fairly quickly. Has a malty biscuit flavor to it. Has a thin mouthfeel and Finishes slightly dry.
355ml bottle. Clear copper body, medium yellow head. Aroma of caramel, herbal hops, roasted nuts, some cheesiness. Taste is on the sweet side, herbs, caramel, malt, light on the hops. Average.
Pours a clear dark tan with a thick foamy head. Of course, I did that with my pour.  Light alcohol aroma, not exactly what I expected. Flavor is a bit dry, but good. Slightly roasted malts.

pours amber with a white fluffy head. aroma is brown sugar, caramel, bread, and herbs. taste is very carbonated, grass and herbs, with a dry bitter finish. there is toasted bread, and a resin quality to the hops. its a nice drink.

Pours a carbonated red with a long lasting white head.  Aroma is very bready with some grassy undertones.  Taste is still bready, with some lemon and grassy touches.  A bit sour.  The lemony, sour flavors stick with the aftertaste for a long time.  Medium bodied, not very carbonated.  An ok beer without any negatives or positives.

Pours amber with a thick creamy head.  The aroma is malty.  The taste well balanced and smooth.  I dont get the "uniqueness" that the beer promises but it is very drinkable.  While not being all that original in my opinion, its got a nice taste.  Decent.

Bottle. Pours clear orangeish amber with a medium off-white head that dissipates with a bit of lacing. Aroma is malty, perhaps a bit of caramel, with grass and grain notes. Taste is grain, roasted malt, with a mild bitter finish.

bottle at steakhouse - Pours amber-red with a thick foamy head that lasted.  Smell muted but slightly malty - of hay.  Taste smooth, malty, easy drinking.  Felt like could have kept drinking it all night.
Golden pour, quickly fading head. Stale hops and cardboardy biscuit malts. Its a bit dusty. Not a whole lot here, but its somehow strangely appealing.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2012 Grainy beer; touch of sweetness also.  Easy to drink, low ABV (California Common), refreshing.  OCTOBER REVISIT of Anchor Steam - Nice aroma of toasty malts with a little bit of Juicy Juice.  Head and lacing are a little weak, but the color is a nice amber.  Flavor is a little light, but whats there is very pleasant - some bready malts with a bit of caramel.  I like this a little better than I remember - a subtle, classy beer.  DAY AFTER COMMENTS: Man, this is even fruitier and tastier after sitting in a colder fridge than the one I got it from in the craft store.  Not re-rating it per se, but its always interesting how much temperature, dating, etc. can play a role in how a beer smells and tastes.

One finger thick head that lasted till the last drop. Clear and copper in color. Hard to place the smell but pleasant. Taste is very refreshing and good. Robust taste when it touches your young and has a crisp after taste. B+. would buy again. 

- time for a fresh beer
Aroma is sweet and malty.  Pours a light amber with a nice white head.  Taste is sweet and malty with a bit of hop bitterness at the end.  Good beer.
A beer for the bar/pub. Fits perfectly with snacks, potato chips or peanuts in company with good friends.

Copper, clear, off white persistent head. aroma:  grainy malt with some caramel and toasty notes, moderate hop aroma. Flavor:  grainy-sweet malt, light toast, balancing bitterness, low esters, finishes with woody Northern Brewer hop flavor. Easy drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355 ml bottle from Big Ridge. Pours an  orange/amber with little head. Aromas of cereal and malt. Very smooth but not very distinctive. Malt start and bitter hops finish. Not much in between.
Copper/Dark yellow with head.  Interesting beer that treads the line between "clean crisp easy drinking" and "flavourful" quite well.  Grainy malts run the show but it stays balanced.

Nice amber colored pour. Small off-white to white head that sticks around for a little bit. Small amount of lacing. Nice malty aroma with a bit of hops. Taste is a smooth malt flavor rounded out with a bit of a hop presence, but not overly so. This is one of my regular buys and cant believe I havent rated this until now. Clean and smooth.

Bottle from Alko. Amber color, medium white head. Slightly bitter taste with nuts, some hops, caramel, toast and dry finish. Pretty high carbonation in the bottle version at least. Unique and very enjoyable brew.
A mild tasting microbrew, but a good choice as it has a fine texture and taste.

I really enjoyed this beer in SF; its still good but so much better there. Maybe I just like SF, but this beer brings it all back. None of the descriptors relate beer to place; I cant imagine SF without this beer, and unfortunately vice versa. 
Im surprised this isnt more highly rated; its nearly a national brand yet tastes like beer should, bud.

This has been one of my favorites for several years. Great nut brown appearance.
Has a slight sweet taste with apparent hoppiness. 
I prefer it from draught but bottle is enjoyable too.
Breay and sweet lemon aroma. Clean crisp taste. Delicate carbination, due perhaps to smaller bubbles? Quite smooth and almost no finish.

Pours a copper color with a little bit of head and lacing. Has a bready malty and crisp lager aroma. Taste keeps the malty sweetness, but adds a nice soft bitterness and a hint of the hops. Very drinkable.

Pours amber with a finger of white head. Aroma of caramel and some light grassy hops. Taste is about the same. Light sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with a thick texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. Its a style I would like to try more of.
Amber colour with a small white head. Very good aroma with fruit/citrus. Light body, a bit watery. Very light carbonation. Taste is not very strong. Its a bit weak beer overall in my opinion.

Rating #41 for 2012

12oz bottle cold from a tulip glass. Delightfully pleaseant aroma of warm molasses, some spice with cinnamon and pear showing through. 1 inch yellow tinted head over a deep amber colored liquid and a lot of wispy lacing. The taste was full bodied but simple I noticed cinnamon and ripe green pears. Carbonation was high and it finished smooth with a table sugar like sweetness.

12oz bottle - pours copper with rich white head.  Nose is caramel and grass.  Flavor adds more grass.  Taste is a little sweet but somewhat more bitter.  Medium body with watery to sticky texture.  Would have been better served a little colder.  Doesnt seem very mature.

Pours amber Orange with a thick off white head. Aroma is light malts and slight sweet wheat-like grains. Taste is similar to aroma with black pepper and a beautiful mild bitterness in the finish. Awesome.

Deep amber; thick off-white head; cheap lager aroma promises little, but pleasant sweet caramel malts predominate in the flavour with some fruit; this carries through to the finish, which has a hint of hop bitterness too; smooth, slightly slick mouthfeel; enjoyable, understated - a polite well-mannered sort of beer.
Pours clear amber with a nice head. Aroma caramel, hops. Sweet caramel taste. Medium low palate.  Not Bad.

Anchor steam is an interesting beer. People should check this out if for no other reason that there are so few steam beers and they are a truly American addition to the beer vocabulary. Poured from a bottle into an Anchor Steam pint glass, copper in color, nice head, falls away rather quickly with steady carbonation. Aroma is a mixture of malt and a lagerish odor. beer is easy to drink and tastes wonderful. This is one of my standby beers, I order when I see it at an average bar. Its a great beer "brewed in San Fran since 1896"

355ml bottle. Sweet and malty aromas. Pours amber colour, with nice white head, some persistance, some lacing. Ligh to medium body and average carbonation. Oily texture. Taste ismalty, sweet, candy, some fersh herbal and spiced. Correct finish, sweet. Enjoyable, but not awesome.

Pours big rich amber in colour.  Nose is a little molassey, and this hint comes through on the palate.  Quite a sot full flavoured beer, but I just did not like that flavours hence the poor overall score.
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours amber with a big white head that quickly fades leaving virtually no lacing. Aroma is sweet caramel malt and the taste is basically more of the same.
33 cl bottle @ home. pours a light brownish colour with white head. THe aromas are malty, and rich at that. The taste notes are with light caramelk, malts and maybe a bit spicy. A good beer

(bottle) Slightly fruity aroma. Medium bodied and well carbonated with a pleasant smooth mouthfeel. Rich sweet malt and caramel flavour) with reasonable bitterness in finish. Its a pleasant beer but I was expecting more.

Brown 355ml bottle, best before Oct 2008, drank Apr 2007. 

Poured into a Corsendonk Tulip glass, dull copper, hazy more than cloudy. A good white head and carbonisation rising through the beer to replenish the head as it shrank away. 

Aroma of malt biscuits and some caramel. 

Unremarkable taste, barley malts and not a lot of anything. 

A slight bitterness does linger in the aftertaste, but there is no great body to this beer, it isnt watery by any means, but there just isnt much too it either. 

A little disappointed with this one really, was expecting more flavour and a better mouthfeel from a beer most beer lovers in the UK have at least heard of, if not tried.

Jag har lite svårt att bestämma vad jag egentligen tycker om den här ölen. Den är lite tråkig men samtidigt lite spännande, nej det här var en lite knasig sak. Smaken är lite sur med en bitande beska men den är lite tunn i kroppen, tyvärr.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2013 From tap served in a branded sleeve at Hops in New Westminster. Slightly aromatic. Cloudy medium amber color. Little head. Flavor is mild, fruity, well balanced. Not intensely flavored. Just a very nice American beer.
Update: Bottle at Kingston Taphouse on Richards in Vancouver. A light ruby color, with a light tan head. Tastes of malt, caramel and a bit of hops. An easy drinking beer.
From old backlog. Nice golden copper colour with 3 finger head that lasts. Aroma is floral hops, spices, fruity. Flavour is fruity, hops.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2015 Pours a clear, golden brown with a decent head that retains a nice lacing.Taste is caramel malts, honey, a little bready, light citrus and floral. Light bodied with a creamy texture. Carbonation average. Finish is lightly and nicely balanced

From bottle at the Stavanger Øl- og akevittmesse 2012. Clear deep golden with an off-white rim. Caramel and malts on the nose. Balanced sweetness and bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Long bitter and malty finish.
Very little head or aroma on this draft pour. Has the hallmark skunkiness of a cheap lager. Does not sit well.

Bottle 355 ml from Bier-Bienne (CH). Amber-apricot colour, nice pale ochre foam. Creamy beer, round, with notes of toasted cereals, caramel-toffee and ripe fruits. Soft attack then well bitter in finale.

Poured copper in color, with a big, foamy, white head.  Aroma is bready with a crisp grassiness.  Taste is bread, grassy hops, and a little bit of citrus fruit on the tip of the tongue.  Exceptionally smooth and drinkable.
335ml bottle. Amber with off white head. Aroma is sweet and fruity, with caramel, sitrus and plum, almost like my own home made plum liquor.

Got this at a local restaurant. Unfortunately, when I asked for a glass to pour this in, it was frosty frosterton. I waited until the glass got closer to room temp before I poured. Pours a deep gold with a nice rocky 2-finger head. Smells sweet with a touch of hop twang. 

Nice crisp mouthfeel aides the drinkability, yet this is a smooth beer. A little mellow on the taste, but Im tasting some corny mealy taste, with a slight hop bite on the finish. Aftertaste reminds me of Cheerios. Not too bad a beer. Anchor does well with most anything they put out. Recommend.
This beer is the perfect beer to keep in your fridge to enjoy after a work day. Cooling and relaxing.
Pours a clear amber with a white head. Aroma is fruity and sweet. Taste is initially sweet and moderate bitter towards the end and finishes dry. Medium bodied and lots of carbonation.
Deep amber color with a white thick creamy head. Fruits, caramel, malt aroma. Hops, some sweetness, citrus and a little malty taste. Rich flavor. Nice overall beer.
Malt, grass, and some citrus in the aroma.  Smooth mild flavor with malt and a little fruit.  Hop bitterness in the finish.  Good, easy-drinking beer.
A subtle spicy beer. Pours a pretty mahogany with decent white head. Smell is hops and some light fruity malt. Taste is yeast, roasted malt and grapefruit. Good creaminess and a light-medium feel.

Poured from a bottle into a shaker glass. Appearance is copper to amber with a respectable head of white foam. Good retention. Aroma is reminiscent of a slightly sweet and drily bitter amber. Taste is more of the same. Super light on the palate, as it makes me believe this is the type of beer I could drink about as easily as I could water. It has enough character to keep me wanting another drink, but not an overly complex beer.
Dark golden with an off white head - dood malt aroma - Nice malt body with some nice hints of flowery hops that lingers for some time into the finish alonf with some malt - this was nice
Bottle. Light caramel malt aroma. Amber with a small beige head. Grainy malt nicely balanced with lingering,  peppery bitter hops. Medium body, lightly carbonated

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Appearance is a clear light copper with a one finger head that fades rather quickly.

Smells has caramel with some lightly toasted malt. Some floral hop aromas comes through as well.

The taste is quite malty and has some caramel and biscuit. A moderate bitterness comes in about halfway through with some floral hop flavor. Finishes clean and slightly sticky.

Overall a solid beer but it seemed a little thin and lacking in flavor. I have had this on tap before and it was better. Might have to revisit this sometime.
Pours a clear copper color with a large beige creamy head. Aroma is crystal malts, orange, sweet and hay.   Taste is fruity,  piny and malty in a nice combination. Very drinkable. Medium body.

The deep amber color, thick creamy head, and rich flavor. 
Nice discrete hoppy after taste
Really a nice beer. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Pours a murky copper color, with a large, sexy four-finger off-white head that fades away at a moderate pace.

S: Mostly earthy aromatic hops, but also features a small bready scent, as well.

T: The opening is malty, biscuity, and almost sweet, while it finishes with a decent hit of grassy, floral hops. Flavorful and refreshing, but I imagine it would be better suited to the summer months.

M: Finishes very wet, and has moderately high carbonation overall. Nice smoothness, too.

O: This is pretty damn good, and like many of the well-known craft beers (SN Pale Ale, SA Boston Lager), has a good degree of versatility, as well. On the other hand, its not my favorite, and truth be told, I think I prefer Flying Dog Old Scratch (if were staying in the not-too-well represented style of the California Common) overall.

Strange that Ive never rated this.  I have this a lot when you get somewhere with not much selection.  Copper Amber with a pillowy head.  Caramel and Bread aroma.  Lots of malt, but really well balanced session beer.
Carmel color and a deceptively fruity aroma. Very hoppy yet light bodied. Very generic for the most part but worth a try.
Bottle. Transparent amber. Bread, caramel, malts, peach, hops. Body too powerful for the taste, which finishes barely bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2012 Pale amber color and is clear. A thick creamy head forms and is quite resilient. The beer appears mildly carbonated. The smell is sweet and fruity. There is a floral scent along with an aroma of grain. The taste is generally unremarkable. A heavy cereal or biscuit flavor up front, followed by a mildly bitter hop taste.
Pours amber color with a white head. Aroma is fruity with some caramel and grassy hop undertone. Taste is also very similar and body is light. Lots of carbonation.

Pours light amber with a big tan head. Smells malty. Taste is malty, with a little baked bread and butter. Body is pretty thick for the light taste of the beer, id say its medium. Silky texture. A small dry hop presence comes out at the end. But, this has a little bit of a cheap beer taste, not the nicest way to say it, but that is just what the after taste reminds my of.
Bottle from LCBO.  Clear amber with a huge thick head.  Yeasty and peachy aroma; smells like a Pilsner.  Sweet taste up front with some hops and a slight bitter bite at the end.  Pretty good.

Pours a clear copper with an off-white head. The aroma is caramel malts and bready.  The taste is slightly sweet malts in the beginning, but finishes with some hoppy bitterness. Body is on the light side.
I love this beer, especially now that I am living in San Francisco. Dark amber color with white head. Aroma of grains, hops and malts. Similar flavors with a nice bitterness. Love it!!

Light amber, to  a dark gold.  Off white head.  Malt and light leather in the nose, with a hint of metal.  Full body with solid bitterness through the middle. Lasting finish of deep malt and resin hop bitterness.  Good original beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber with a half inch white frothy head. The head disappears quite quickly but the thin ring left around the glass leaves a nice curtain on the glass. Aroma of bread, grass, some light caramel. Bitterness is very settle and smooth, accompanied by some notes of almond. Medium body and carbonation.

Poured into a lager glass from a 12 ounce bottle 1SW on the back.

A: Clear amber body with a dense rocky white head. Carbonation bubbles steadily rise to meet the head.

S: Mild caramel and a mild bitterness.

T: Mild caramel sweetness, slight toasted flavor. Rather bland.

M: Medium bodied, crisp carbonation.

O: While I appreciate the classic brewing method, this doesnt appeal to me.

12 ounce bottle into pilsener glass, bottled 1/11/2012.  Pours slightly cloudy golden copper color with a very nice 3 finger dense off white head with incredible retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts.  Nice soapy lacing on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up.  Aromas of bready grains, grass, floral hops, herbal spiciness, caramel, and a bit of light fruitiness.  Some nice and well balanced aromas; but are a bit muted.  Taste of bready grain, floral, grass, pepper, caramel, herbal, and light apricot.  A decent amount of peppery bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of bread, pepper, herbal, floral, and light fruit on the finish for a bit.  Nice balance of flavors.  Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a smooth and crisp mouthfeel as expected.  No alcohol noticeable at all as expected for 4.9%.  Overall this is a very nice brew from Anchor.  Very crisp with a nice flavor profile; and easily drinkable.  Definitely a great session beer contender.

cooper-amber clear colour with two fingers light brown head, wich goes down slowly. Aroma of barley malt, caramel, hops and some grapefruit. Theres a light bitter flavor when in mouths and aftertaste is bitter at the same level and lasts long. Beer is pretty light and refreshing, structure is watery and carbonization is present, but not obvious.
Slightly bitter with little aftertaste. Color was golden amber and poured beautifully.
This one is okay, but too hoppy for me. Carmel color, Carmel toffee taste with hop bitterness. Floral brew, little carbonation, probably wouldnt have again
A classic. One of the beers that got me into beer. Nose and palate are consistent showing fruity notes with just a hint of caramel. Balanced hops and malts. Always nice.
dirty amber body, fizzy tan head forms. Smell, aromatic and hoppy, floral, not disimilar to the liberty ale but less powerful  Taste, nice mix of malt and hops, pretty well rounded.

Fruity and sweet, with a delicious aftertaste that I cant quite put my finger on. (but that I love) Not too bitter and not too heavy. If I could get hold of these locally and for a reasonable price then they would be a staple.

Love the aftertaste. Smooth beer, with just slight bitter taste less hoppy. I got a lot of the malt flavor on the aftertaste. Perhaps theres a bit of fruity flavor the more I drank. And I drank a lot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle pours amber with a white head.  Aroma and taste are all malt with a subtle sweet finish.
An amber coloured beer with a small white head.  The aroma and taste are both fruity. Its rather sweet than bitter but its also has a moderate hoppy bitterness. A good one!

355 ml bottle.
Rated on 20100326.
Pours dark amber color with small head. Aroma of smoky malts and grain. Flavor of malts, yeast and ripe fruits.
5324

12oz bottle. Rating #2562. Clear dark amber pour with a nice fluffy white head that left a decent amount of lacing on the glass. Musty fruity aroma, dark fruit juice with a bit of hop character. Nice moderate bitterness that stuck around a good while, nice stuff and a classic. (2225)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pale amber color and is clear. A thick creamy head forms and is quite resilient. The beer appears mildly carbonated. The smell is sweet and fruity. There is a floral scent along with an aroma of grain.  The taste is generally unremarkable. A heavy cereal or biscuit flavor up front, followed by a mildly bitter hop taste.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Bryan on 3/09/2012.
Appearance: Pours a dark copper. 
Aroma: Aroma is heavily of malt.
Taste:Almost no bitterness, heavy malt presence but not overbearing.
Palate:Creamy body, light carbonation, quick finish.
Summary: A solid enjoyable beer, not enough hops for my desire.
Very easy drinking beer. Definitely sessionable. Aroma is yeast and barley malts. Taste is the same as the aroma light sweet and light bitter. Well balanced. Nice beer!
Pours a amber, head dissipates quickly.  Nose is fruity and bready.  Taste is earthy.  Body is light to medium.  Great session beer, unique flavor.
The beer is a light yet thick brown with a light head.  Has a good clean aroma that invites with malts and barely.  Thick and flavorful.
Refreshing beer, from bottle. Pours an amber colour with some head. A famous American brew, but not ranking in my favourites.

Its mixture of yeasts, malts, barley, and hops are very simple, but the flavor is very good and balanced! Combined with the fact that its easy on the palate and you have a beer that can appeal to just about any beer drinker out there!
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2012 Il sapore di orzo è molto presente e mina un pò laromaticità. Non mi ha entusiasmato. Birra comunque particolare.

I live in San Francisco. This beer is nostalgia for me. It's simple, but delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber colour. Aroma of caramel and malt. Taste is thin, crisp, some malt and caramel. Finishes with some hops

From notes.  First reviewed 1/18/2011.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

Anchor Steam pours a dark orange color, cloudy with large bubbles clinging to the bottom of the glass before their inevitable ascent to maintain the head on top. Although a modest foamy white head is initially visible, it fades to a film with a pronounced ring. 

Light toasted malt and long-lasting earthy hops create a relatively light aroma.

A bit of caramel sneaks through, but the flavor here is mostly a modest level bitterness, with just a dash of tart lemon. The malt back is reminiscent of a toasted biscuit, but the earthy hop flavors step in front. The finish stays bitter.

This is briskly carbonated, as was apparent from the appearance. Slightly dry, more so at the finish. Grainy and slightly astringent with a light to medium body.

This is definitely a beer worth trying. It is Anchors flagship beer and has by far the most reviews of any Steam beer. There is a fair amount going on here, especially for an American Lager at 4.9%.

350 mL bottle from Tesco into a Westmalle glass.  Bubbly foam head above a golden orange fizzy beer.  Fine hoppy aroma, very attractive and a hint alpine.  Nice, hoppy, and light ipa.  More-ish.  Deliciously golden hoppy beer, nice stuff and enjoyable.
Bottle. Redish amber with an off white head. Aroma and Flavour of malt with a little spice. Finish is tangy
From the tap @ Metro, Lahti. Pours beautiful amber colour. Minimal white head. Aroma has citrus and malt. Taste has honey, fruits, malt and hops. Quite bitter and sweet. A very enjoyable beer.
This one seems like a mix of lager and Pale Ale. Its nice, slightly bitter and very easy to drink. Refreshing.
Bottled. Pours; light copper, abit golden with a semi tiny / medium head. Smells: spicy and malty. Tastes: sweet, light and abit malty.
Pale red color with a creamy white head. The aroma is malty with hints of spices. The taste is sweet, but not too strong. The mouthfeel is medium bodied, and very smooth.

Pour is a light amber/copper, small white head quickly diminishes and leaves very minimal lacing. Aroma is sweet, lightly fruity, with some hops sneaking in the end. Flavor starts sweet, maybe slightly bready in the middle, and a good hoppy ending.
amber, orange, clear, minimal head, white foam, caramel, herbs, lightly bitter, full body, average carbonation,

Bottle. Pours orange with a small white head.. minor carbonation.  Smell is pretty minimal but there are hints of bread.  Taste is fairly minimal.. very light bitterness.. but far from hoppy.  Im happy I tried the style and its a unique beer; however, I wouldnt buy this regularly.

Sötétebb aranyszínű főzet citrus-gyümölcsös aromával, melyet fehér kenyérbél, némi karamell és (gyógy)füves komló kísér.
Közepesen száraz befejezése édeskés, kissé fanyar, citrusos felhangokkal.
Könnyen iható, kerek sör-ritkaság, amelyre már egy ideje fenem a fogam és - az újonnan nyílt sörözőnek hála  végül nem is kellett messzire utaznom miatta...

Ok, I am patriotic and all... I liked this ale once it went room temperature.  Good head, lasted as long as expected for an ale, finished rough at first but as time progressed (warming) it improved. Great ale for a steam ale.

Draught at House of Blues Anaheim. Good solid looking beer  with a deep amber colour and a small white head. Tastes pretty good with a solid flavour . The original steam beer that many try to unsucsefully try to imitate.

On tap at Beer Bier, Budapest. Clear dark golden color with medium white head. Malty, fruity and a bit salty aroma, it point to green apple for me. American hops also appears. The aroma is a bit light, but its complex. Interesing bitter-sweet taste. Light body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Complex finish. Very interesting aroma and taste. Its difficult to comparable with other beers, its a unique one.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma is malty, light caramel, bread, grass. Taste is malt, grain, grassy hops. Thin body. lively arbonation, lightly bitter finish. Enjoyable, refreshing and easy drinking beer. 140212

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2013 Light amber with a white, creamy head. Aroma is of malt, bread, orange peel and kind of metallic. The taste is crisp and malty, with a subtle bitter finish. Nice balance, easy to drink a lot of these.

Poured from a draft into a Monster pint (33.9 oz.) at Woodstocks in San Diego, Calif. Caramel looking. About a 1 ½ fingers of head. Nice white cloudy lacing. Sporadic and cloudy film on the sides.

Smelled bread and grains mostly. Kind of a freshness smell, but heavy (malty) as well.

Tasted pretty similar to the nose. Reminded me of a pilsner. Bready and grainy. Clean, light and crisp.

Medium body. Thin texture. Average carbonation. Smooth, clean and crisp finish.

A bit disappointed overall. I dont know why, but I was expecting a lot more.
Bottled. Dark orange with mininal head. Sweet grainy aromatics and flavor. Medium body and a balanced finish. A malt mans session ale.

Reddish-gold, slightly cloudy, off-white fluffy head.   nose is mild hops, slight grapefruit...Taste is bread, hops, slight citrus bitter/tang.  this has a different "feel" to it I really like, not amazing, but good, just enough bitter...tasty.

Poured from 12oz bottle into pilsner glass

Aroma:  hay and leaves heavy in the aroma.  little bit of alcohol and quite skunky

Appearance:  brownish copper and very clear.  3 finger white frothy head that lingered.  Laces glass extremely well.  Very few bubbles

Taste:  bitter upfront and slightly sweet in the end.  little bit of sour in there as well.

Palate:  Medium body and thin texture.  very fizzy carbonation on the tongue.  Abrupt finish.

Overall:  Bought in a mixer 6 and wasnt sure what to expect from this.  Pleasantly surprised but probably wont purchase again.  I dont think i could drink more than a couple of these.  The skunkiness reminded me of a Heineken or Becks.
Pours clear dark yellow with about a finger of white head. Smell is light and fluffy, maybe a bit of lemon zest. Taste is soft and mild. Pretty mellow and interesting beer.
12 ounce bottle. This is a well made beer just a boring style. Lots of malt, grainy, bready, toasty. Good beer, malt focused, easy drinking.

355 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours reddish golden with a small white head that leaves some trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet, fruity and slightly metallic with bread, grapes, plums and very ripe peaches. Taste is malty sweet and slightly bitter with bread, golden syrup, grapes, plums and lemon peal. Finish is slightly sweet and rather bitter with citrus zest.

Pour deep amber with a thick creamy white mostly diminishing head. Inviting aromas of medium intensity with sweet malts. Medium in intensity, body and aftertaste. Creamy texture with sweet roasted malty flavors and a rich well balanced quality. Greatly Appreciated
I had this one a long time ago. If ill drink it again, Ill update this rating. I remember a pretty good beer though

Pours deep orange amber color, with slight  cloudiness. Has thick creamy off-white head. Aromas are berries, some apricot, ocean air breeze. Texture is well carbonated, little tart and crispy. Palate is smooth sticky but, sweet malty,  herbal with  good amount of hoppiness. Aftertaste is hoppy and bitter, with fruits and dry medium long finish. Refreshing, good beer.
Bottle from systembolaget. Light hazy amber colour, with an off white head. Hoppy and light fruity nose, with some sweetness. Fresh hoppy flavour, with a nice moderate sweet malt background
bottle. Orange colour. Aroma of malts, grains, some caramel. Taste mirrors the aroma, well balanced, refreshing and flavourful. Just a straightforward well-done beer.
chocolate, bread, caramel, dough, leaves, banana, rotten eggs, raisin, vanilla, orange, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, average carbonation, long finish,
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2013 Nice maltyness, but I couldnt find anything that would really make this one stand out. Well made and everything, but just not my thing.

355ml bottle

Pours dark orange with a smooth white head. Aroma has notes of light hops, malts and fruits. Taste of malts, light fruity hops and hints of caramel. Smooth, slightly bitter finish. Okay, quite well balanced and easy to drink.
Bottle; clear copper with medium creamy beige head; aroma-spices, toffee, herbs, nuts; taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, lively. Decent

I have had this beer for god knows how long, this is a family favorite. This beer is one of the few I know as only "Beer" while I call some beers lagers, some IPA, some just ordinary ales this beer is what I could only define as "Beer" and it deserves nothing less. It is an interesting mix of hop and as far as I could justify...Harbor/sea faring taste. I live very near SF so I can get a regular supply of it and do, and am always impressed by the well though concoction of hops and barley. Truly this is one of the better Micros out there and the shape, taste, and amount are all worth it. Warning for those who drink at warm temp. I would not fully suggest that with this beer, although some may disagree I feel this beer is better served Ice cold and with copious amount of good food and Foot Ball. Heres to the 49ers and the beer they are part of in SF! Cheers.

Splendido aspetto, bellissimo colore ambrato con schiuma persistente. Al naso prevale la componente maltosa, mentre al palato sempre malto a comandare ma con una parvenza di luppolo e finale leggero di liquirizia.

Lovely beer. Perfect balance of hops and malts, amber color, medium carbonation, smooth aftertaste, good head retention. If you go to San Francisco, you have to try it on tap, it is even better. Im fermenting a batch right now, if it doesnt work, will try to go back to CA and drink more of this beer :P
I enjoy the anchor steam brew. Good smooth taste and finish. Bubbly in a mug.  little lacing. Great brew. unique.

Nice crisp California common(steam)   Very drinkable.  Mild floral hop notes, caramel and pale malts easily identifiable in taste.  Not overwhelming hop bitterness.  Great session beer at less than 5 percent abc

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad
Pours an Amber/Orangey color with nice creamy white head. Honey on the nose and on the palate. Goes down smooth. Very nice beer.
Bottle. I figured I would give this one a whirl. Reminded me of an amber lager, a little on the malty side, almost no real hint of hops. I wasnt really impressed.
The best combination of appearance, aroma, taste and aftertaste I have found in an American beer - period.

This is one of my new favorite beers that Ive had in recent memory.  Nice appearance, goes down smooth and you can taste a somewhat caramel flavour on the aftertaste.  Quite flavourful and the bouquet is sweet as well.

Bottle at home. Lovely deep orangey colour with a good frothy head which fades down quickly but lingers on at a decent couple of millimetres thick, with nice lacing. The nose has lovely perfumey notes, with a touch of aromatic hops. Good malt presence and a touch of hops on the flavour add to the massively refreshing nature of  this beer, helped by balanced carbonation. Lovely.

Pours amber with low head
Aromas of malts, some brown sugar
Palate starts out quite hitty but ends too abrupt.
Good beer
My first California Common. Not an actual difference to any lager... but maybe I need more tastes...

Beautiful amber color. Long-lasting on the palate. Head somewhat hugs glass. Smooth taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear, amber colour  with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma is caramel, slightly sweet, some toasted notes, and hops. Light sweet taste. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finishes with good malts and bread-like notes and nuts. Good beer.

Bottle.  Slightly forward nose, with plenty of carbonation.  Color is interesting dark amber.  Flavor is relatively rich with hoppy, slightly floral flavors.  Moderately bitter finish.  Thirty years ago, this was about as good as you could get from a bottle, but it has since been surpassed by a fair number of micro and not-so-micro brews; Samuel Adams comes to mind.  Would buy again for old times sake.

Aroma: Very light malt aroma. Perhaps some dark chocolate.

Appearance: Deep amber, slight hazy. Fluffy white head. Soft carbonation. 

Taste: Bitter hop taste. Toast notes to finish. 

Palate: Slightly sticky mouthfeel. Medium body. 

Overall: An inoffensive, uninteresting beer.

From the bottle marked 1SL. I cannot believe I had not reviewed this one until now. The granddaddy of crafts pours a slightly cloudy medium amber with a lacy off-white head.  The aroma is well balanced between the caramel malts, barley, and the hop bitterness. The body is about medium.  The taste is fresh and crisp with a moderate bitterness.
Bottle. This is a total classic, Ill drink this any time especially because it is so available. Very good.

Pours clear pale amber with effervescence, fluffy white head and decent retention.  Aroma is mild butterscotchy oxidative notes, some doughy yeast notes, mild ale fruitiness, some piney/minty hop notes.  Taste is like a homebrew; very apparent "dirty" fermentation character of dry fruit, dough, butterscotch, and a minty hop note on the finish.  Body is medium, creamy, avg carbonation, crisp doughy minty finish.  Overall, this beer fascinates me with its challenging character and uniqueness.

(draught 0,3l)
Fruity, roasted malt aroma. Clear dark golden color. Huge all time white head. Light sweet, medium bitter. Medium body. Long bitter finish.

Brownish color with a modest off-white head. The nose is light, of oranges a little caramel. The taste is lightly sweet and mild. The palate is medium, the carbonation average. Overall, its really hard for me to pin this beer down, its certainly unlike anything Ive tried from England. Good, though it seems to tick boxes from a lot of diverse columns.

Bottle. Burnt copper color. Thick white head dissipates quickly. Medium carbonation. Aroma is bread, yeast, little bit of caramel malt and fig/prune.  Medium body. Sweet bready, malty flavour with a dry bitter finish. Solid.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

the good.
lovely bronze colour. heady aroma of sweet malt and bread. taste is sweet malt with a bit of fruit coming through.
the bad.
slightly too much alchol in th enose which i found surprising given the abv.  the finish wasnt for me either.  to drying and a strange taste right at the end. maybe metal or rotten figs!

13/12/2011 355ml bottle @ Klaas place - BB: 6/2013 (2011-705) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark orange beer, small off-white head, unstable and non adhesive. Aroma: sweet malts, caramel, little cheesy, ripe to rotten banana. MF: ok carbon, light to medium body. Taste: very malty, sweet, caramel, bitter hops, fruity (peaches). Aftertaste: lots more of malts, toast, nice bitter ending.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2012 Bottle sample at a tasting in at kerenmks place. Thanks kerenmk. Poursorange to yellow with a nice head, aroma of honey, wine, caramel, flavor is bitter and hoppy with nutty tones, medium bodied   6/3/7/3/13[3.2] 

At a tasting, thanks Dagan, pours orange to yellow with a nice head that leaves a beautiful lacing, aroma of malt, vanilla, wood and some yeast, flavor is a bit sourish with a pleasant bitterness and nuttieness, dough and bread can be sensed, medium bodied  6/4/6/3/11[3.0]
Poured copper with a big head and left good lacing. Could not pick up much aroma. Taste had some caramel followed by bitterness. A lot of carbonation.

Date: December 9, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Heritage Description: Orangish brown pour with nice head and some lacing, aroma of yeast, bread and malt / caramel.  Taste is not that good, kind of like dirty water with a metallic finish.  Got a new style crossed off the list, but eesh maybe I got a bad bottle of this stuff or something.
355ml bottle. Clear, amber body. Off-white foamy lasting head. Sweet hoppy aroma. Balanced round taste of sweet malts and fruits. Nice lasting aftertaste.

Pours clear amber with slight orange, average white head.  Aroma grassy, bread and hops.  Taste follows aroma with bread, malts and hops.  Finish with prolonged hop bitterness which is not overwhelming.  Palate a bit thin.  Alcohol not apparent.
Drinkable but uninteresting beer.

Pours a clear amber with a thin head that disappears quickly.  Not much in the way of aroma...some biscuits, perhaps a little toffee.  Tastes the same, toffee, malty biscuits with a little hop bite at the end.  Not really my style of beer, but solid none the less.

bread, grass, amber, clear, tan foam, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter, 
Pretty hoppy, but well balanced with a clean, crisp finish.  Perhaps not the most innovative brew, but definitely the original and classic california common

The aroma is mostly malt with heavy bread notes and some yeast.  The beer is a clear amber with a strong white head. Taste is floral hops with some yeast fruit ester flavors.  There the hop flavors offer some bitterness in the back.  The palate is clean and crisp.  Overall a great session beer.
From bottle. Decent level of caramel toffee malt, slight chocolate. Smooth and easy going. No issues, perhaps lacks innovation.
Clear amber color, nice beige head and decent lace. Nose is malt, slightly floral, front is malt, the top light, the finish is crisp, slightly dry, fair hop bite, and a very drinkable beer
the trademark steam beer. enjoyable but not very exciting. personally i find it an excellent companion beer with pizza but rarely drink it otherwise
Vrij helder amberkleurig bier met witte kraag. Vol in de mond. Smaak vrij zacht en zoet, met duidelijk honing aanwezig. Lekker

Copper orange color. Big thick head foam.
Smells a bit yeasty, hoppy and biscuit.
At the beginning u sense the hops at your tong and slowly slowly it fades away. Nice smooth and very drinkable.

Pour is light brown with a slight orange tinge and a white head. Aroma is well balanced - toffee, grassy hops, citrus, caramel. Flavor is similar to the aroma but not as pronounced. Dry and light finish.

Bottle. Dark golden with a frothy and lasting head. Aroma is grainy-malty but also fruity, with dried plums and apricots, plus fresh apples and peaches, some dust and hops. Moderate body, soft malty, less fruity taste with a medium, lingering bitterness and a nutty-citrus-herbal aftertaste. Tastes a bit like a fruity version of a pilsener, very crisp and enjoyable!
bottle in Alexandria,VA. pretty decent, you can buy it in the czech republic as well.

deep amber, righ and creamy looking head. aromas of minerals, grassy hops, and a bit of malt breadiness.  tight bitterness, and medium malt sweetness.  medium body, pretty clean and dry finish. refreshing.

Super malty and almost bock like but fairly tasty beer - quite elegant in the round.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Takova nic moc vodicka.ale co cekat od amiku, ze. I kdy musim uznnat ze bud je jeste vyrazne horsi.

This is a beer I wanted to try out for a long time. The steam beer from San Francisco is world known, and its an interesting history behind the style. 
It pours a nice head with little retention. Some lacing in the glass. Smooth malty flavor, and resembles a little with lagers. Medium body. A great beer...
Bottle from the victoria inn birmingham. Pours amber haze with no head. Lager style aroma and taste. Light orange taste. I have had this off tap and it was great. Disappointing from the bottle.
Bottle, pours copper with off white head. Aroma is malt, fruits, floral, cookies. taste light sweetness and bitterness.
Color a little lack luster but has a nice head. Aroma is flowery. Taste is modest hoppy bitterness and light malty sweetness.
red-amber colour, head quickly disappears, slightly fruity, full-bodied with some bitterness in the finish, lack of character - nothing special
Kopparfärgad öl med gulvitt skum. Klassisk doft av malt och humle. Bra balanserad öl med citrusbeska.
Bottle. Pours browny gold. Quite delicious. Not very complex. Ideal for drinking bottle after bottle of.

Bottle.  Pours a copper color with a medium, lasting head.  Fruit and malt aroma with hints of florals and hops.  Flavor is well balanced between sweet malts and citric fruits with a slightly hoppy finish.  Hoppy orange aftertaste.  Nice and easy drinking.
Golden coloured from the bottle. Aroma is very malty, bit of caramel and a hint of liquorice and ginger spiciness. Seems to get sweeter towards the end. Nice and biscuity. Very nice.
bottle at corte ingles, lisbon. Interesting. Not really my taste, but interesting color and aroma. Will re-taste it in the future.
Btl. 4.8 %!. Lightr head, fine redgolden colour. fine carb. nice caramel nose, but maybe a little simple. medium body and length. Nice semi dry camael with maybe a little hoppy spice..

355mL bottle poured a nice amber color with big creamy white head with good retention and very little in the way of lacing.  Aroma is lightly toasted malts and flowery hops.  Taste is modest hoppy bitterness and light malty sweetness.  A pretty fine beer which is pleasing to drink.

Pours a clear amber with a medium white head that sticks around.  Has a hint of hops and some roast  and nut hints.  There is a rich bitter taste with a slight hint of sour.  Medium body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation.  A somewhat long, bitter finish but not akin to a pale ale.  A beer that I will try again but I dont see it much in my area.  A sure request on the west coast though.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2012 Tasted on tap in standard pint glass at Blueberry Hill, St Louis, Missouri, USA. Beautiful, clear, amber color with lasting off-white foam. Strong aromas of biscuity malt and woodsy Northern Brewer hops. Nice round medium-body mouthfeel. Bitter but balanced. Smooth carbonation, no harshness. Mildly fruity ale yeast character. Complex but accessible. Filling but refreshing. To me, Anchor Steam is a masterpiece of American brewing, a measuring stick for subsequent microbreweries.

a solid brew that is very session-able. Pours an amber brown with a thick white head that laces in chunks. The nose is stronger than the taste- notes of malts, dark fruits, semi-sweet. The beer is very well balance an fairly mild, high palate rating because it is very easy to drink.
Bottle to pilsner glass.  Pours a clear amber with a white frothy head, and stays, and doesnt really make much lacing.  Lots of sweet malt flavors, and some fruit flavors.
Draught at Alvar, Turku. Thanks Plavec! Darker amber body withca small head. Light plummy malty nose. The taste is more subdued than expected, plums, malt, light, vaguely sweet. I expected much more.
Nice bitterness in the taste, prolonged bitter finish, a full body. Rich in both taste and aroma, quite fruity. Colour is amber, and the foam is white. (355 ml bottle)
Upscale pillsner.  Good color, not too sweet, nice hoppy taste, but on the verge of being skunky.
Amber, small dense white head, bit of carbonation. Aroma has sweets, honry, caramel, malts. Smooth taste, somewhat fizzling, a bit thicky in the mouth. Somewhat dry finish, with some nuts in it.
Tap - small foamy head, medium-dark amber color, somewhat sweet, smooth mild malty flavor

Now this is one jim-dandy of a brew! This brew poured up a hazy copper-colored body with a wonderfully thick, off-white colored head with good retention and lacing effects on the glass.  Aromas of malts, caramel, citrus fruits (lemons, and maybe some orange).  Flavors of the same in a malty concoction that beckons you to take the next sip just as soon as you finish one.  Medium-bodied, full-flavored with a dry finish and citrusy aftertaste.

In pint at BJs.  Looks perfectly amber.  Off white retaining head.  Smell is not too strong but definitely amber malts and nothing else.  Tastes again straight up unwavering amber with tingling hop presence that compliments great.  Quite well balanced and fairly drinkable.  Overall 8 of 10.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2011 Aroma of malts and dirt.  Pours orange with a big frothy head.  Taste is barely there but nutty and dirty.  Interesting and easy to drink but not very tasty.
Amber colour with frothy head. Pine hops on the palate with a tingly salt, well balanced with hops slightly outweighing the sugary malts and lightly lingering on the tongue  a great palate cleanser.

Bottle from Beer Cafe, Glasgow:
Strong hop aroma with some nice herbal notes & a little spiciness too. The later part is similar but with more of a citrus & pine presence. Well balanced.

An orange amber colour that is slightly darker in places & settles with a thin white, bubbly head with average retention.

A lot a pine in the flavour that is blended together nicely with some good citrus flavours & just a hint of sweetness. Along with the initial bitter hops their is a background herbal & grassy hops taste & a semi bitter, hop infused semi-bitter one.

Very smooth to drink & highly drinkable as a direct result of this. The beer is a medium bodied one & the carbonation is about right for the type of beer.

Overall this one was great with a beautiful bitter hop flavour that was very well balanced & went down great. I imagine this would make an excellent session beer.

1001 Beers Blog:
Tap.  Medium hop bitterness.  Medium carbonation.  Reminds me of a lighter sierra nevada pale ale.

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xuuMpIxitq8
  
Appearance: Hazy amber, 1-finger head regresses to a topping layer, average lacing

Smell: Bready malts, orange rind, corriander, pepper

Taste: Medium body, pine & citrus bite at the mid-palate, little bit of sea salt, tame bitterness on finish, drinkable

Pairings: Bbq, cole slaw, mac & cheese

Aroma: bread crust at the forefront, light notes of toffee and orange peel.
Appearance: Rich and abundant white head, clear liquor, deep amber hue.
Taste: Medium bitterness that lasts all the way through, ending in a light, though long, pleasant finish. Good body, light but good carbonation. Very well balanced, satisfying beer.
On tap. Golden in color. Very light drinking beer, but much more flavorful than a macro-lager. Quality session beer!
Bottle. Color clear amber with small head. Aroma malt, sweet, citrus. Taste caramel, citrus, malt, bitter.

I hadnt had this in over a decade so it was nice to give it another go.  While pricey ($11-$14 per six pack in the NY area) it is a very nice beer.  I have brushed by it time and time again over the years, writing it off as something common.

After watching Michael Jacksons "The Beer Hunter" episode where he meets with Fritz Maytag and discusses the beer I had to give it another try.  Im very glad I did.

355 ml, bottled. Pours clear amber (light), small white head. Aroma: Malt, mild licorice. Taste: Mild sweetness, some bitterness. Pleasant. Soft. Malty flavours. Palate: Mediun (-) body, a bit thin. Average carbonation. Pleasant.
Not a bad beer at all, crisp in the front like an american pils but with a little extra kick of something at the end. Wouldnt drink this all the time but not a bad change of pace.

Bomber. Aroma is grassy, wet hay. Very faint.  Pours light amber, with nice head.  Flavor is nicely balanced. Barley and bread, backed up with just a bite of citrusy hops. Finish has sourdough bread component. A nicely executed beer in a traditional style.

it poured a clear orange color with a small head. The aroma was of sweet malt, toffee, and some mild grassy hops. The flavor was similar, with sweet caramel, fruit, and mild hops. A decent California Common.
Comments blocked due to obscenities.......................................
Föregångare som idag känns snäll och drickvänlig, men som inte lämnar djupare intryck.
Sweet and vaguely tangy malt aroma, slightly metallic. The taste is dry and somewhat bittersweet with bread, malt and alcohol. No beer for me this is!
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.

Apparently the original US craft beer and actually one of my personal first contacts with American beer beyond Bud, Miller and the likes. Back then, I was amazed by just how much flavor it had, but oh how things have changed since... Not a bad beer by any account, just not a very complex or distinct one either. Pours light amber / copper with medium white head. Aroma is more malt and yeast than hops, with a bit of hay and earthy tones. Theres also a bit of a funky off-flavor that I cant really put my finger on. Taste is generally very balanced between malty sweet and hoppy bitterness but a bit too smooth and lacking enough of a finish. Body is very light, which doesnt help the generally lightweight feel of the beer compared to other US craft beer. Sounds like Im bashing it, but in all fairness this is a very decent beer - its just that in light of its competition - all those amazing US craft beers - this beer feels more like an improved mainstream brew than a true craft beer.
Anchor Steam is a quality beer , incredibly smooth with a great taste. Slightly expensive, but the quality of this beer makes it worth the buy.

Only example I know of that I have tried. Not sure when it came out but it was a novelty and certainly had more going for it than Busch or Coors or PBR. It is still a light weight in the craft beer spectrum though.
355 Ml bottle. Pours light brown with a white head. Smooth and balanced with a citrus touch and feel of hops bitterness. Not complex, but smooth. Pretty decent.

bevendo questa anchor steam in bottiglia qui in italia si nota subito (pur non avendo ricordi limpidi)la differenza con la sorella americana!sembra un prodotto meno caratterizzato e con sapori piu tenui!
color rame scuro!schiuma ambia pannosa di media consistenza!sapoti di malto tostato e luppolo!in bocca è liscia come una birra a bassa fermentazione con gusto di malto tostato !poi esce il carattere luppolato che si mescola benissimo con note fruttate!chiude abbastanza lunga secca e amara!il tutto in grand equilibrio
hai presente quando arrivi a casa e vuoi una birra o quando vai al bar e vuoi semplicemente una birra???ecco!!!per me questa è lideale!!!

12oz bottle. What most claim as the original American craft beer. Its like an amber ale and a pale ale had a baby and this is what was conceived. Nice malty flavor with a hop balance that keeps everything in check. Not much complexity but its a well made brew. If youve never had it, then you might as well, its a pioneer in craft beer.
Nice amber color with fine head. Flavor is malty and dry. Good bitterness.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2012 I hadnt tried this in a while, and I recall thinking it was rather bitter when I first tried it (and knew little about beer). Nice amber apperance. Malty sweet aroma, a bit wet and bready. Taste does have a bit of a bitter aftertaste, but nothing like the IPA I thought this was a while back. The dominant flavour is sweet malts, raisins maybe.

Bottle 355ml a clear amber beer with good medium head. Nose is grany, grassy and honey like. Aroma is caramel like, slightly sweet, some toasted notes, hops is medium to high, metallic hints, finish is nicely malted with some brown bred notes and nuts. Good beer with nice creamy body and nice malt presence we usually have with decoction.
Pours golden copper with only very little white foam. Aroma is caramel, some nuts. Taste is caramel and nuts as well, bit of a floral hop note there. Palate is light.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Copper coloured with a creamy off-white head. The aroma is nutty and spicy with notes of gently roasted malts and fruity american hops. Flavor is sweet malts with a fine finishing bitterness. The consistence is the essence of this beer - very smooth, almost sticky, yet hoppy and refreshing.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a spicy herby hoppy aroma a spicy herby hoppy sweet taste with a sweet bitter finish

Copper color.  Full head.  Aroma of sweet malt, cinnemon and spice.  Med-lite sweetness and Med-lite bitter.  Creamy texture,  ave carbonation.  Some caramel notes on the taste.  Yum.  I forgot how good this beer is.  Easy to drink.
Clear amber  coloured beer with small white head and only very few carbonation. Herby bit hopped aroma. Medium palate. Finish is rather sweet in begin with a bitter spicy ending.
355ml bottle. Amber colour. Taste and palate were crisp, clean, dry and well balanced.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Not as fresh as the  one I had at the brewery but still plesent.
Thick and lasting beige head. Almost clear orange color.
The aroma is dominated with half dark chrystal malts. This is also the dominating taste with small bitterness and big body.
Tasted draught as well as from bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Liked it pretty much, though its not really special. Nothing really stands out but its just a good beer I guess.

Bottle at The Caley alongside Knops California Common. A golden beer with a fair white head. Yeasty, caramel aroma. Pronounced caramel flavour with grassy hops, some CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. Not bad. Its Anchor by a nose.
Crisp, dry beer, almost a session ale. Nice lager malt style base with good carbonation. Amber colour with creamy head. Very good drinkable beer, well worth returning to.
Pours a reddish amber with active carbonation. Aroma is light lagered malt. Flavor is well balanced. Deep malty backbone finished with spritely hops and carbonation for a crisp clean finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a big, fluffy off-white/yellowish head. Decent lacing. Hoppy aroma with a cereal touch. Slightly tart. Sweetish, hoppy flavour with a touch of citrus and pine. Has a sort of stale feeling to it, but without actually being stale. Bitter hop finish with a lingering dryness. Pretty decent. 16.07.11.

I wondered for ages when I was going to get to try this iconic beer. Pours golden amber with a large fluffy white had and quite a distinct malty fruitiness to the beer. Quite a pleasant aroma that I see comes from a warm fermentation with lager yeast. Theres prominent carbonation to the mouthfeel that is initially quite overt and then bubbles along on the palate for quite a while. Theres an almost gooseberry tang and then fruit leather and bitterness. Intriguing. Theres quite a lot going on culminating in a long tart finish. Very likeable beer.

Bottle- Pours a clear dark copper color with a nice head and some lacing.
 Aroma is a pleasant roasted malt with traces of sice and citrus mixed in.
 Nice mild malt flavor with a sort of earthiness. A bit of sweetness and herbs seem to round it out. Just a touch of bitterness and a dry finish.
Fairly medium body, crisp and clean. Very well balanced. Smooth drinker that goes down easy. Great example of the style, an American original. This is a must try beer.
Pours amber with a medium head. Aroma is malts with a hint of hops. Flavor is malts, fruits and hops. Nice.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Creamy, grassy, caramel, malt aroma.  Amber brown colour, reasonable head. Sour grassy caramel malt flavour. Slightly sour aftertaste. Drinkable but not great.

Es riecht ein wenig wie ein Rauchbier, was meinen Geschmack nicht wirklich trifft. Der wässrige Antrunk lässt nichts gutes erwarten, der Mittelteil jedoch ist schön malzig gestaltet, auch ein fruchtiger Beigeschmack ist deutlich zu vernehmen. Der Nachgeschmack schmeckt erdig, dann hopfig, dazu kommt ein mittelbitterer Geschmack. Zu betonen ist noch die schön gestaltete Flasche....hat was. 	 
Test vom 6.11.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,11,12,10,14,11 - 11,15

Aroma is thick and intense. Lots of caramel malt and buttery. Floral as hell (hoppy) with a breadlike/yeasty follow-up. Nice, fluffy, off white head and caramel colored body. Taste followed the nose. Some hopiness up front in the taste with some malts consisting of caramel/biscuit flavors. Slight hop bitters at the end too. Pretty darn good. Like an amber.

Pours a nice light orange, with lots of bubbles and a little head. Smelled of lightly roasted malts, hops and bread, which was all refreshing. The taste was like honey, which turned to bitter hops quickly. This subtle hop twang gave off to a wheat tang that had a really filling flavor to it. Finished nice and bitter with a hint of caramel. Very nicely balanced, and pretty complex for such a light beer. As the description says, this beer truly is unique.
Satt med några vänner och drack och provsmakade en del öl. Vi kom överens om att detta var ett av de bättre. Fin och stor smak, mycket öl för både pengar och alkoholprocent.

clear amber brown liquid, pours a foamy, slightly tanned medium thick head. a malty scent with floral characters. earthy tones with leather and dough/bread, hint of vinegar and wood. the tasty is very crispy malty with a solid hoppy fruity side. the palate is surprisingly thick with a medium full hazy-feel body. carbonation is tingly and works well the bitterness. an interesting beer from anchor with solid simple characte

12oz bottle.  Filtered orange-tan, thin head.  Mellow, malty aroma, some light fruity nuances.  Medium bodied, well balanced, refreshing.  Light soapy, citrus hop tones.  Pretty much the gold standard for Steam beer, an absolute classic.

Color ramato-rubino, con una schiuma cremosa soffice e persistente, molto bella da vedere questa birra, ancor più da bere. al naso il dolce aroma del malto ha interessanti sfumature floreali. al palato è decisamente frizzante, ma non ho avuto i disturbi che accompagnano questa caratteristica, in bocca è cremosa, con un corpo discreto per lo stile, comunque ben rotonda, equilibrata, beverina, ho trovato nel berla quella soddisfazione di freschezza che da tempo cercavo in una birra.
Pretty decent beer, though i prefer the liberty of Anchor brewery.  I like the hops they use with both of those beers, though.  Drank in a bottle in Taipei, Taiwan

12oz bottle poured amber with full off white head. Aromas was pleasant a bit grassy with a hint of light malt.  Flavor was delicate slightly bitter and tasty. Body was medium full with a good dry finish. Overall good brew

Pours a dark golden orange color with a two finger frothy, pillowy white head that has excellent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap/ring. Chunks of soapy lacing left behind.

Slightly earthy aroma with floral, piny hops, sweet malt and light fruit. Hints of caramel, toffee and nut.

Medium bodied with a slight creamy texture that adds fullness to the palate. Crisp floral hop presence up front thats only faintly dry and bitter. This is countered by the sweet malt and light fruit notes. Hints of caramel, biscuit, toffee, hazelnut and apricot. Well balanced and easy to drink. There is nothing outstanding about this beer but its well crafted and sessionable.
Had this one both from tap and bottle. Yesterday had it from tap. Pretty light beer, easy to drink. Tasted a bit like caramel/toffee.

Bottle.  Pours an amber color with a decent light tan head that lasts. Aroma is of caramel malt and hops. Taste mostly of roasted malts, but is slightly sweet with a slightly bitter finish. Overall, a good sessionable brew great for the spring/summer.

A reddish copper colored brew with a thin white head.  The aroma is faint but consists of subtle malt and floral hops.  The flavor is a mix of nutty malt and jabs of hops bitterness and a light caramel finish.  Not bad, an inoffensive beer.

June 8, 2011. 4.8% abv; 355mL bottle, refrigerated, BBD: 05/12, lager glass.

Aroma of sweet malted barley with some mild citrus rinds and resinous piney hops. Clear dark orangey amber colour with large visible bubbles. A white pillowy head with decent lacing. Doesnt last too long. Bitterness is a bit overpowering with herbal, spice and citrus flavours. Hops covers much of the malt that was present. A medium body with a sappy sort of finish. Carbonation is refreshing. A little too resiny which could afford more malt-hops balance. Good, but I dont see what the big deal is.
Draught in Cafe Frape, Mestreech. Dark copper colour with medium firm creamy head. Flowery nose. Aroma is fruity, malty with harsh but weak hops.Flavour is kind of sour with hoppy finish. Excellent!

Pretty much clear, copper body and creamy head. Hoppy aroma with grass, fresh herbs, toffee candy and a little nutty. Quite distinct. Balanced and straightforward taste, slightly bitter and thin. Long aftertaste for such a mild and easily drinkable beer. Not overly fond of the nose on this but a pleasant drink. Well brewed! (33cl bottle)

Tap @ some bar in SF a couple blocks from Haight & Ashbury.  Poured a light amber.  Grassy aroma with some background malt.  Taste is cereal malt with some earthy hops.  Thinly textured.  This is essentially a fizzy yellow beer with some additional nuance.  Id prefer this over a macro lager, but not much else.
Amber beer with foamy white head and banana/ peppery aroma. Smooth mouth feel with prickly carbonation and a bitter finish. Some butterscotch and overripe fruit flavours.

Pours a clear copper color with a creamy head.  A light refreshing beer that I was surprised by.  It lacks any complex flavors but is a good beer to drink on a warm day or when its the most interesting beer on the menu.

Golden, clear, sparkling body with a white head. Pronounced aroma with caramel, flowers and citrus. Medium bitterness. Light body, lively carbonation. 

[superficial speed rating based on an itsy bitsy teeny weeny 2-4 cl sample @ Øl og mat festival, Oslo. Rated by tfredvik with a cold.]

A very strange brew.  This stuff almost smells like a rotten egg and tastes like it at times too.  I wasnt a huge fan and Im guessing it may just be the style I dont like.  Well done, I just didnt like it much.

light golden tangerine orange slight off white head. Aroma sweet malt, hops, light caramel, toffee, amber malt. Taste biscuity malt, citrus, toffee, caramel. MF medium slightly thick body. Decent brew tasty but different.

Pours a deep amber color with a thick fluffy head that sticks around forever. Smells of earthy hops, a bit of toffee, and sweet grainy malt. The taste follows the aroma. Earthy hops and sweet malt with a long lingering mild hop bitterness in the finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, crisp carbonation. I drank a lot of this beer in the mid nineties it was somewhat of a gateway beer for me. Delicious in its simplicity, yet interesting enough for my ever changing palette. Great session beer!

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2012 Lovely stuff, one of my favourites, not just because it evokes my favourite city. Lovely gold-orange colour, sizeable creamy head. Fairly sweet, yet hoppy, rather fizzy, somewhat fruity too. Very nice taste, pleasant aftertaste. Very drinkable. Mmm.

Pours clear mid-amber from the bottle. Light aroma of hops. Quite carbonated, a distinct fizz here, slightly sweet malt to start, rapidly overtaken by a fresh hoppiness, but not overpowering. Finish is dry, not overly long. A refreshing bottled beer from one of the better known US microbreweries and very pleasant indeed without being remarkable.

Anchor Steam was one of the first micros that made it into PA 25-30 years ago.  It was the first micro I ever tried with my father, so my rating may be a little higher on this one.  In fact, the only place that had this beer in PA was Park House on the Northside.  This is one beer I could drink anytime anywhere!  I usually beer a case of this stuff once a year.  The taste is well balanced with malt/hop flavor.

the original steam beer.  decent lager flavor and little aroma. light body and nice amber color.  not my favorite style or beer but i give this one respect for its one of the first microbrews and one that is still around.

Röstmalziger, delikater Geruch. Süßlicher Start. Dann sofort röstmalziger. Die Mitte hält einige aromatische Tendenzen parat, getreidig untermalt. Schokoladiger Ausklang mit leichter Bitterkeit. 
Ein schönes Bier in einer ebenso schönen Flasche.

[355ml bottle, Appellation Wines, Edinburgh] Pours crystal clear golden amber colour with decent white head. Sweet caramel malt aromas, some toffee in there as well. Faint hop trace on the nose. On tasting, the toffee malt characters come out first, before the finish is taken by hops and ends quite crisply with a nice dryness. Supremely drinkable, to think people once looked down on steam beers as being unrefined [16052011]

Bottiglia - Beer Shop - Latina (LT)
Color ambrato intenso, limpida, bella schiuma compatta e persistente con una leggerissima tonalità bruna.
Una classica, fatta molto bene, modestamente amara e non complessa a livello di aromi, ma al palato restituisce comunque ottime note di malto che restano in bocca a lungo.
orange, very light taste masked by the carbonation. long subtle finish.  Overall a refreshing beer.

Pivotéka Zlý Časy, Prága. Tükrös barnás-pirosas szín, méretes habja piszkosfehér színű és kitartó. Illata malátás és bogyós gyümölcsös. Íze lágyan malátás, kellemes karamella és piros bogyós, édes gyümölcsös ízekkel megtoldva, és valami pillecukros aromával még tovább fokozva. A komlótól a végére keserű lesz, de a cukros gyümölcsös (főként alma) édesség még hosszan érződik, tehát inkább egy édesebb sörnek mondható. Száraz, nem túl szénsavas, közepes testű ital, amiről nem igazán tudom eldönteni, hogy mi vele a bajom, valószínűleg ez a lágy test mögött húzódó cukros édesség az, ami egy idő után elkezd zavarni. Összességében azért nem rossz, de semmi különös.

12 ounce stubby bottle poured into a 10 ounce glass.  Its been years - perhaps a decade even - since I last had the famous Anchor Steam Beer.  Pouring it again, for the first time, and Im struck by the loads upon loads of carbonation in the brew.  The bubbles just go on for days.  Upon further inspection, this beer is brilliantly clear, as you can easily read the label from behind the glass.  A big frothy head bursts to the top of the brew, but recedes just as quickly.  Color is darker than gold but not quite amber, settling in at a rusty orange.  Smells of a light grain, almost like a pilsner.  First taste is sweet, almost fruity, with a very sweet malt finish.  This - this is not like I remember at all!  Moderate bitterness in the finish, but not overpowering at all.  Slightly sticky and relatively thick mouth feel, though the heavy carbonation helps to scrub the taste off your tongue as you drink it.  As you continue to taste the malt becomes more and more pronounced, and it works in context with the yeast profile to create almost a jam and bread flavor.  An underrated gem.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2015 Aroma is minerally, light malt, fruit apple pear. Appearance is clear copper with small light tan head. Taste is caramel malt with some apple and butter. Solid hop bitterness but not much aroma. Hint of roast. Palate is medium light and very crisp. Overall not bad. Not my favorite style but still enjoyable.
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Amber color with nice thick white head. Aroma, fruity, caramel, spices. Taste, refreshing fruity, hints of caramel nice long bitter finish. Nice beer.

Tasted 5-12-2011 from bottle at home.
Aroma:  Sweet, sugary malt, apple fruit
Appearance:  Lovely darker copper color with off-white head and decent head retention.  Best characteristic.
Taste:  I got big sugar throughout this beer.  Tastes like it has a bunch of left over unfermented sugars.  Maybe thats the style?  After the apple sugar I got a slightly tart, mildly skunky finish.  Also on the finish was a hop note similar to lime citrus.  Very mildly bitter.
Palate:  Flabby.  Not overly effervescent or luxurious just sugary full.
Overall:  Wish it was dried-out with more fermentables or offset with bittering agents.  As it is I think its closer to apple juice than beer.  But it was a fairly tasty glass of apple juice.
Pours a copper color; clear with a white frothy head. Not much hop aroma; more malt some aromas of apple.  Malty with hop accents; a good session beer.

bottle,light lager hoppy aroma, golden, clear, white stable foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, nice taste...the lager and ale flavours are fighting in my mouth medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, nice beer...my 1st from california common style
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: (12oz bottle).  Pours clear copper with big off-white head.  Nice carbonation. Aroma has caramel, some lager yeast, and florals.  Taste is bitter with some sweet caramel malt. Thin bodied with creamy texture.  Bitter finish.  This way MY gateway beer into craftbeer.  While I dont enjoy it as much as I used to its still a great beer in my eyes.

2 May 2011, bottle. light orange, clear, steady bubble and slight frothy head. nose like an amber ale; slightly nutty, malty w/ hint of alcohol and bitter grassy hops. thin and very fizzy. rich, creamy malt sweetness w/ a significant bitter, almost lager hop flavour. still has an amber ale flavour to it, which im not a fan of. ok. like a blend b/w an ale and a lager.
Poured a light amber body with a small fizzy head. Definitely a hoppy aroma, along with some herbs. Initially sweet, with a bitter finish. Light to medium bodied and refreshing.

Ive held a love affair with Anchor Steam for years now, even back in my pre-beer geek days.  I never really cared about its history, or the novelty of drinking craft-brewed beer amongst Budchuggers; no, I honestly thought Anchor Steam tasted amazing, a beautiful mix of lager-inspired fruity yeasts and malt, with a firm bitter finish that would make my friends wince.
