I cant believe people have rated this so highly. Nothing worth drinking here. No distinguishing good taste.
Great bottle.  Refreshing, fruity, hoppy.  A little too non-dememo  for me, but a solid drink.  Glad I tried it.
This stuff was way too hoppy for my tastes. It looks good, but its just not my style.
Michael Jackson puts this in list of the Top 10 American Beers.  Its a decent, hoppy West Coast example of a well-brewed craft micro.
I dig this beer. Its not overly hopped and has nice balance leaning towards the malts. When I need a lighter style and refreshing beer - I go for this brew.
Rich, malty-sweet, but also bitter brew.Full head, amber color. Very well made. Great balance of flavors from one of the originals.
Malty, caramel aroma, auburn, big toffee head. Malt flavour with good bitterness. Sweet, smooth and creamy. Very pleasant drink.

I had this off the tap at dinner tonight. Not bad, considering that Im not generally a fan of amber beers. It was fizzier than I like, but the nutty taste and finish were okay. Rather overpriced, though.  Comment 4/28/02: Had a bottle of it tonight at a wedding banquet. Im not changing any of the scores, but the bottled version seemed different, almost as if it were a darker beer than what I previously got from the tap. I think I actually liked it a bit better from the bottle.
Strong yeasty aroma with a thin and quickly dissapating head.  Very carbonated and sharp flavor.  Pleasent but not something I would buy again.
Nice beer! Especially on tap!
quality brew nuthin fancy but always tasty
Overall a nice drinking beer, nicely balanced, floral aroma,good crisp taste, nothing spectular, but very solid
sickly sweet aroma.brownish watery color. the flavor is nice, but the finish is seriously over balance sweet and sour motif.
Sweet brew from a sweet city.

On tap, this beer is a reliable, very drinkable brew. Nicely balanced w. hoppiness being slightly dominant. Golden color, floral aroma, refreshing with just a touch of sourness, lurking in the backgound. Decent in the bottle but draft is best.
A not too bad beer.  A bit thin for my taste.  A presence of malt, and a little alcohol.

Stumbled upon this beer by accident, a good suprise. A smooth tasty beer that I would have again.Re-rate 5/24/02 Very malty aroma, dark dark a orange appearance. Lacey white head that lasted. Palate is watery and malty. Middle is smooth, and it finishes smooth, dry, and malty. I feel exactly the same what about this brew as I did before.
Good solid American brew.  Very rich head that lasts longer than expected.  Nice taste (nothing surprising just solid).  Much better than the porter.
Amber in colour with a floral, fruity aroma.  Has a really dry finish to it.  Average.

Re-Rate 05/18/02: Clear amber color, nice beige head and decent lace. Nose is malt, slightly floral, front is malt, the top light, the finish is crisp, slightly dry, fair hop bite, and a very drinkable beer, unfortunately I sample only rarely?
An awesome brew.Creamy and rich with complex flavors.Its perfectly hopped and just a great sipping beer.

Complex , pleasant and not to heavy aroma , that remninds me gardens of my great-granpa ...
Decent look but not above average . Taste as good as it smells . Creamy , so refreshing , good balance of hops and other ingredients .
Always a good safety beer,not overpowering on any account,but satifying and refreshing.

I shared the soda keg with funk and I could NOT believe how good it was.  It is floral and hoppy with almost a banana-like finish to it that makes it unreal.  It will also fuck you up beyond belief if you split a soda keg of it.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2003 After trying so many other beers from so many other styles, I have to knock this one down a few notches. Still a "sentimental" favorite, it just can not match the complexity of the Belgian Ales I've come to know and love!

One of my all time favorites. This is a must with clam chowder in a sourdough bowl at pier 39 in San Francisco! Being from the Bay Area, it's a great taste of home to have this when far away.

A good beer, but one of the more overrated ones.  Decent aroma and flavor, with malt barely outshining hops.  Nice amber body with good head.  As between the flagships of the two big Cali micros, give me Sierra every time.

Let me say from the outset that this is a GOOD beer.  But it disappointed me a bit, probably because I recently tried Anchors magnificent Liberty Ale.  The first mouthful of this - and the second, third, and fourth - shouted CARAMEL.  That perfectly normal in an amber/dark beer, but its too prominent here.  Nose is quite floral (Cascade?)
Still, if all mainstream American beer was like this, wed live in a better world.  This is, absolutely, a real beer.  Just not as good as Id hoped it would be.
A nice, easy drinking beer.  Thought id give it a go as the description made it sound so unique.  Quite highly carbonated, and light in colour.  Was ok.
I wasent very impressed , on bottle it said it had a head???? where is it?
I find this quite nice on a Sunday Afternoon watching football. Very nice taste. Great for Bottled beer.
this is a GREAT beer.

I agree with Bruce, I coulda thought it was a budweiser except for the finish.  Too fizzy, and that does it for complaints except for overpriced, not a bad beer, but not a good beer.  I did like the bottle it came in.  Would not buy again.

Very disapointed with this beer for what it costs. Tasted like a hoppy budweiser. It was just totally lacking in flavor and imagination. I was almost in disbelief that a beer this average could be so overhyped and overpriced.

Im not a big lager fan, but after reading about how this beer was made to gain some ale qualities, I was impressed. Much more complexity than a typical lager. It was not too much bitterness. Id like to try some other beers in the style to see if its really a good style.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2003 Pretty nice beer.  A little too much fizz for me though.  Nice coloring and head though.  Not my favorite, but I'd buy another six pack.  Update:  I had the distinct pleasure of trying this beer again on tap in San Francisco.  The head was most glorious in the pitcher and the flavors and aroma's much more prominent.  Better on draft.
Nice mild flavor and finish.  Very well balanced and pleasant.
Smooth and balanced with the right amount of hops.  Refreshing, I enjoyed this one.  Good overall flavor that went well with the day.

I have a penchant for hops, and this beer both teases and satisfies me.  I really enjoy it, but I can take it for granted, since the flavor and palate are both so smooth and balanced.  Its an inviting and accessible beer that seems to work for just about everybody, and its quality and consistency seem virtually unrivaled.

A beautiful looking and smelling beer.  The flavour doesnt quite stand up to that initial expectation, but its quite good.  Ive only had it bottled, but I enjoy it very much especially with bar food as the hops really cut through.

This is a good beer.  I am only able to find it at two places in my area.  I really want to try the Foghorn Ale though.  Overall, this was a plesant beer, and went well with dinner.*update-  After trying these a bit more, I am begining to find the Anchor beers to have a bit to much of a hops bite to them.  They are supposed to be that way, but I like a smoother tasting beer with less hoppy bite.
very good beer,very fresh,nice head,somewhat heavy after a few.
i had this one a long time ago, but i remember good things.

Ale or Lager? Lager or Ale? Whatever it is, Ill have another one. 

Malty, with agressive hop finish

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2003 To me, the aroma says it all. And then when you get into it, a malty grainy palate that sort of melts on the tongue. Smooth dryish finish. Take it out of the frig a few minutes before enjoying this classic. It's a keeper!
A very floral beer with a good dosing of malt chewiness. A great drinking beer but far too expensive for what it is.
Great hop taste and aroma, with a strange finish. Worth trying.
I liked this beer.  Good floral hop tones without being bitter.  Very smooth.  Not overly flavourful, but enjoyable.
Overall, a decent beer, it has some interesting flavors, a definate wheat and floral presence.

One of my favorites.  My first micro, tried first around 1980.  Beautiful appearance, burnt yellow-orange color with a great head.  Has a unique taste that is not available in any other beer.  Tastes completely different on tap though, and I do not really like it draft.
its an o.k. amber.  crisp, drinkable, but not my favorite.
Nice aroma and o.k. in the hop department. Its a rather bland looking color with little to no  head (absolutley no retention) but theres nothing offensive about it. O.K. in my book.

Being in Alaska and trying Anchor Steam for the first time in years could effect my judgement, but I love this beer. It had great color and clarity along with a smooth but bity aftertaste. Overall it was very enjoyable experience again.
Disappointing.  Not bad for generic tasting beer, Slight chemical taste.  Pretty mediocre, though smooth.
Kind of a touchstone of the microbrew movement in the US. I think everyone is at least a little bit familiar with the beer, so no need to describe it. I like it.
Full-bodied taste. Beautiful appearance. Nicely hopped.
Good - nothing spectacular, pretty average taste.  I dont care for the short bottle.
Anchor Steam is a quality beer , incredibly smooth with a great taste. Slightly expensive, but the quality of this beer makes it worth the buy.
Smooth and light though lacking in flavor.
Had heard mixed reviews on this one.  Myself, I was very impressed.  A sweetness and a hoppiness that is hard to achieve in cooperation with one another.
Never really liked this one that much.
Great beer, great flavor!  Decent head, good color.  If Im lucky I can get this at a baseball game.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2003 Call me weird, but I think this is a really good beer for the six-pack crowd. Reminds me a bit of Creemore, only more palatable. A bit too carbonated maybe, but a great, crispy flavour, especially for a West coast brew.
Nothing really impressive.  Looks beautiful.  But lacks any real character for the price.
Tastes like a bitter Budweiser. I had heard great things about this beer but was very much let down when I finally drank one.

When I first had this stuff I couldnt see what all of the fuss was about. (One of the first of the Micro-wave here in Ohio) But eventually i found myself still drinking it. A bit bitter, but a tasty brew. A beer that most around here gave up on a long time ago and I still buy on occasion.
Short-lived head and average color. Crisp and not overly bitter, but not much to the finish. Slightly better-than-ordinary overall.
It´s OK, strange aroma but nice.

ok i guess.

needs a little bit more of a kick
Fruity aroma. Strong malty character. Plenty of bitterness and hop character.

brassy color on the red side of orange (pantone 1595)and  clear.  aroma of generous maltiness and the very faintest reminder of grand marnier liquer; like a marzen i think.  complex flavor, (which just means that i cant figure it out) clean tasting, says the commercial discription, meaning you cant taste dirt or toxic waste; gee, thats no help. fortunately, its not clean like a hospital floor but rather has rich, ginger-like spiciness and a bitter finish. hooray for fritz maytag (the owner), makes you want to go out and buy a dishwasher.
THE BEST BEER EVER!!!  Buy some NOW...  you will not regret it!!!
Good if oyu like budweiser, I dont.
Meh...sorta bitter, strange sent, bought it because I read the 1899 novel, McTeague who drinks steam beer. What the hell is steam beer?!?

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 Rerate: tap and bottled. Bit citrussy hop, slight sulphury. Medium bitter in taste. Decent refreshing brew. The sulphury keller notes give it some extra dimension.
Funny original rating from 2002: How can this stuff score over 3.0? All those english/american standards are really heavily overrated. Sample some belgian brews, and you know what real beer tastes like.
A very good brew.
Really good stuff, this really is a classic beer and perhaps an American style.  I think I need a Steam.
Very tasty, nice balance of flavors.
Very sweet.  Will buy again.

This was a swell beer. Had the color of kerosene, but flavor is what we should be after essentially. Very clean, crisp, right amount of head and carbonation. Good beer, left a bitter aftertaste that was soon replaced with the impression of almonds in your face portal. Not bad at all.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2004 This is a great, underrated beer. It has a light lagery feel but with a burst of sweet banana and fruity flavors. It doesn't exude flavor like many "top beers," but it is well balanced and easy to drink with food. ( Rerate but numbers stay the same).
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2007 [bottled] Copper colour. Thick head, doesnt stay long though. Sweet toffee aroma with notes of hops. Hoppy bitter almond flavour. Thin body.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2012 Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is light to medium amber.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (grain/cereal, husks, caramel), lightly hoppy (apricot), with notes of butter, decaying fruit.

Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter, unclean, husky.

Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Wow, this has gone from ok to below average to terrible over the years.  Diacetyl, horrible malt character, and a disgusting aftertaste, both dirty and very husky.  Truly repulsive.  How do people still drink this at all?!
The style says california Common but it definetly doesnt taste common. This is a beer which is refreshing and still keeps its hoppy aroma. very well finished. Go for it.
My wife got this for me in San Francisco before we were married.  I thought it was alright and is definitely better than their Porter or Christmas brew.

This is a re-rate.  I had it on tap and it was an entirely different experience from the bottle.  Nice malt and hop balance, with hops getting the edge in the finish.  Not a beer I could put down alot of, but it went well with the pizza I was eating.
A solid beer with a crispness and relatively smooth, albeit somewhat hoppy finish.
Fruity cascade hop aroma.  Strong malty body with a bitter, fruity, hoppy taste.  Good session beer.

You can taste the effort of combining ale complexity with lager smoothness.  It doesnt succeed on all fronts but this is still good beer.  Sharp, hoppy taste with slightly fruity flavoring.  It does leave a bit of a bad aftertaste.
Looks good...drinks somewhat less. Not real easy going down with a somewhat bitter aftertaste. Overall, definitely average.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2003 Re-Rate.  Original rating 3.7. I've been wanting to re-rate Anchor Steam for a couple months now.  My friend came out from San Francisco and brought me a few 22 ounce "bombers" of the Steam.   The beers were really fresh and it compelled me to re-rate.  This beer is full of flavor and has a slight bitterness in the aftertaste.   Good almost anytime of the year, and best when on draft.
It was pretty good, not what i expected, nice bitterness, but had an edgy taste, could have been a bit more well rounded, but it was still pleasant.

Wonderfully balanced beer.  The color just says drink me.  The flavor is slightly fruity, with a modest amount of hops. Clean mouth feel - goes down well with a nice finish.  Goes well with pizza, burgers, pub food and just about anything, but this brew has enough umpf to stand alone as a good drinking beer.
Too filling. Pleasant hops, indeed. Can sometimes be just too watery or lacking in flavor. I seem to stumble onto ths stuff in varying degrees of taste & freshness. Only a hair above average.
its up thier with some of the better beers.
liked the orange-amber colour, but compared to the Liberty ale this is thin and lacking in flavour.

i decided to try this again and rerate. not that much different really...has a pleasant taste, but there is really nothing distinct about it. i take a drink and try to discern flavors, but still i dont get much.
Godd beer with rich flavors.  if you ever have a chance to try their Christmas Ale it is really fantastic.
Malty and balanced in taste, auburn in color. One of the better American beers.
Stumbled upon this beer by accident, and I glad. A very smooth tasty beer, that is good for a special occasion.
Ahh, good old Steam.  one of my favorites.  Best on tap.
Not a bad combonation with most foods.  This is not a good as I was lead to believe, but definately not bad.
SuperBudweiser. Smoother. Similar hoppy ending. A bit carbonated, with a dry finish. Could this be my new standard for your average domestic beer?

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2006 22oz bottle:  Clear orange with a thin white head, light caramel aroma with some grass, starts and ends lightly bitter, medium bodied but full for the style, solid carbonation.  The lawnmower beer.

Brownish amber, good granular head that fades to thin white bubbles.  Picks up an additional appearance point for packaging.  Flavor improves as some of the carbonation is relieved-- hoppy, grainy with some underlying malt sweetness.  Palate is average consistancy, fizzy, trails bitter. I didnt think that I was going to like it but I did.

A classic to be sure, but one now far outclassed by the myriad of micros that it made possible.  Slightly corse hop flavor is mild and lager character is noticable.  A brilliant alternative to Budmilcoors, but a fading memory of the micro revolution.
This is an ordinary, middle of the road brew - nice maltiness with slight hops.  Enjoyable and drinkable, but I prefer their Liberty Ale.
Very Good.
A nice balance of everything, somewhat bitter, but smooth and very easy to drink
Not a good session brew as the fruitiness (green apples) just takes over and demands your attention. Nicely balanced with a thick malty body and aromatic hops. Good sip and savor brew.
I felt that, for the price, this was a pretty average beer.
Not a bad brew, I had my first last night.  Crisp hops, malty goodness.
I just dont really enjoy this. A full body with some crisp sharpness but just not real good.
A bland brew despite its dignified position in the history of beer. It doesnt really send me.

An American classic. Anchor set the standard for craft beers and Steam remains a favorite of mine. Nice body good malty body and floral hops finish. This would be a terriffic everyday beer if it werent so expensive. Not that it isnt worth the price but its tough to pay almost eight bucks for a six-pack of beer every time. I ususally buy it in bars or when I have some extra bucks in my pocket. There are lots of great beers available for $5.99 per 6-pack so its getting tougher to justify the higher cost of Anchor Steam.
Good Hearty flavor.
i had a soda keg of this one weekend and my god was it good.
red-amber colour, head quickly disappears, slightly fruity, full-bodied with some bitterness in the finish, lack of character - nothing special
Really bitter. Easy to drink beer. Very clean aftertaste.
Great tasting beer, from a brewery with a great story behind it.
slight taste of clorine, cloudyness caused by the shallow frementing, fitz did a great thing for microbrews made them what they are today

Really really good beer.  Just having one reminds me of winter nights spent in North Beach San Francisco watching the fog roll in as I walked unsteadily out of Specs and through the tight dirty alleys of Chinatown.  It has character.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2010 There is something about this beer which keeps me coming back.  The fine balance between a lager and ale.  The simplicity of the Northern Brewer hops sitting on the firm malt base. A beer to drink on a rainy day.
Nice Hoppy flavour, the bitterness is just right
UPDATED: APR 1, 2005 A decent all-around beer with a little hoppiness and OK mouthfeel, best served ice cold.
Deep red-amber.  Mild nose.  Rich and a little malty.  Smooth going down.  Entriely drinkable!
This was a very harsh tasting brew.  It was very bitter tasting with too much hoppiness.  It was strong and I was unimpressed.
Straw colored beer with a white head. nice floral aroma. Nice hoppy flavor. Yum!
good for the price.
A bit thin. Decent but not great.
Nice, drinkable beer that feels lighter than it really is.
As delectable as the city it comes from.  I was just stranded in SF as a result of the tragedies and it cerainly helped cope.
Great flavor - good bitterness, nice  clean. Very slight astringency at finish but no lingering aftertaste.   Go out & get some!
Not that this is a bad beer - but this brewerys other products make a high standard to match.
This beer was great until near the end.  It tasted like baking soda.

Good beer.  Very filling and long lasting aroma.  I can see why this is a classic.  Much like Bass or Harp in that I think it would be a good beginning beer for those used to the three stooges (Bud, Miller, and Coors).  A question though, if you had to nail it down as either a lager or an ale, wouldnt it be a lager since lager yeast is used?

A quality beer that lacks the palability and drinkability of Sierra for me. Ive found much variance which may add to my reticence and appreciation. After visiting the brewery, its obvious Liberty Ale is their best beer.
One of our best in CA. Virtually unmatched in its style.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2003 This was a great beer. I robust solid flavor that showed no signs of weakness. Another great beer from a great brewing company.
Very clean beer.  I tried a copy of this as a homebrew project.  I am nowhere close.  This stuff is great & extremely well made.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 RE-RATE.   Poured from bottle.  Toasty malt aroma.  Good lookin clear Amber with solid head.  Tasting caramel malt, dried fruit, citrus hops and pepper.  Dry feel complements sweet flavors.  One of the first beers I ever rated.  Still holds strong even in todays market.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
the trademark steam beer.  
enjoyable but not very exciting.  
personally i find it an excellent companion beer with pizza but rarely drink it otherwise
Comes on strong with an interesting metallic flavour that somehow catches my fancy.

The classic (and only, per the trademark) Steam Beer. A unique combination of ale and lager, this beer hits you with a solid American hop bite, but tickles the sides of your mouth with a maltyu sweetness. Slightly too aggressive out of the bottle, but nicely calibrated on tap. Enjoy.
One of the few beers I will pay premium for here in the North East. Very rich, defined flavor that is not overpowering. Quite smooth.
A rich, tasty, creamy head....  over a light, tasty beer.  A great beer for all occaisions, for all people.  Not too heavy, not too hoppy, yet substantial enough for anyone.
Anchor Steam is more drinkable than many American beers, but the aroma didnt do much for me.
Steam a long way from this one.
A very American beer. Unique and refreshing. The carmel maltiness is TREMENDOUS and you can always count on Anchor Steam to quinch your thurst.
Simply the best

Hype or not, I discovered this very special beer during my first visit to the Bay Area in 1977 and retasted it when I visited San Francisco last year. Of all the non-specialist brands that you can buy in the shop around the corner certainly the most drinkable. Unfortunately, we cant get it in Denmark yet; you have to go to Sweden (of all places!) to get your supply.
good beer....but...
Second micro brew I ever had (1980). Awesome fresh, on tap from one of the finest breweries in the world.
This is very simply a delicious, drinkable beer.
Well, I cant say I hate it because it doesnt taste like anything. Great to pound if youre trying to get drunk I guess, good body and very smooth, but severely lacking in the flavor department.
UPDATED: JUN 27, 2006 Kind of blah. Some nice fruity notes, but mostly a very light malty flavor with just a touch of bitterness.
Good crisp beer but nothing special.
I wish I could say I liked this because it took me a long time to find some of it. the wait wasnt worth the want.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2007 Wish I could say I loved this, mostly out of nostalgias sake--I DID love it when I was first getting into beer 15 years ago, when I couldnt even dream of buying the big Belgians or Sam Smiths.  Its a good beer, but that aftertaste...really too bitter for a lager.  Looking forward to trying the Porter after a long absence, though.
A little too dry and bitter for my taste.  Looked pretty, though, and smelled great, which was why I was a little suprised that the overwhelming taste was hops.  Not bad.

Overall I assume this is a good beer, however the lot I tried was a bit on the bitter side, which, I hope, is not how this beer is supposed to taste, I will have to try again to be sure. Looks very nice and smells excellent. When transfered from bottle to a glass some of the bitterness goes away, amazingly, and it is quite good.
A very solid american ale.  Good balance of Malt & Hops.  Great color.
UPDATED: SEP 13, 2004 Transcends lager and ale styles, hoppy, malty, fruity, dry. A must try.

Excellent.  Nice mouthfeel.  Delicious golden head with just the right amount of hop and malt balance.  Nice golden color. One of the best starter beers for a novice beer drinker who wants to get into the better stuff. Not too demanding.
clean in, bitter down, great aroma, way too expensive

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2003 Mildly hazy golden color with a white head.  It has a unique spicy taste, solid malt flavor and a decent mouthfeel.  The only reason I don"t drink it more often is the hefty price and the fact that my favorite local watering hole quit buying it (an outrage!!).
Not a big fan.  Bitter finish, not a lot in the way of taste.
Good, but not great.
Lager smooth and ale fruity, this is of course a classic of American brewing.  Remarkably dry finish.  Whats with Fritz Maytag copyrighting the term steam beer though?
Smells a little better than it tastes, but overall its not a bad beer.
Smooth like a lager, hop flavour lika an APA.  Excellent.
Im not a fan where a flavor just overrides a beer. I guess this is hoppy. It was ok, but I probably wouldnt order another one unless I was just curious.
A beer Ive had time and again.  Always a nice experience.  Lager-like ale, what more is there?
Weird flavor. Not quite hops, not quite malt, not citrusy.  I really dont know what it was. But it wasnt too bad and it went down ok.
Its OK.  A little sweet by my standards.  Absurdly expensive considering the fact that its nothing terribly special.

I gotta be blunt here - I just dont get it.  Here you have an amber ale with a hard body, respectable malt profile and dry finish.  Ok, its a decent beer, has some flavour and complexity, but it enjoys an absurdly good reputation. Its just not that special I dont think.
Full of flavor and character with just the right amount of everything. An everyday beer with alot of substance.
To me this is a very good middle of the road beer.   Nothing stand outs and nothing detracts from it.
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2004 Interesting beer.   Defined bitterness, very unique flavor.  Something that all beer lovers must try at least once.  I don't see what the hype is about though.

Not what I expected – starts out crisp and hoppy then becomes very bland, on the verge of souring.  Too bubbly overall  - not the worst and surely better than some, but not a top pick – I’ll stick with the porter.
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Florida, USA

text: mmm mmm good
At first I wasnt too crazy about the aftertaste, but it never lingered too long because I kept taking another drink. Very drinkable and light enough you can drink several without getting filled up.

A hybrid ale/lager. Is actually a lager yeast fermented at the low end of ale temperature range. The carmel malt dominates the nose with some restrained hops. Very clean taste well balanced with the malt and Northern Brewer hops. Not an outstanding brew, but still well done and classy. Fritz always does a great job.
Though not something I would choose to drink all the time, it is an interesting beer. I mean how do you describe it other than a lagery ale or aley lager? That really is what it tastes like.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2003 Interesting and unique beer - difficult
to judge.  Mild tasting, with a moderate
hop presence.  It really does, in some ways,
have char's of both a lager and ale.
Thanks to the new hop guide, I can say that I don't like Northern Brewer hops as a finish/aromatic hop.  The hop aromatics and flavors in this beer present as a slightly woody and earthy/musty note that I don't find particularly agreeable.  Bitter finish is a bit strong for this light bodied beer.

The fact that its a lager yeast brewed at ale temperatures is kind of neat, however, its not as clean as a lager and not as flavorful as an ale.  If you havent had it, I recommend giving it a try though.  Its one of those things to experience.
